title: Calcaneus 2017 Ginestra Bianco  (Etna)
description: Subtle scents of Spanish broom and yellow stone fruit slowly take shape. On the palate, fresh acidity lifts mature yellow apple and lemon zest, while a salty note marks the close.

title: Casca Wines 2013 Monte Cascas Altitude Sparkling (Távora-Varosa)
description: This lightly spicy and definitely perfumed wine comes from high-altitude vines planted in an area just south of the Douro and known for its sparkling wines. It is so crisp, bright and fruity with delicious acidity and a fine sweep of freshness at the end. Drink now.

title: Ceste 2015  Barbaresco
description: Aromas of baking spice, tilled soil and ripe dark-skinned fruit lead the nose. The taut palate offers sour cherry, clove and tobacco alongside chewy tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Chateau Lafayette Reneau 2016 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Steely lime, fresh apple and white flower aromas start off this semidry offering. A juicy orchard fruit flavor starts off the palate, with astringent green pear rind and lime coming in midway. The finish is brisk and clean.

title: Château Moncontour 2017 Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Lightly honeyed and with white fruits, almonds and a touch of minerality, this wine is already delicious. Its freshness and crisp texture are both young and the wine will age. Drink at its best from 2020.

title: Château Tanunda 2015 100 Year Old Vines Shiraz (Barossa)
description: Notes of plush berry fruit, vanilla and cherry cola are followed by a palate that feels a little hot from the alcohol and is almost syrupy in texture, with grainy tannins and prominent oak throughout. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Collier Creek 2017 Crafty Fox Merlot (Lodi)
description: Red cherry aromas and a creamy texture highlight this medium-bodied, well-priced and certified sustainable wine. It has good concentration to keep your interest and very smooth tannins for easy drinking.

title: D. Massin NV Cuvée de Réserve Brut  (Champagne)
description: A blend of 75% Pinot Noir and 25% Chardonnay, this is a rich wine. Ripe apple flavors are up front, with gentle acidity to balance. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Dante Robere 2015 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Strong woody aromas like cedar, oak and wood smoke are carried through in the flavors of this big and firmly tannic wine. Oak and baking-spice notes dominate the taste while the full body fills the mouth and releases blueberry and blackberry on the finish.

title: Domaine de Bel Air 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: A smoothly textured wine, this is soft and full of ripe white fruits. Its acidity and grassy character are controlled by the wine's richness. Balanced and finishing with crisp acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Domaine de la Pinsonnière NV Brut  (Vouvray)
description: This honey- and apple-flavored wine is deliciously fresh. With a hint of almonds as well as the fruit, it is perfumed and ready to drink.

title: Domaine du Vieux Bourg NV Jean-Marie et Noël Girard Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: An attractive blend of Cabernet Franc and Chenin Blanc, this wine is fruity, with touches of almonds. It is perfumed, rounded and softly textured, showing flavors of ripe apples as well as crisper citrus. Drink now.

title: Domaine Gibault 2016 Emotion Red (Touraine)
description: This is a rich blend of Malbec (known locally as Cot) and Cabernet France. It has a dense, ripe black-fruit-flavored character that is concentrated and just maturing. A touch of spice goes with the blackberry flavors that finish with good acidity. Drink now.

title: Domaine Paul Thomas 2017 Chavignol Rosé (Sancerre)
description: Ripe red fruits are cut with acidity smoothed by a touch of caramel in this balanced wine. It is fresh while also rich, taut and fruity. Drink now.

title: Domaine Philippe Raimbault 2017 Les Godons  (Sancerre)
description: This bottling shows a full, fat style of Sauvignon Blanc, although the wine hasn't lost all its freshness and has kept some citrus flavors. Its richness reflects the warm vintage, ripe and full in the mouth. Drink from 2019.

title: Draxton 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Polished and generous tannins wrap around elusive fruit and more up-front notions of clove and forest in this older vintage wine. Underlying succulence saves it from tasting too broadly flat or undefined.

title: Draxton 2017 Rosé of Pinot Meunier (Napa Valley)
description: Tasting like a cherry-orange Creamsicle, this wine from an unusual variety is pleasing in freshness and lighthearted body weight, an easygoing quaff that many will enjoy.

title: Enrico Serafino 2015  Barbaresco
description: Subdued aromas of dark fruit, coconut and baking spice slowly emerge from the glass. The firm palate delivers black plum, mocha and vanilla alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2020.

title: Flanagan 2014 The Beauty of Three Red (Bennett Valley)
description: A proprietary blending of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon with 15% Syrah and 5% Merlot, this is a big-boned, considerably ripe expression of blackberry, black currant and soy with a soft rounded structure and finish of cocoa powder.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Les Deux Cailloux  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: There are plenty of cailloux (stones) in Pouilly Fumé and this wine shows the steel and minerality that results from this soil. Very crisp while also with a richer element, this wine needs to age further. Drink from 2019.

title: Tenuta di Fessina 2017 Erse Rosato (Etna)
description: Grilled herb, Mediterranean scrub, brimstone and wild berry aromas march to the forefront. Fresh and savory, the medium-bodied palate offers wild raspberry, crushed strawberry, white pepper and dried aromatic herb set against tangy acidity.

title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2016 Pinot Meunier (Dundee Hills)
description: Most often found in sparkling wines, here the grape is given a chance to show its stuff as a full-blown still red. It's tart and chewy, with chunky fruit flavors of cranberry and cherry. More tannic and darker than its cousin Pinot Noir, this finishes with citrusy acidity.

title: Trisaetum 2016 Coast Range Estate Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: From a cool site set on sedimentary and volcanic soils, this sets a sleek, supple tone throughout the palate. It deftly mixes in strata of earth and herb under black cherry fruit. Tannins are polished and firm. It's drinking well already, but seems likely to improve further with additional bottle aging.

title: Via Romano 2015 Barbera (El Dorado County)
description: This is a really well-made, flavorful and nicely balanced wine from a new winery that's doing exciting things. It's full bodied, moderately tannic and moderately acidic which is typical of the varietal, but backed by wonderful ripe black-cherry, black-olive and black-pepper flavors.

title: Wolff 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A pale shade of pink in the glass, this Grenache-based rosé is excellent, starting with soft aromas of bubblegum and pink lemonade. The palate is zesty, fresh and framed by persistent acid, with tangy raspberry, plum-skin and tight pomegranate flavors captured in a taut texture.

title: Pfeffingen 2016 Dry Scheurebe (Pfalz)
description: While mineral driven on first whiff, aeration reveals increasingly fragrant aromas of white blossom, pineapple and grapefruit in this wine. It's dry and intensely zesty on the palate, marked by a tropical lychee note and a refreshing herbal undertone. A light-bodied, invigorating sip to enjoy now–2023.

title: Calcaneus 2017 Romice delle Sciare Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Don't let the light salmon color fool you: This savory rosato is chock-full of flavor and brightness, opening with aromas of grilled herb, wildflower, red berry and a whiff of sea breeze. On the tangy palate, juicy acidity accompanies ripe cherry, tangerine zest, strawberry and graphite along with a hint of bread dough. White pepper and a salty note linger on the finish.

title: Ampelos 2015 Ampelos Vineyard Syrache Syrah-Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blends 70% Syrah and 30% Grenache from the estate site. The wine is bright and fresh on the nose, a whiff of peppery meat and earthy leather arriving first. The midplate takes on more ripe concentration in brambly blackberry and strawberry.

title: Beacon Hill 2016 La Sierra Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This supple, sexy wine is ready, set, go for immediate enjoyment. Pretty cherry and chocolate flavors round out the middle, with sweet spices all the way through a most pleasurable finish. All Pommard clone, it was aged 18 months in 30% new French oak.

title: Belden Barns 2016 Serendipity Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: From what the producer considers its best pocket of vineyard, planted to multiple clones, this is a beautifully expressive wine, well-integrated and delicately layered, with a flowing, silky texture. The flavors delve into raspberry, strawberry and black tea, humming along to an earthy finish.

title: Ben Haines 2016 B Minor Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: This is a light-bodied, delicate Pinot Noir, with bright aromas of crunchy cherry fruit, black pepper and game. These tones carry to the palate are are woven together by dusty tannins and poised acidity.

title: Bergström 2016 Gregory Ranch Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Think cherry pie fruit with a touch of pastry crust and you've got a handle on this tasty wine. The acids add citrus highlights, principally pineapple, and the tannins have a hint of green tea astringency.

title: Bernardus 2016 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Ripe but sour cherry aromas meet with purple flowers, hibiscus, subtle chaparral and a hint of juniper on the nose of this bottling. It's energetic on the palate, with earthy clay flavors playing against the background of rhubarb, red plums and orange rinds.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Kanzemer Altenberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Subtle, savory hints of saffron and crushed mineral on the nose belie the bolder tones of pink grapefruit and lime that await on the palate of this semidry Riesling. It's fresh and fruity yet has elegance and restraint. The finish is moderately long and earthy.

title: Bodegas Bilbainas 2013 Viña Pomal Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cinnamon, clove and oak-spice aromas frame notes of berries and citrus peels on the nose. A full palate feels a touch oily and creamy, while this tastes of savory, lightly salted plum and berry fruits. The saltiness carries over to a well-formed finish. Drink through 2025.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2006 Faustino I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Smooth, welcoming aromas of cola, black fruits and integrated oak are soft and indicate that this is ready to drink. A plump, sappy palate delivers ripe berry and chocolate flavors, while this is fleshy on a finish weighted down by berry pulp. Drink through 2021.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2011 Conde Valdemar Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Baked blackberry and cassis aromas are ripe to the max and come with plenty of oak-driven vanilla. On the palate, this is plump but honest, with depth and give. Baked berry flavors are enriched by oaky vanilla and coffee notes, while this is smooth and steady on the finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: With a touch of spice from well-integrated oak, this is a fresh and fruity white from a remarkable vineyard site, one of the best in the appellation. It shows balance within a context of undeniable ripeness and grip, the flavor defined in baked apple, almond and cinnamon.

title: Buehler 2015 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This is a great value for a wine of such quality, made with a handful of Petite Sirah that grows in the same field-blended site. Layered and grippy, it shows structured blackberry and mocha flavors around secondary tones of leather and earth.

title: Covila 2013 II Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Cool earth and horsey aromas are part of a nose that also contains quality berry and plum notes. A healthy palate with form and finesse generates flavors of smoky berry and chocolaty oak. Oak spice and residual acidic energy push this to its finale. Drink through 2023.

title: Montaudon NV Grande Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: Warm and soft, this ripe wine has mature fruitiness that shines through gentle texture. With a relatively high dosage, it is an easy wine to enjoy as an aperitif. Drink now.

title: Paul Buisse NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: A crisp blend of four grapes, this lively wine is dry, full of citrus flavors with a bright, clean aftertaste. The wine, just hinting at toast as well as riper yellow fruits, is ready to drink.

title: Paumanok 2017 Dry Chenin Blanc (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Restrained aromas of citrus, apple peel and limestone carry to the immensely zesty palate. Electric acidity carries from start to finish, ending on a sour lime note.

title: Poderi Elia 2014 Serracapelli  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas of espresso, coconut and vanilla. The assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean, clove and chewing tobacco set against grainy, astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Rafael Cambra 2016 Mateo Cambra  (Rioja)
description: Medicinal, rubbery berry aromas require airing to settle. In the mouth, this Rioja Garnacha is plump and round but with only medium-level concentration. A rubbery flavor is attached to plum and berry notes, while this is standard on the finish.

title: Roberto Sarotto 2015 Currà  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of ripe dark fruit, coconut and baking spice. The dense palate offers prune, espresso and star anise alongside close-grained, rather evolved tannins. You can feel the heat of evident alcohol on the finish.

title: Shingleback NV Black Bubbles Sparkling Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: After a fair amount of swirling in glass, this offers notes of plums, ripe berries and pepper spice set against an earthy backdrop. It's lightly fizzy and slightly sweetness, but is accompanied by robust, drying tannins. The fizz dissipates quickly, leaving the wine feeling flat.

title: Spicy Vines 2015 Edge Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an old field blend of Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Carignan, Cinsault and Grenache, cofermented together and aged nearly two years in French oak, a small percentage of it new. The wine is thick in muddled red fruit and possessed of a soft rich texture.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Le Grand Vin Red (Fair Play)
description: Big, oaky and already well aged, this full-bodied wine has plenty of structure filled in with spicy cedary aromas and vanilla and black-cherry flavors. Firm tannins give it a hefty mouthfeel.

title: Bianchi 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Quite shy on the nose, this bottling offers dark red fruit and sandalwood with patience. The palate is a bit flat, with basic red-fruit and wild herb flavors.

title: Bodegas Bleda 2017 Castillo de Jumilla Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Scratchy, oaky aromas of pencil eraser, wood grain, vanilla and raspberry lead to a dense thick chewy palate. Herbal, salty plum and berry flavors finish tannic, grabby and sticky.

title: Cortes de Cima 2017 Chaminé Rosé (Alentejano)
description: A fresh and crisp wine that has plenty of acidity and attractive red-currant fruits. It is a light and bright blend of Aragonez and Syrah, ready to drink now.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2015  Sancerre
description: This bottling has a bitter edge from the toasty wood that masks the red-cherry fruits and gives the wine a strongly spicy character. Drink now.

title: Landshut 2017 Pinot Grigio (Pfalz)
description: Hints of yellow apple and pear are marked by savory, earthen tones in this light-bodied Pinot Grigio. It's moderate in concentration but offers fresh acidity and a dry, easygoing palate.

title: Les Frères Couillaud 2017 Bernier Chardonnay Chardonnay (Val de Loire)
description: This soft wine offers simple apple and apricot flavors. Everything is in balance to give a gentle, smooth wine that is ready to drink.

title: MAN Family Wines NV Brut Chenin Blanc (South Africa)
description: This is pleasant and easy-drinking, with notes of fresh-cut apple, orange pith, lemon rind and a touch of talc. It's light in weight, with brisk acidity, high carbonation and tart lime, green apple and plum notes that are short but refreshing.

title: Paul Buisse 2015 Clos du Gaimont Moelleux  (Vouvray)
description: Although labeled Moelleux this wine is rather half-hearted about being sweet. It is delicious with acidity and baked-apple flavors, but misses out on intensity. Drink this wine now.

title: R. Stuart & Co. NV Rosé d'OR Sparkling (Oregon)
description: A yellowish copper shade, this forward and fruity wine seems slightly oxidized, though not necessarily to its detriment. It's loaded with Christmas cake flavors and finishes with a metallic aftertaste. Drink up.

title: Scala Dei 2016 Garnatxa (Priorat)
description: Rubbery aromas of latex and sulfur give way to jumpy red-berry and animal notes. A jammy sappy palate requires airing to show its best, while this varietal Garnatxa tastes of herbal raspberry and red plum. A rubbery grating finish fits the overall package.

title: Taliano 2011 Montersino Tera Mia Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals camphor, raisin and cooking spice. The tight palate offers prune, dark spice and mocha alongside firm drying tannins that grip the finish.

title: Ayala 2012 Le Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Produced from fruit grown on the Côte des Blancs, the heart of Chardonnay in Champagne, this wine is both richly mineral and deliciously fruity. Dry and tense, this vintage wine should be aged further. Drink from 2020.

title: Balletto 2016 Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From an estate-grown property, this is acid-driven and beautifully tart, persistent on the palate in whirls of blueberry and boysenberry. It offers the right amount of ripeness for its frame, finishing with complex structure and freshness.
designation: Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Barons de Rothschild NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This Champagne, made for the three Bordeaux winemaking branches of the Rothschild family, is beautifully mature. It has richness, toast and elegance along with hints of brighter fruitiness. Crisply textured at the end while adding acidity to the mix, it is ready to drink.

title: Benovia 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From several of the producer's estate sites, as well as the Zio Tony Ranch farmed by the Martinelli family, this wine exudes rich, velvety blue and black fruit flavors within a context of firm tannins and integrated oak. Dots of white pepper and cardamom complete the complex experience.

title: Boizel 2008 Grand Vintage Brut  (Champagne)
description: Half-and-half Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this rich wine is just approaching maturity. Touches of spice and toast contrast beautifully with ripe pear and apple flavors that are crispened with citrus acidity. Although this full wine can be drunk now, it will be best from 2019.

title: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2013  Taurasi
description: Aromas of black cooking spice, dark-skinned berry and blue flower swirl around in the glass. On the palate, firm, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity balance dried black cherry, clove and freshly ground pepper. Drink 2021–2030.

title: Domaine Brochard 2016 Le Cul de Beaujeu  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from a steep, southeast-facing vineyard close to the castle of Beaujeu. Particularly rich, it offers tropical fruits that show strongly through the acidity. There is an urgency to the texture, taut and still young. The wine proves the aging ability of fine Sancerre. Drink from 2020.

title: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2015 Clos du Château Paladi  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine comes from a small walled vineyard next to a townhouse with little towers, called locally in jest Château Paladi. Ripe with apple and lime fruits, the wine is crisply textured and balanced, with a flinty character. It is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Matthias et Emile Roblin 2016 Ammonites  (Sancerre)
description: Named after the shells that are the basis of the chalk soil of Sancerre, this wine is ripe and full. The aging in large wooden barrels has softened the shock of Sauvignon Blanc, resulting in a citrus and apple-flavored wine that is now ready to drink.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Back Yard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The overall balance and underlying minerality in this wine are a good start, indicating a wine that is built to last. There's a delicate aspect to the brambly fruit, plus hidden seams of lemon curd and salted caramel. Drink 2022–2032.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Parker West Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Ripe black cherry kicks off the nose of this bottling from the family's westernmost property, but then comes the more elegant touches of clove, chaparral and bay leaf. The palate is savory and complex, showing shiitake mushroom, sour cherry, ripe cranberry and a pinch of oregano.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2012 Feudi Studi Candriano  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, blue flower, forest floor, smoke and a whiff of cocoa come together in this wine. The velvety palate shows nice tension, delivering black cherry, blackberry, licorice and tobacco set against taut, fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. A flinty mineral note energizes the tight finish. Give this time to come around to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2024–2032.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2013 Piano di Montevergine  (Taurasi)
description: Menthol, tobacco, blackberry and dark, exotic spice aromas slowly take shape. On the firmly structured palate, tense, fine-grained tannins support black cherry, licorice and clove. It's still young and tight, so give it plenty of time to fully develop. Drink 2023–2033.

title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Oger Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This wine is one of a trilogy of individual village wines from the Côte des Blancs. It is just moving out of youth and growing up, hinting at the toastiness to come. However, it has kept its intense minerality from the chalk soil of the Côte des Blancs. Drink this structured wine from 2020.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens thick and rich, but evolves to show an underlying spark of brightness that persists through the midpalate and onto the finish. Raspberry and sage contrast against each other as a fleshy element of wild strawberry comes into play.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2014 Piocho Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very plump aromas of dark strawberry, lilacs, jasmine and a hint of gingerbread show on the nose of this blend of 33% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc, 7% Malbec and 7% Petit Verdot. The elegant palate rolls out flavors of candied raspberry, elderflower and black plum, growing more intense with acidity and tannins into the finish.

title: Joseph Mellot 2015 La Grande Châtelaine  (Sancerre)
description: Lightly and judiciously wood aged, this wine is smooth, rounded with a poised balance between its acidity and generous yellow fruits. The period of wood and then bottle aging has softened and filled out the fruit, giving the wine a ripe character. Drink now.

title: Kessler-Haak 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This study of Clone 2A begins with big aromas of boysenberry jam, black tea and minty chocolate elements. There is decent weight to the palate, where rich and ripe flavors of blackberry meet with firm tannins and buoyant acidity. Dashes of star anise and all spice give further depth.

title: Kracher 2017 Auslese Cuvée White (Burgenland)
description: Hints of creamiest vanilla and caramelized pear stream generously from the glass. The palate deepens these impressions with almost emollient force. All of this encompassing richness is countered by wonderfully sharp freshness and a tingling background of peppery, almost nettly spice. Such lovely balance and such lasting savor!

title: Lallier NV Les Sous Sélection Parcellaire Grand Cru Blanc de Noirs Extra Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: Made with ripe Pinot Noir from Aÿ on the southern slopes of the Montagne de Reims, this is full of warm apple and pear flavors, cut with generous acidity, finishing with a mineral tautness. The wine is ready to drink.
designation: Les Sous Sélection Parcellaire Grand Cru Blanc de Noirs Extra Brut

title: Encosta do Sobral 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Tejo)
description: This wine is definitely on the tropical-fruit spectrum of Sauvignon Blanc flavors. So apricot and white-nectarine flavors are right up front in this ripe wine. It's all fruit, with a tangy edge of citrus to give freshness. Drink now.

title: Fowles Wine 2014 Farm to Table Shiraz (Victoria)
description: A simple, fruity number, this wine exudes pleasing stewed rhubarb, plums, raspberries, flowers and black pepper notes, but there's also some heat and oak that's a little intrusive. The palate is plush and round, with savory, sandy tannins, crunchy acidity and a bitter oak element on the finish.

title: Glenora 2017 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: Aromas of citrus rind, white blossoms and peach skin make for an enjoyably fresh nose. The palate is rounded in feel, with an integrated line of acidity that boasts creamy citrus and coconut flavors.

title: I Capitani 2015 Campi Taurasini Jumara Aglianico (Irpinia)
description: This Aglianico opens with aromas of vanilla, dark-skinned fruit and camphor. The straightforward palate offers black plum jam, mocha and star anise alongside round tannins. Drink soon.

title: Joseph Mellot 2017 Clos du Pressoir  (Menetou-Salon)
description: A wholly owned Mellot walled vineyard in this small region west of Sancerre is the source of this crisp wine. It is light and bright with mineral texture while not losing fruitiness. Drink this refreshing wine now.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: This wine is forward in aromas of guava and pink grapefruit, with a backdrop of smoky slate. Medium-sweet in style yet light in body. Zesty, piercing acidity freshens a long, mineral finish. It's easy-drinking wine to enjoy now–2022.

title: Lük 2016 Havlin Vineyard Upper Slope Gamay Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is rather tight and tannic for a grape that is more often fruity and forward. Flavors of blueberries and graphite come up, with hints of stem. The tannins retain some earthy astringency.

title: MAN Family Wines NV Méthode Cap Classique Brut Sparkling (Coastal Region)
description: Medium-intense scents of apple pie filling, creamed orange and grilled pineapple fill the nose of this enticing sparkler. The palate shows a bit more restraint, as flavors of lime peel, melon rind and straw are partnered with bright acidity and ample carbonation to balance and lift.

title: Maryhill 2015 Proprietor's Reserve Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Raspberry jam, slightly candied fruit and barrel spice aromas are followed by ripe, luscious fruit flavors. The tannins bring a bit of grit on an otherwise enjoyable offering.

title: Mathew Bruno 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fleshy and full-bodied, this 100% varietal white offers notions of sweet peach, baked pineapple, biscuit and honeycomb. The texture is thick and viscous.

title: Merriam 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Whole-berry pressed, the estate fruit is farmed organically for this wine, which is a rich and relatively thick expression of candied strawberry and watermelon Jolly Rancher. It refreshes through the finish.

title: Miles From Nowhere 2017 Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
description: This wine is ultra extroverted and bursting with aromas of green pepper, grass, lemon and white spice. On the palate is a mighty lick of acidity and a slightly chalky texture.

title: Nardone 2011  Taurasi
description: Prune, underbrush, scorched earth and cocoa aromas lead the nose, along with a slight whiff of barnyard. On the evolved palate, fine-grained but rather fleeting tannins support dried black cherry, raisin and a hint of baking spice alongside the warmth of evident alcohol. Drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Bondenotte  (Sancerre)
description: Named after a parcel of old vines in the village of Bué, this wine has an earthy character. A yeasty edge contrasts with the red-cherry fruits. The wine could do with a few months more, so drink from 2019.

title: Philippe Prié NV Brut Tradition  (Champagne)
description: An immediately drinkable wine, this is crisp and bright with green fruits, apples and final acidity. It has a light mousse and a good lift at the end. Drink now.

title: Quinta da Plansel 2017 Plansel Selecta Red (Alentejano)
description: This open fruity blend is rich and full bodied. It exudes warm southern sun and ripe grapes. Happily, they are balanced with gentle tannins as well as acidity. Drink the wine now.

title: Raphael 2017 Pinot Grigio (New York)
description: Light rose gold in the glass, this wine offers a fresh orchard-fruit aroma, with a riper notion of peach underscored by white blossoms. The palate is less flourished, yet still boasts rounded apple and pear flavors that are balanced by a shot of tangerine acidity.

title: Régine Baron NV Cuvée Perle Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: Pale in color, fresh while soft, this is an attractive, red-fruit -lavored Champagne. A shot of crisp acidity balances the ripe fruit, giving a wine that is ready to drink.

title: Rivata 2014  Barbaresco
description: The shy nose eventually reveals baking spice and dark-skinned fruit. On the linear palate, close-grained astringent tannins accompany sour cherry and clove. Drink after 2022.

title: Robert Hall 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of gravelly earth, dark black cherry, wet wood and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also very earthy, although a tad weak, with smoke-laced black currant and peppery spices.

title: Wolff 2016 Old Vines Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Very showy aromas of daffodils and white peach meet with sea salt and vanilla on the nose of this bottling. There is good grip to the sip, where flavors of lime, grapefruit and sliced orange arise.

title: Wölffer 2016 Perle Chardonnay (The Hamptons, Long Island)
description: Initially shy on the nose, aromas of lime blossom, gardenia and crushed stone slowly creep from the glass. There's a pleasant tension to the slightly rounded palate, with flavors of pineapple rind and melon melding on a tangy wet stone undercurrent.

title: Batasiolo 2012 Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Scorched earth, underbrush, grilled porcini, chopped herb and leather aromas take center stage. The earthy full-bodied palate evokes dried black cherry, prune, star anise and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside drying, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins a few years to unwind then drink sooner rather than later.

title: Benanti 2016 Rosso  (Etna)
description: Truffle, crushed mint and red berry aromas mingle with a whiff of wild rose. The aromas carry through to the light-bodied, racy palate along with white pepper and a citrus note. A hint of oyster shell gives it a tangy finish.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Bernkasteler Badstube Kabinett Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: Loads of sun-kissed grapefruit, quince and lemon flavors collide on the palate of this fruit-forward sip. It's uncomplicated and juicy, yet balanced by zesty lime acidity and a hint of minerality. The finish is brisk and clean.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 DOM Off-Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: Pure, pristine flavors of white grapefruit, lemon and lime lend an exhilarating freshness to this off-dry Riesling. Subtle nuances of wax and pollen accentuate the midpalate, but overall, it's a thirst-quenching, easy-drinking wine.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2013 Judge Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: Made entirely from the one variety, this is bright and floral in red-fruit and lavender notes, as well as the darker side of the grape: compost, turned earth and barnyard leather. It shows power and full-bodied ripeness while maintaining varietal integrity.

title: Canard-Duchêne NV Léonie Brut  (Champagne)
description: Named after Léonie Duchêne, who created this producer, this wine is crisp and drier than most from the house. With taut minerality as well as some weight, it is made mainly from red grapes. Drink this bottling now.

title: Casa Primicia 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, savory aromas of leathery berry fruits come with an animal note. This warm-vintage Reserva is dense and feels like it's piling on top of itself. Roasted, spicy berry flavors are slightly leafy, while oak spice is lasting on a solid, chunky finish.

title: Cascina Chicco 2014 Rocche di Castelletto  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of red berry, underbrush and a balsamic note emerge from the glass. The solid palate shows black cherry, star anise and clove alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Chappellet 2016 Mountain Cuvée Proprietor's Red (Napa Valley)
description: This rounded, approachable blend is well-made, blending 51% Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller percentages of Merlot, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Concentrated in big, burly black fruit, it offers accents of tobacco and mocha around a thick midpalate and finishing touch of char.

title: Château du Coudray Montpensier 2017 Le Grand Bouqueteau  (Chinon)
description: This young wine still has a stalky character, but the rich fruit and warm tannins hold promise for the future. Drink this ripe, spicy wine with fruitcake flavors from 2020.

title: Coelho 2015 Family Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Just one barrel was made, and it was aged for 18 months. Oak-driven aromas open into flavors of toasted coconut and roasted cashews. The medium-bodied berry fruit is clean and fresh, with highlights of orange peel and chocolate.

title: Curto 2015 Nero d'Avola (Eloro)
description: Dark berry, Mediterranean brush and carob aromas take center stage. Made with Nero d'Avola, the smooth, juicy palate delivers ripe blackberry, ground pepper and clove alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy through 2020.

title: Domaine du Vieux Bourg NV Jean-Marie et Noël Girard Cabernet Franc (Crémant de Loire)
description: That Cabernet Franc makes fine sparkling Crémant in the Loire is obvious from this red-currant-flavored, crisp-textured wine. It is full of sparkling fruitiness, vibrant with acidity and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine Gueneau 2017 Les Terres Blanches  (Sancerre)
description: Crisp, herbal and apple flavored, this perfumed wine is ripe, full in the mouth and still young. It has great acidity and a tight mineral texture. The wine comes from 25-year-old vines that add concentration to the fruits. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2017 Villa Paulus  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Named after the Roman villa that once existed in Pouilly-sur-Loire (and which gave its name to Pouilly), this wine comes from old vines giving concentrated citrus and green-fruit flavors. Bright, crisp and tangy, the wine could do with some aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Paul Thomas 2017 Silex  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from a parcel of vines planted on flint soil close to the Loire river. It is tense and mineral, with swathes of rich citrus, lively acidity and a tangy aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Fairsing 2016 Dardis Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: The Dardis cuvée is taut and citric and shows wild berry fruit. Barreled for 10 months in 30% new French oak, it shows little impact of barrel flavors at this point in time; just the slightest hint of caramel streaking through the finish.

title: Famille Duveau 2016  Saumur-Champigny
description: This fruity wine is full of ripe red-cherry flavors, with a touch of smoky tannins. It has a delicious, juicy character, very open while also having a balanced structure. From vineyards to the east of the city of Saumur, the wine is bright and ready to drink.

title: Dominio de la Abadesa 2014 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Mature, slightly oxidized berry aromas lead to a palate that has the clamp and tension of rubber bands. Black-fruit and plum flavors are good but basic, while this feels rocky hard and rubbery on a tannic finish.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Les Belles Vignes  (Sancerre)
description: This young, stalky wine has smoky flavors on top of red-berry fruits. Its tannins are still very present and need to soften, while the fruit needs to fill out. Drink from 2020.

title: Global Wines 2016 Grillos Red (Dão)
description: This is a fruity wine, open and full of blackberry flavors. It has a rich, generous character that fills out the texture of this attractive, ready-to-drink wine. The name of the wine? Grasshopper.

title: Graffetta 2015 Hyspa Red (Terre Siciliane)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Petit Verdot, this has aromas reminiscent of dark berry, bell pepper and underbrush. The easygoing palate shows dried black currant and tobacco alongside smooth tannins.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Les Baronnes  (Sancerre)
description: Perfumed red-cherry flavors enhance the soft texture of this wine. It has bright acidity as well as a warm, open structure. Drink this rich wine now.

title: Jacquart NV Rosé Mosaïque Brut  (Champagne)
description: A soft, ripe wine, this is full of red fruits that are balanced with just the right amount of acidity. It is an attractive, generous wine, aged for at least three years before disgorgement to give extra richness. Drink now.

title: Joseph Mellot 2016 Domaine des Emois  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from a 14-acre vineyard cultivated organically. The soft and smooth texture is balanced with the bright cherry flavors and acidity. Light, juicy and fruity, it is ready to drink.

title: Lujon 2016 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Flavors of green apple, vanilla wafer and graham cracker combine in this mild-mannered Chardonnay. There's still a strongly yeasty impression to the flavors, suggesting that it should continue to develop and integrate its flavors over the next couple of years.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Griva Vineyard Therese Vineyards Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Rich aromas of pomegranate and cranberry are dusted with baking spice, pepper and dried herbs on the rather ripe nose of this bottling. The palate is also riper than usual for Pinots from this appellation, showing flavors of cooked berries, star anise, licorice, vanilla and cedar.

title: Matthews 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of anise, dried cherry and cedar are followed by a lightly styled palate with medicinal accents. The tannins seem a bit bunched up.

title: Max Ferd. Richter 2016 Classic Riesling (Mosel)
description: Subtle earth tones on the nose contrast juicy white grapefruit and green apple flavors on the palate of this approachable, fruity Riesling. It's medium bodied and just a shade off dry. Slate and crushed mineral notes linger on the finish. Drink now–2021.

title: MCM Wine Co. 2015 Spectaculuxe Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This is mostly Ranch at the End of the Road and Arianses Vineyard fruit, along with dashes from Stone Tree and Marsala. Aromas of fresh flower and orange peel are in the lead, with the Viognier (6%) showing itself strongly. Blueberry pie aromas follow. The palate is interesting, with a lot of bass notes but seeming to be missing in the middle and top.

title: Montaudon NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This producer, based in Reims, has made an open, fruity and crisp nonvintage cuvée. It is a soft wine, suggesting a relatively high dosage. Pinot Noir just dominates the blend with Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier. Drink now.

title: Nicosia 2017 Vulkà Bianco  (Etna)
description: Delicately scented, this offers subtle aromas of yellow wildflower, orchard fruit and wild herb. Mirroring the nose, the crisp, linear palate offers yellow apple, Bartlett pear and a light salty note alongside bright acidity.

title: Nicosia 2017 Vulkà Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Wild berry, rose and violet aromas lift out of the glass. On the juicy, straightforward palate, fresh acidity brightens ripe strawberry, pomegranate and a hint of wet stone.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Dineen Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Yakima Valley)
description: You have to lean into the glass to try and get at the aromas, with green herb notes starting to emerge over time. The dark cherry flavors are more giving, though not quite holding across the palate. Firm, not fully ripened tannins back it all up along with tart acidity.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Una Notte Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The majority of this wine is 77% Grenache from StoneTree Vineyard, with the balance being Syrah and Mourvèdre. Dried orange peel and flower aromas are at the fore, with the lighter styled palate showing more of the same. There's a rough feel to the wine that seems distracting.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Rosé (Sancerre)
description: A wine with caramel as well as red-fruit flavors, this is soft and smooth. A tang of acidity shows at the end.

title: Paso Highlands 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Highlands District)
description: Red fruit, clove and licorice show on the nose of this bottling. Cooked strawberry, roasted plum and cherries are dusted with allspice on the fairly simple but clean palate.

title: Patrice Moreux 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: Open, ripe and soft, this lightly yeasty wine is developing quickly. Tangy citrus and apple flavors are balanced by a touch of spice as well as a zesty aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Educated Guess 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% whole-cluster pressed wine that is high-toned in flavors of lemon peel and grapefruit. The finish is quick and unfussy.

title: Forget-Brimont NV Brut Rosé Premier Cru  (Champagne)
description: This bottling has some age, giving its soft character some attractive bite and spice. The strawberry fruits are lively with a smooth character that comes from the relatively high dosage. Drink now.

title: Harken 2017 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (California)
description: Vivid toasted-oak aromas and flavors dominate this full-bodied mouth-filling wine. Along with a charred-wood aroma come buttery butterscotchy flavors from a complete malolactic fermentation and a pear nectar component that provides the fruity side.

title: Icardi 2015 Montubert  (Barbaresco)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals camphor, toasted oak and mocha aromas. The linear palate delivers raw cranberry, espresso and clove alongside taut rather astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Marquis de Goulaine 2017 La Loire Royale  (Vouvray)
description: This soft, medium-sweet Chenin Blanc offers crisp acidity, creamed apple and honey flavors and a clean aftertaste. Drink this light, perfumed wine now.

title: Michel Forget NV Premier Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This soft, ripe rosé has a tangy edge that keeps it bright and fruity. Strawberry flavors and a relatively high dosage means this is an easy wine to appreciate even when, as here, the bottling is young.

title: Navarro 2016 Navarrouge Red (Mendocino)
description: This good, easy-drinking wine gives a sweet first impression and builds fruity and savory notes through the flavors and finish. It adds chocolaty accents to herbal ones like bay leaf and fruity ones like black plum.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)
description: Merlot and Cabernet Franc each make up 40% of this wine, with the balance being Cabernet Sauvignon. Clove, vanilla and raspberry roll-up aromas are followed by slightly dried-out fruit flavors. The tannins bring an astringent squeeze.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Madonna Spätlese White (Rheinhessen)
description: While demure on the nose, sweet grapefruit and pear notes in this semisweet white are forward and slightly confected on the palate. A blend of Kerner, Silvaner and Riesling, it's a sweet-tart, easy-drinking sip with just a hint of smoky minerality. Enjoy now.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Pintail Red (Napa Valley)
description: Thick tannins take on a leathery quality in this blend of 64% Zinfandel and 36% Cabernet Sauvignon, the Zin from high atop Howell Mountain. Tart acidity underlies the leather, black currant and dried herb.

title: Peñalba Herraiz 2016 Aptus 6 Meses Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Sappy blackberry aromas are dense. In the mouth, this is heavy and a bit overweight for a joven-style wine. Plum and herbal flavors end with flabby weight.

title: Saddleback Cellars 2016 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a strong candied flavor of sugarcane and baked pineapple, allowing its ripeness and barrel-fermentation to speak loudly and with conviction.

title: Sand Point 2016 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Sweet oak aromas and candied fruit flavors give this medium-bodied wine a pop personality. It has a soft texture, light tannins and quite a bit of vanilla and oak spices.

title: Sparkman 2016 Kindred Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of tin, green pepper, herb, plum and cherry lead to plump but still light fruit flavors. Grainy tannins provide support.

title: Washington Hills 2017 Late Harvest Riesling (Washington)
description: Honeysuckle, jasmine, lime and ripe peach aromas are followed by sweet fruit flavors, speckled with abundant floral notes. It delivers sweet, easy-drinking appeal.

title: Alasia 2014  Barbaresco
description: The shy nose eventually reveals moist underbrush and camphor aromas. The simple palate offers raw sour cherry and a hint of licorice framed in tight, somewhat astringent tannins.

title: Antis 2014 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Hot tar and peanut brittle aromas are earthy at best. This Malbec is tight and unyielding on the palate, with plum and currant flavors. The finish tastes saucy, with tomatoey acidity.

title: Cantina della Serra 2016 Sessanta  (Erbaluce di Caluso)
description: Aromas of acacia and mature apricot follow over to the straightforward, rather evolved palate along with a balsamic note and a hint of candied orange slice. It closes on a bitter-almond note. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

title: Chakana 2017 Estate Selection Chardonnay (Uco Valley)
description: A bright gold color and aromas of pumpkin and melon lead to a chunky, plump palate. Flavors of squash and papaya are less than bright, while this softly peters out on the finish.

title: Coelho 2016 Coelho Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This plain and simple Pinot has light strawberry and thin raspberry fruit, with lemony acidity. It was whole berry fermented, but the overall impression is that the grapes either were picked early or simply ran out of ripening time.

title: Cristom 2016 Mount Jefferson Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Cristom's multivineyard blend is a polished effort that overdelivers for the price. Spicy and pungently herbal aromas lead into flavors of tart strawberry and peppery herb. The leaf and bark aspect is forceful but nicely integrated, and the structure suggests aging this a few years for optimal drinking.

title: Damiani 2016 Barrel Fermented Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: An opulent nose of ripe yellow apple and melon melds with highlights of rose, ginger and white pepper spice. The palate is rich and silken in feel yet impeccably balanced by supportive acidity and delicate astringency. Succulent flavors of melon and canned peach meet with flecks of spice and flowers to give an overall broad impression.

title: Domaine Dozon 2017  Chinon
description: This rich wine is structured and firm while also having red berry and cherry fruits, rich smoky flavors and final acidity. Its tannins and tight acidity also promise aging. Drink this wine from 2021.

title: Domaine Jean-Paul Balland 2017  Sancerre
description: This wine has a good balance between rich apple flavors and tight acidity and minerality, reveling in the warm 2017 vintage. The texture is taut, but the young wine will soften in a few months to offer smoothness and roundness. Drink from 2019.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Hylo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The winery's lineup of single vineyard Pinots features sites rarely if ever seen elsewhere, but all are deserving of extra attention. The high elevation (aptly named) Hylo Vineyard selection is all Pommard clone, with generous raspberry and cherry lollipop fruit. The natural-tasting acids bring citrus and tangerine, and the finish is focused and long.

title: Elias Mora 2015  Toro
description: Savory, meaty berry aromas are unconventional and gamy more than bold, oaky and fruity. A plump round palate is full but not fat, while roasted meaty blackberry flavors finish toasty and snappy, with touches of heat and burn that should slip away with more time in bottle; drink through 2025.

title: Elio Filippino 2013 San Cristoforo  (Barbaresco)
description: Red berry, underbrush and tobacco aromas lead the nose. The savory palate offers red cherry, cinnamon and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very earthy on the front end, this clonal selection presents aromas of dark hibiscus, baked red fruits, pine forest floor, peppercorn and wild herbs. Tangy cranberry and sour cherry show on the sip, where a decent tension frames the palate.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2015 Grande Cuvée  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: The extra richness of a Pouilly Fumé is very apparent in this wine. Its ripe white fruits are tense, tangy while also full bodied and, even after three years, still very young. That bold fruitiness needs to soften further, so drink from 2019.

title: Gyéjacquot Frères NV Anatom Noir Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is rich and full in the mouth, with some good mature flavors. The creamed apple has garnered a nutty, toasty character that gives it ripe complexity. Textured and very complete, this bottling is ready to drink.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 La Bourgeoise  (Sancerre)
description: Intense, fruity and now ready to drink, this wine comes from some of the old parcels of the Bourgeois estate. It is rich while remaining crisp, with a flinty edge that gives it a good texture.

title: Kessler-Haak 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fresh and lively aromas of hibiscus, sumac and tea leaves make for a compelling entry to this bottling. Tart cherry and plum-skin flavors lead into richer fruit toward the finish, with touches of Earl Grey tea and loamy soil throughout.

title: Lanson NV Green Label Brut  (Champagne)
description: Made from organically grown grapes (hence Green Label), this wine is very much in the crisp Lanson style. The rich character is tensely textured, full of tight minerality as well as green fruits and wonderful final acidity. Drink this bottling now.

title: Lingua Franca 2016 The Plow Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Firmly rooted in flavors of blueberries and plums, this adds accents of black olive and green tea. The tannins are substantial and somewhat astringent, with a finishing touch of orange peel.

title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2016 Winemaker's Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Softly alluring and youthfully vibrant in fresh power and tart acidity, this block-designate is spicy and fruit-forward in black cherry, blackberry and a dip of vanilla cola.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Herbal and forested in savory elements like rose petal and black tea, this is a gorgeously rich and round red wine, a true showcase of the appellation and sure to please a crowd. Red and black cherry are met by wild strawberry and lush waves of depth.

title: Navarro 2016 Premiere Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a beautiful, elegant, lighter-styled wine in a half-bottle that shows great balance between ripeness and fresh acidity. Lemon and crisp apple aromas lead to light vanilla and butter flavors that mingle well with the fruit elements.

title: Oso Libre 2013 Carnal Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 64% Grenache, 22% Mourvèdre and 14% Syrah certainly plays toward the riper end of the spectrum, but its roasted red fruit is deeply layered with star anise, ginger, clove and caramel aromas. It's powerful on the palate, with unctuous flavors of roasted blackberry and plum as well as more baking spice.

title: Planeta 2016 Dorilli  (Cerasuolo di Vittoria Classico)
description: Made with 70% Nero d'Avola and 30% Frappato, this opens with aromas of dark berry, underbrush and a whiff of carob. The polished, balanced palate offers blackberry jam, Marasca cherry and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins. An orange zest note signals the close.

title: Prinz Salm 2016 Dalberger Ritterhölle Erste Lage Trocken Riesling (Nahe)
description: Spicy, earthen aromas juxtapose crisp white grapefruit and lemon in this dry, medium-bodied wine. It's a zesty, intensely mineral wine backed by piercing shards of lemon-lime acidity. Still in its youth, it's a tightly wound wine that should yield and expand from 2021 to 2030.

title: Steininger 2016 Riesling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Very exuberant bubbles burst to send notes of lime zest and lemon to the surface. There is real body and substance to this, more perhaps than one would bargain for in a Sekt, but there is impeccable balance. The finish is dry and fresh.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2017 Bianco  (Etna)
description: Aromas of acacia, chamomile and mature lemon zest slowly appear in the glass. The aromas carry through to the medium-bodied palate along with ripe yellow apple, hazelnut and a hint of flint. Tangy acidity lifts the dry finish.

title: Terra Costantino 2014 Rosso Contrada Blandano  (Etna)
description: Made with organically cultivated grapes, this opens with an enticing fragrance of Mediterranean scrub, wild mint, fragrant blue flower and woodland berry. The minty note follows over to the fresh, linear palate together with crushed strawberry, sour cherry and mint. It's polished, with lithe tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2022.

title: Thick Skinned 2015 Red (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (60%), Malbec (33%) and Petit Verdot. It's aromatically locked up on first pour, showing whiffs of cherry and spice. The palate is considerably more expressive, packed with rich, dense, jammy black cherry flavors surrounded by a pleasing sense of structure.

title: Tornatore 2017 Bianco  (Etna)
description: Inviting aromas of fragrant wildflower, white stone fruit, aromatic herb and a whiff of wet stone take center stage. On the linear, savory palate, bright acidity lifts ripe yellow apple, green melon, citrus zest and dried thyme, while a mineral note gives it a savory—almost salty—finish.

title: True Myth 2016 Paragon Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This widely available wine is a solid catch and stands out with its beautiful packaging. It offers a smoky nose that's complemented by lemon peel and sandalwood. Oak shows prominently on the palate, where smoked peach, melon and more lemon ride a creamy texture.

title: Ulithorne 2015 Avitus Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This is classic South Aussie Shiraz: Ripe plums, chocolate, ground black pepper and a dusty, wood spice lead the way on the nose. The palate is full and plush, the tannins are fine-grained and focused and the oak is in check. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Estate Reserve Merlot (Fair Play)
description: This is a big, structured, full-bodied Merlot that feels moderately tannic in texture and gushes with ripe plum and black-cherry flavors. A light minty aroma and attractive oak spices work well to add complexity.

title: Yalumba 2014 The Scribbler Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz (Barossa)
description: A blend of 64% Cabernet Sauvignon and 36% Shiraz, this solidly made, full-boded red offers notes of plump cherry, plum, licorice, cocoa powder and dried green herbs. The herbaceouness really shines on the palate, supported by dusty tannins.

title: Keuka Spring 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: A fragrant perfume of rose petals, melon, ginger and white pepper spice comes together in the glass. Succulent in feel, the palate is broad and oily, with supportive acidity and mild astringency maintaining balance. Flavors of juicy yellow apple, melon and spiced potpourri broaden the midpalate and lead to a delicate jasmine note on the lingering finish.

title: Colosi 2014 Passito di Salina  (Malvasia delle Lipari)
description: Made with Malvasia delle Lipari and a drop of Corinto grapes, this opens with aromas of dried apricot, ripe fig and a whiff of jasmine. The aromas carry over to the palate along with tangerine zest and star anise. It's sweet but well balanced.

title: Torricino 2014 Cevotiempo  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas suggesting pipe tobacco, blue flower, menthol, baked plum and a whiff of exotic spice take center stage. On the full-bodied, enveloping palate, firm, fine-grained tannins wrap around mature Morello cherry, licorice, prune and clove. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Acumen 2014 Peak Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: This estate-grown wine is brawny in leather, earth and cedar, with powerfully concentrated flavors of red currant and black cherry. Substantial in style, it resolves on the midpalate to show touches of acid-tinged grace and restraint. Its finish is sticky in dark chocolate.

title: Acumen 2014 Peak Edcora Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Winemaker Henrik Poulsen worked alongside the late Denis Malbec on this winery project, which is relatively new to the appellation. Deep brambly berry aromas rise from the glass in this elegant effort, blended with tiny additions of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Brown-sugar flavors accent a velvety rich and smooth texture, the tannins tamed and softened.

title: Ada Nada 2015 Rombone Elisa  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of dark berry, underbrush and cooking spice appear in the glass. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside polished tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2021–2028.

title: Alexana 2016 Revana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A diverse clonal mix adds texture and detail to this estate-grown wine. The fruit is a bit on the lean side, with flavors of red currant and wild raspberries. The tannins carry an earthy, herbal tone on through the extended finish. The best drinking window should be 2022 to 2030.

title: Bellangelo 2015 1866 Reserve Chardonnay (Seneca Lake)
description: Initially closed on the nose in tones of smoke and nuts, after a few good swirls in the glass this wine reveals a wealth of brûléed lemon and peach tones. While broad in feel, the flavors are tight and restrained at the moment, centered around zesty citrus and tangy minerals. Drink after 2019.

title: Bellwether 2016 A&D Vineyard Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: This is the last vintage ever from this vineyard on Keuka Lake, which has since been leveled and sold to a real estate developer. Initially restrained on the nose, after a few swirls in the glass this opens up to notes of pollen-dusted chamomile, melon rind and wet slate. A delicately framed palate boasts flavors of tangy white cherry and crunchy green pear, with a slick, silky feel and a lingering limestone finish.

title: Bergström 2016 Silice Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This new vintage of this signature cuvée has a strong scent of tanned leather, and those tack room flavors mute down the plum and cherry fruit. For some tasters, this is a feature, if not a benefit; for others, it may be a bit disappointing. Just one bottle was provided and tasted.

title: Bertrand-Delespierre 2012 Saignée des Terres Amoureuses Brut Rosé Premier Cru  (Champagne)
description: The dark color of this rosé results from skin contact. Most Champagnes are turned rosé by adding still red wine. It is a dry style, crisp and fruity with a zingy texture and plenty of red-currant acidity. Drink now.
designation: Saignée des Terres Amoureuses Brut Rosé Premier Cru

title: Left Coast 2015 Truffle Hill Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine is aromatic in tones of red and black berries, cedar and tobacco. The palate brings plum and black cherry flavors, with drying tannins that leave a lingering taste of black tea.

title: Mastroberardino 2017 Radici  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: White spring flower, acacia and tropical fruit aromas lift out of the glass. On the smooth, rounded palate, tangy acidity and a mineral vein energize ripe yellow apple, juicy pear and a drop of honey. A hint of toasted almond signals the close.

title: Mirafiore 2014 Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)
description: Aromas of bread crust, field flower and yellow stone fruit lift out of the glass. On the silky palate, bright acidity lifts peach, chopped herb, toasted almond and citrus zest alongside a refined perlage.

title: Neely 2016 Holly's Cuvee Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Toasted oak, sandalwood, pine, lemon peels and dried apple show on the nose of this bottling from the appellation's northernmost stretches. The palate starts with the freshness of cut lemon before dwelling back on the intense and savory qualities of aged wood and sea salt.

title: Omen 2017 Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: For those who like a hint of sweetness and a ton of dark jammy fruit flavors, this wine is a no-brainer. A blend of 50% Zinfandel plus Barbera, Syrah and Petite Sirah, it smells and tastes chocolaty, berry-like and superripe, and has a velvety texture that soothes the palate.

title: Open Claim 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This well-funded new effort has released its first wines, from a vineyard planted in 2012. The wines show plenty of potential, though young vines cannot fully express all the secrets of the land in which they grow. Light berry flavors and highlights of toast and breakfast tea are in focus. Consulting winemaker Tony Rynders has used one new and one neutral barrel for this limited offering, keeping flavors in balance. Off to a good start, this is a winery to watch.

title: Persona Non Grata 2015 Red (Lake County)
description: Very ripe and concentrated fruit flavors are framed by light oak spices in this full-bodied and round-textured wine. It has a generous mouthfeel, deep black-plum flavors and a good sense of richness, partly due no doubt to a hefty alcohol level.

title: Piazzo 2015  Barbaresco
description: Aromas of woodland berry, new leather and forest floor lead the nose. The savory palate offers red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Poças 2013 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a sweet rich style of LBV, full of ripe plum fruits as well as raisins. The luscious texture of the wine is nicely lifted by acidity at the end. This style of Port, with its tannins still there, can be aged further. So either drink it now or wait until 2022.

title: Prunotto 2013 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: Woodland berry, tilled soil, dried rose, new leather and aromatic herb aromas come together in this fragrant, racy red. It's rather light in body and ethereal for Barolo, already accessible, offering flavors of tart sour cherry, clove and chopped dill. Firm acidity and polished tannins provide lithe support. Drink through 2025.

title: Quinta do Pessegueiro 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This fruity style is immediately attractive, ripe with dusty tannins and blackberry fruit. It is not a powerful wine although its tannins do promise longevity as well as a fine sense of structure. Drink the wine from 2028.

title: Riofavara NV Metodo Classico Extra Brut Sparkling (Sicilia)
description: Made with 90% Moscato and 10% Grecanico, this racy sparkler opens with aromas of citrus, crushed herb and a whiff of yellow stone fruit. Reflecting the nose, the vibrant palate delivers dried apricot, flinty minerality and lemon alongside an elegant, continuous perlage.

title: Riverbench 2016 Bedrock Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Quite rich on the nose, this bottling from a historic property deep in the appellation shows loads of honeysuckle and gardenia on the nose as well as lemon bar, nectarine, candied apple and a flash of nuts. It lands with ripe power on the palate, carrying hints of mango and pome fruits.

title: Schloss Saarstein 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mosel)
description: Crisp, cutting white grapefruit and pear flavors lend freshness to this full-bodied but invigorating white. It's silky and expansive on the palate but balanced by zesty acidity and a pleasant rim of astringency on the finish.

title: Schnaitmann 2013 Trocken Sauvignon Blanc (Württemberg)
description: Fresh yellow peach and apple flavors are accented with cashew, green plum and lime zest in this dry but intensely fruity Sauvignon Blanc. It's a full-bodied yet zesty wine marked by a fresh, lingering finish.

title: Sonsierra 2013 Pagos de la Sonsierra Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Dark smoky charred aromas lend a crusty, slightly burnt topping to the nose. In the mouth, this cool-vintage wine is wiry, with magnetic midpalate acidity. Saucy flavors of plum and berry finish savory and tight. Fitting for a 2013, this is never overly ripe. Drink through 2022.

title: Sonsierra 2014 Crianza Vendimia Seleccionada  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry aromas suggest raisin and graphite. A flush palate is full in body and displaying good structure. Roasted berry and plum flavors are meaty in front of a savory finish that tastes of soy sauce and grilled beef. Drink through 2020.

title: Sparkman 2015 Rainmaker Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: A blend of fruit from Olsen and Kiona vineyards. Brooding dried herb, black cherry and spice aromas are followed by a supple, flavorful palate, bursting with cherry, cedar and plum notes that extend on the finish. This one is all about subtlety and sophistication, and it brings both in abundance.

title: St. Francis 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Brimming with a sweetness of baked cherry and molasses, this is a soft, rounded and robustly ripe wine that carries its weight well. A touch of structured, high-toned acidity complements the power and outer reaches of excess, allowing the experience on the palate to speak.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Twelve Falls Red (Stags Leap District)
description: This is an estate-grown combination of half Cabernet Sauvignon with 40% Petite Sirah and 10% Merlot. It offers moderation and grace within its juicy core of muted black fruit, cedar and gamy meat seasoned in black pepper.

title: Pambrun 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: This is the first release from a new winery from Willamette Valley Vineyards that will be located on the Oregon side of Walla Walla Valley. The aromas bring a sense of purity, with notes of black currant, raspberry, plum and fresh tobacco. The palate offers a sense of delicacy and restraint. There's structure here, but it relies less on overt tannins than most Cabernets. It's a unique offering of the variety.

title: Panther Creek 2016 Winemaker's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The latest version is more widely available through expanded production and offers a price drop as well. In fact, it's a fine value in a sappy, sexy style. Raspberry, blueberry, blackberry and cherry fruits are here in abundance—the whole spectrum, reflecting a variety of top vineyard sources. The tasty fruit is backed with fine-tuned tannins—and 42% new French oak.

title: Quinta da Alorna 2015 Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Tejo)
description: Two-thirds Touriga Nacional and one-third Cabernet Sauvignon create a perfumed structured wine that still has firm tannins. Toast from wood aging shows through the rich black fruits adding to the richness of this fine wine. Drink from 2020.

title: Quinta dos Murças 2016 Minas Red (Douro)
description: This wine is made from a single vineyard that is situated between 1,200 and 1,600 feet in elevation. It is poised between structured black fruits and firm tannins, which gives the wine fine potential. Drink from 2020 to allow for the fruit to broaden out.

title: Schild Estate 2014 Ben Schild Reserve Single Vineyard Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: This is a plump, fruity Shiraz that many a rich red wine lover can get behind. Plump, bramble berry, black licorice root, violet and cedar lead the way, while the palate is supple and velvety in texture. Finely knit, spicy tannins hold the wine afloat,. Drink now–2028.

title: Schloss Vollrads 2017 Kabinett Medium-Dry Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Pristine lemon, lime and grapefruit aromas perfume this semidry Riesling. Light-footed yet boldly concentrated in citrus flavors, it's an invigorating wine that finishes with reverberating minerality on the finish. This is irresistibly quaffable yet elegant.

title: Schloss Vollrads 2017 Volratz Dry Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Delicate whiffs of red berries, white peaches and crushed minerals perfume this fruity, full-bodied, dry Riesling. It's rounded and quite plush yet balanced by pert strikes of lemony acidity and a mouthwatering edge of salt. Enjoy now–2021.

title: Simonsig 2017 Kaapse Vonkel Méthode Cap Classique Brut Rosé Sparkling (Western Cape)
description: Made from 72% Pinot Noir, 27% Pinotage and 1% Pinot Meunier, this sparkler boasts superbright scents of white melon, firm guava and red cherry that are supported by a pretty floral hint of fresh peony. It's direct and focused on the palate, with vibrant acidity and brisk red-currant and pomegranate flavors that lend freshness through the medium-length close.
designation: Kaapse Vonkel Méthode Cap Classique Brut Rosé

title: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2013 Opera Mia  (Taurasi)
description: Intense aromas of crushed mint take center stage along with more subtle scents of black-skinned berry, leather and exotic spice. The minty note carries over to the firm, full-bodied but linear palate, along with black cherry and licorice tones. Firm acidity and tight, close-grained tannins provide the backbone. Don't even attempt this before 2025.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Santo Spirito Bianco  (Etna)
description: Aromas of Spanish broom, crushed rock, toasted nut and a whiff of oak follow over to the crisp, elegant palate, along with ripe yellow apple and citrus zest. Hints of butterscotch and mineral linger on the finish.

title: Terra Costantino 2016 de Aetna Bianco  (Etna)
description: A blend of organically farmed Carricante, Catarratto and Minnella, this radiant white opens with light scents of citrus, yellow wildflower, Mediterranean brush and saline. Vibrant and linear, the crisp palate delivers lemon zest, crushed herb and flinty minerality. It's understated and elegant. Drink through 2021.

title: Terredora Di Paolo 2008 Campore  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of pipe tobacco, grilled porcini, leather, dark-skinned fruit and a whiff of dried aromatic herb form the nose. The palate shows prune, dried black cherry, sage and a hint of exotic spice alongside a backbone of assertive, close-grained tannins that grip the salty finish.

title: Teso La Monja 2015 Romanico  (Toro)
description: Pure berry and black-cherry aromas make for a flush and friendly nose. In the mouth, this is quite dry and drawing, with rough-textured tannins. Lightly salty and savory blackberry and black-plum flavors finish with surface-level depth and a reprise of scratchiness; drink through 2024.

title: Theresa Eccher 2017 Ariel Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Made with 100% Nerello Mascalese, this has an alluring fragrance of Spanish broom, wild berry and Mediterranean brush. On the palate, fresh acidity lifts red cherry, pomegranate and a hint of star anise.

title: Tournon by Michel Chapoutier 2014 Mathilda Shiraz (Victoria)
description: This is a bright, light unoaked red. Red currants, black olives, cocoa, bay leaves and smoke lead the way, while a quiet, savory line of tannins balances the crunchy acidity and tart cherry fruit on the palate.

title: Townley 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Well balanced and medium bodied, this wine from a unique mountainside vineyard combines good elements of natural acidity for freshness with ripe apple and pear for flavor. A smooth, layered mouthfeel wraps it all up nicely.

title: Trudon NV Monochrome Brut Pinot Meunier (Champagne)
description: Showing the richness and soft texture of ripe Pinot Meunier, this wine comes from Jérôme Trudon's small-production Champagne house. It has just the right balance, with spice and zingy apple flavors coming through the ripeness. Drink now.

title: Vetter 2014 Sandstein GK Sylvaner (Germany)
description: Hints of waxy lemon peel and chestnut skin lend a rustic tone to this savory, phenolic white wine. Made from old-vine grapes fermented via indigenous yeast and matured in barrel for 19 months, it's a uniquely earthen rather than fruity expression of Silvaner. Dry and exceptionally light in body, it finishes long with a lingering waxy vein.

title: Vigne Guadagno 2013  Taurasi
description: Aromas of oak, plum and exotic spice lead the way along with a whiff of smoke. The aromas follow over to the firm palate, together with prune, cherry, star anise and bitter cocoa. It's youthfully tight, with a backbone of bracing acidity and assertive, close-grained tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2025.

title: Wente 2016 Coastal Selection Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: A blend of grapes from the pioneering family's properties in Livermore and Arroyo Seco, this starts with aromas of pear flesh, lime skin, bright tangerine, honeydew and a touch of chalk. There is a tropical streak to the palate, but it's energetic and balanced, showing flavors of guava, mango and ripe red apple, all honed in by a tight pink-grapefruit-pith structure.

title: Sequoia Grove 2013 Cambium Red (Napa Valley)
description: Already aged in bottle for some time, this Bordeaux can withstand plenty more evolution in bottle, its bright red fruit structured enough within a tight frame of chalky tannin and coconut oak. The ripeness is moderate and in balance.

title: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2016 Clos des Chaudoux  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Harvested from a small parcel, less than four acres, this wine is in perfect condition. It is balanced, with white fruit and citrus coming together, led by the acidity. It is developing into a full, ripe wine. Wait until 2019.

title: Siduri 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite subtle at first on the nose, this bottling offers baked red-cherry aromas and a dusting of soil with some swirling. The palate blends dark red cherry with touches of sagebrush and wild thyme, lifted by a hint of white pepper.

title: Stolpman 2016 Estate Grown Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Compact elderberry aromas and purple flowers mesh with savory touches of roasted beef and black pepper on the nose of this bottling, which is quite young. Black-currant and lilac flavors pop on the sip before the tightly woven structure temporarily hides them, though they will surely arise in the years to come. Drink 2020–2036.

title: Teso La Monja 2015 Almirez  (Toro)
description: A graphite note and the essence of fine oak sit nicely atop a nose defined by blackberry, prune and raisin aromas. A tight palate qualifies as direct, while this Toro cruiserweight tastes of toasty oaky black fruits and pepper. A spicy dry finish doesn't waver, and this Tinta de Toro will age well; drink through 2027.

title: Thomas Schmitt 2017 Estate Bottled Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: The nose of this wine is quite elegant, offering notes of wet slate, honey and lemon. Off-dry in style, it seems to build in fruitiness on the palate, moving from zesty lime and lemon to sweet white grapefruit and peach. Enjoy now–2025.

title: Toil Oregon 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Willamette Valley)
description: A lovely reddish copper shade, this is a rich and complex wine, fermented in neutral barrels and briefly aged in stainless steel. Scents and flavors suggest dried straw, mild earth, wild strawberries and a splash of guava juice. It's far more interesting than most rosés, while retaining all the simple pleasure and freshness that makes these wines so popular.

title: Torres 2015 Cos Perpetual Red (Priorat)
description: Spicy black-fruit aromas are potent, with side notes of clove, lemon peel and charred wood. This is lush, clean and modern in style. Fully ripe blackberry and cassis flavors come with an underlay of chocolaty oak. On a smooth finish, tobacco flavors stand out. Drink through 2023.

title: Weinreich 2013 Bechtheimer Trocken Schwartzriesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Schwartzriesling is better known as Pinot Meunier, the unsung supporting player in many classic Champagne blends. This varietal still wine is a gorgeously transparent expression of Schwartzriesling redolent of pristine blackberries and raspberries. It's primary and quaffable yet nuanced by earthen hints of beetroot and bramble. Concentrated yet crisp, it finishes with a fringe of silky tannins.

title: Loimer NV Brut Rosé Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: The aromatic mellowness of very ripe, red apples mingles with notes of fresh short crust pastry on the nose. The bubbles are tiny and soft, fizzing away while a sublime streak of freshness gives precision and purity on this creamy, classy and very elegant pink sparkler.

title: Aberrant Cellars 2016 Chehalem Mountain Vineyard Block B3 Old Vines Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Sourced from a vineyard planted in 1968 by Oregon pioneer Dick Erath, this complex and textural effort melds together brambly blackberry fruit with elements of spice, sassafras and mocha. The wine is nicely layered through the lingering finish. It should continue to drink well through 2025.
designation: Chehalem Mountain Vineyard Block B3 Old Vines

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2014 Faith Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Intensely dark in the glass, this impressive blend of 58% Petite Sirah, 39% Syrah and 3% Carignan shows strong aromas of black currant, black plum, whole peppercorn and violet.
