description: Ripe orange pith, tight apple flesh, lemon rind and sandalwood aromas show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from a property in the Corralitos area. There is a fine line of lime set against roasted apple and seared lemon on the palate, with toasty flavors on the finish.

title: Trapiche 2015 Medalla Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Blackberry, black licorice and campfire aromas lead to a fleshy palate that's full but with gaps. Blackberry, dark plum and cassis flavors are standard for quality Malbec from Mendoza, while this is chocolaty on a finish that doesn't evolve.

title: Veuve Doussot NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Pure Chardonnay gives a tight edge to the otherwise warm, rich fruitiness of this wine. Acidity integrates with the ripe yellow fruits to give a rich Champagne that is ready to drink now.

title: Vietti 2014 Ravera  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of truffle, dark spice, chopped mint and whiffs of oak lead the nose. It's austere and rather lean, showing dried cherry, clove and a hint of rust alongside assertive, close-grained tannins that leave a drying finish. Give the tannins several more years to unwind then drink sooner rather the later to capture the remaining fruit. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Weinreich 2017 Basisweiss Trocken Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen)
description: While light bodied and crisp, this is a silk-textured Grauburgunder offering loads of juicy pineapple and tangerine flavors. It's a dry, easy-drinking sip but nuanced by hints of waxy apple and peanut shell. The finish is vibrantly fresh.

title: Raymond 2015 LVE Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a burly blend of 65% Petite Sirah and 35% Merlot. Brimming in jammy blackberry and black cherry, it has a touch of clove and cinnamon within its folds of soft plush fruit.

title: Roger Champault & Fils 2017 Les Pierris  (Sancerre)
description: From a densely planted vineyard, this soft wine has ripe pink-grapefruit and taut lime flavors, with a strongly mineral texture. It is very much up front, and needs time to settle. Drink from 2019.

title: Rubus 2015 Icono Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Baked berry and earthy plum aromas are dense and meaty. A raw, choppy palate shows aggression and tannic bite. Snappy black plum and wild berry flavors finish with inward pull along with lasting notes of mint and oak.

title: Salvano 2015  Barbaresco
description: Earthy aromas of tilled soil, game and a whiff of dark berry lead the nose. The straightforward palate presents raspberry jam, clove and white pepper alongside taut tannins that lead to a grippy finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)
description: From the estate's Dwarf Oak Vineyard, this bottling shows rounded red cherry, pomegranate, fruit punch and cinnamon stick on the nose. It's lean and racy with high acid on the palate, proving tart with a compelling texture although not much strong flavor on the palate.

title: Schlink Haus 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: The nose suggests more earth and mineral than fruit but the palate here is fresh and fruity, boasting juicy tangerine and white grapefruit. Approachable and easy-drinking, it's an off-dry wine that finishes on a touch of spice and pepper.

title: Schloss Saarstein 2017 Auslese Grosse Lage Riesling (Mosel)
description: There's a dark, earthen tone that permeates throughout this deep gold Auslese. Dried apricot and yellow raisin flavors on the palate are delicately sweet and accented by savory notes of saffron and dusty minerality. Laser-like beams of acidity lend levity and grace to a moderately long finish.

title: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei 2016 Brut Klassik Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Slightly floral, slightly melony notes hail bright freshness from the first sniff. The rather frothy, fizzy palate is easy, light and mild, with a rather generous dosage that bolsters the easy stone fruit and lemon notes. The finish is dry and fresh.

title: Stolpman 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Ballard Canyon)
description: Fresh lime and wet stone meet with reductive grassy aromas and a touch of pear on the nose of this bottling. It's very tangy on the palate, showing citrus and apple cider elements.

title: Tenuta Carretta 2014 Garassino  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of dark berry, leather and underbrush emerge from the glass. The savory medium-bodied palate offers blackberry jam, star anise and black pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2016 Classico Vigna Casalj Catarratto (Alcamo)
description: Aromas of mature orchard fruit, spring blossom and Mediterranean scrub lead the nose. On the tangy palate, a hint of bay leaf accents honeydew melon and citrus. A saline note signals the close.

title: The Originals 2017 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of lime leaf, green flower and herb lead to just off-dry drinking white peach flavors. It brings textural heft and intrigue.

title: Theorize 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This white has a Muscat-like quality, a sweetness of peach, fig and apricot that's exotic and pronounced. Jasmine plays expertly on the nose.

title: Trivento 2016 Golden Reserve Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Pulpy aromas of blackberry, cassis, fig and pastry show a mineral streak. This feels solid and chewy, with spongy tannins. Standard black fruit flavors are normal for Mendoza Malbec, while this is weighty in feel and tastes of blackberry on the finish.

title: Trudon NV Roséphile Brut Pinot Meunier (Champagne)
description: Jérôme Trudon's crisp, red-currant-flavored rosé balances freshness with a bright character. Its fruit is still young and full of eager acidity. Another few months will make it even better. Drink from 2019.

title: V. Testulat NV Carte d'Or Brut  (Champagne)
description: Half Pinot Noir, half Pinot Meunier, this is in effect a Blanc de Noirs. It has intense acidity, with green-apple flavors and a tight, nervy texture that suggests the bottling is still young. To bring out more maturity, keep until mid-2019.

title: Vignobles Berthier 2017  Sancerre
description: This fruity wine is attractively textured and crisp, with a strong mineral edge that gives a bit of bite. Full of red-currant flavors and with final acidity, it will be better from 2019.

title: Villa Matilde 2014 Tenute di Altavilla  (Taurasi)
description: Forest floor, black-skinned berry and dark spice aromas slowly appear in the glass. On the tight, assertive palate, close-grained, drying tannins accompany blackberry extract, prune and licorice alongside firm acidity. It closes on a note of powdered sage.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2016 Encanto Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Ripe blackberry and cassis aromas are lusty and bring a note of oaky clove as this opens. A bold bright palate is juicy and rugged. Grapy black-fruit flavors are toasty, while the barrel influence is strongest on the finish, which tastes of clove, chocolate and oak spice.

title: Vollereaux NV Brut Réserve  (Champagne)
description: This nonvintage cuvée, a blend of equal parts of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier, is ripe, soft and ready to drink. Creamed apples are balanced with acidity, a rounded texture and a warm aftertaste.

title: No Girls 2015 La Paciencia Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The aromas pop in notes of sea breeze, dried nori, flower, wet stone, peat, white pepper and strawberry, showing a lot of complexity. The palate is elegant but intensely flavorful. A smoked meat finish carries as long as you care to count, kicking it up a notch.

title: Bründlmayer NV Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Reserve Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: A rich tone of baked apple fills both nose and palate. Yeasty development is expressed as buttery patisserie notes, while lemony brightness lends a fresh, vivid aspect. The fizz is fine and very creamy. This is rich in its slenderness, opulent in stone fruit and flavor and yet ultrafresh. The long finish brims with ripe lemon. Drink now–2025.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Reserve

title: Archery Summit 2015 Summit Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A portion was fermented in concrete, which adds some interesting texture to the mouthfeel. The rest, done in small open-top fermenters, contributes light hints of leaf and stem. It's a complex and palate-thrilling mix of citrus, berry, Bing cherry and breakfast tea, beautifully balanced and long.

title: Barons de Rothschild 2008 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This vintage Blanc de Blancs completes what is now a full range produced for all the Rothschild family-owned properties in Bordeaux. It is full of minerality as well as crisp intensity. The fruit is almost mature while still fresh and tangy. This textured Champagne will be best from 2020.

title: Bergström 2016 Bergström Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery's top cuvée is sourced from the original 1999 plantings. Intensely aromatic with complex suggestions of toast, spice and sandalwood, this is a wine to explore at length. The red and blue berry fruit flavors are framed with citrusy acidity, and the extended finish somehow conjures up salted caramel. It's a bit lighter and lower in alcohol than the 2015, but in terms of complexity and stylish detail, it's its equal.

title: Deutz 2010 Parcelles d'Aÿ Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: A new concept from this Aÿ-based producer, this wine showcases pure Pinot Noir from some of its finest parcels. The wine has weight and richness while not losing sight of elegance. The fruit is just beginning to mature, showing a crisp texture while promising a broader vision in the future. Drink from 2021.

title: Diamond Creek 2015 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Soy, tobacco and dried herb mark this appropriately named wine, which does indeed have a gravelly, chalky aspect to its texture and taste. From a five-acre vineyard block of the estate, it is endlessly complex and nuanced, despite its full-bodied richness and concentration.

title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2016 Le Clos  (Vouvray)
description: Organically grown grapes from a single parcel go into this resplendent wine. Touched lightly by wood but much more focused on honey and apple, spice and intense acidity, the wine is ripe, peppery and set to age. Drink from 2022.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2012 Feudi Studi Rosamila  (Taurasi)
description: This opens with compelling aromas evoking pipe tobacco, Asian spice, blue flower, leather, menthol and baked plum. It's firmly structured, offering dried black cherry, blackberry, licorice, nutmeg and crushed aromatic herb. Fine-grained, velvety tannins give it grip as well as elegance. Drink 2022–2037.

title: Foxen 2016 Block 8 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This block-designated wine is intense in hearty aromas of black raspberry, dried mint and loamy earth. Spiced cake and sharp purple-flower flavors arise on the palate, but it's the dark, penetrating and focused boysenberry and dark-fruit flavors that command attention. Drink 2019–2036.

title: Foxen 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's an impressive array of aromas on the nose of this bottling, starting with light red cherry and pomegranate before intensifying into boysenberry jam with loads of star anise and dried ginger along the way. The mouthfeel is full, carrying boysenberry-jam flavors laced with sandalwood, myrrh and anise.

title: Foxen 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A bowlful of ripe red fruits, hibiscus and sharp cinnamon-laced potpourri make for an inviting nose to this single-vineyard expression. Bright acidity cuts through flavors of tart raspberry, pomegranate and baking spice on the taut palate, which is light in body but loaded with flavor. Drink 2020–2032.

title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Avize Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This explosive, ripe wine is part of a trilogy that the producer has made from three of the greatest villages in Champagne. This tense, mineral-driven wine is rich with white fruits. It is still young, so wait until 2020.

title: Franz Keller 2016 Franz Anton Schwarzer Adler Pinot Noir (Baden)
description: Pristine, pure fruit abounds in this exceptionally fresh, invigorating red. Crisp red-cherry and -plum flavors are accented by crushed minerals, blossoms and tobacco. Full bodied and plump in mouthfeel, it's balanced by fresh acidity and a hint of ash reminiscent of the Kaiserstuhl's volcanic origins. Lovely already, it should gain depth and complexity through 2030.

title: La Badina 2013  Lessona
description: Enticing aromas of wild berry, white pepper, blue flower and menthol mingle together on this linear fragrant red. Reflecting the nose, the precise vibrant palate offers strawberry compote, crushed raspberry, aromatic herb and baking spice framed in taut, elegant tannins and bright acidity. It's all about finesse and balance, and will age and continue to develop for years. Drink 2020–2033.

title: Mumm Napa 2013 DVX Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: Made from just a bit more Pinot Noir than Chardonnay, this is a lovely, complex and memorable wine, elegantly round and lengthy on the palate. A fleshiness of tangerine, peach and cherry complement the bright persistent acidity that has had time to mellow and integrate in the bottle.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Big but very agile, this full-bodied wine balances great fruit acidity with equally great richness in terms of ripe Anjou pear flavors and an almost thick, mouth-coating texture. The appearance has a faint green highlight in the yellow gold color, the aroma has toasted oak, butterscotch and apple, while the flavors nearly flood the palate with toasted almond, cream and baked pear.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Amazingly inviting aromas of rounded red cherry, wet slate, loam, vanilla, cracked pepper and dried herb show on the intense nose of this classic single-vineyard expression. Framed by sandy, nearly gritty tannins and a buoyant acidity, the flavors of ripe black cherry, tangy blackberry and wild herbs will only intensify with time. Drink 2019–2032.

title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Floral aromas lead to a ripe generously structured Port. The tannins may be firm but they are also rich bringing black-cherry fruits along with them. This is a wine with excellent potential. Drink from 2027.

title: Ramey 2015 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a well-made wine from several sites, including Cole Creek, Rodgers Creek and Alegria, all vineyard-designates of their own. Together, they sizzle in floral lavender, smoke and gamy meat. The Syrah is cofermented with 6% Viognier. The body is concentrated in ripeness and grip; let it mellow in the cellar and enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Ninth Island NV Sparkling Rosé Sparkling (Tasmania)
description: Ninth Island is the second label of the well-respected Piper's Brook, and its fizz is made by Natalie Fryar, the winemaker behind Jansz. This pink sparkler is made from Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier. Delicate notes of yeast, green apple, strawberry and watermelon rind are woven into a palate that's creamy in texture but buoyed by a bright line of acidity and lively bubbles.

title: Novy 2015 G-S-M (Sonoma Valley)
description: This blends 36% Syrah, 23% Mourvèdre, 22% Viognier and 19% Grenache. A beautiful perfume of violet opens the proceedings, followed by white pepper, garrigue, lavender and meat. A high-toned midpalate tames the wine's richer, riper leanings that takes on a robust taste of strawberry leather before pepper comes back to dot the finish.

title: Patrice Moreux 2017 Corty Artisan Les Monts Damnés  (Sancerre)
description: This wine is all about fresh, tangy and grassy fruit. With a distinct texture and strong minerality, it is tight and needs to age. It comes from one of the top vineyards in Sancerre. Drink from 2020.

title: Pflüger 2017 Quarzit Trocken Sauvignon Blanc (Pfalz)
description: An intensely aromatic, invigorating wine with notes of freshly cut grass, lime zest and smoke. The palate is fresh and pristine, offering loads of cutting gooseberry and lime flavors. Offers all the vibrant fruit of New World Sauvignon Blanc but is more sprightly and mineral in character.

title: Pommery NV Brut Apanage  (Champagne)
description: This bottling has some age to it, giving a toasty wine with a crisp texture. Nearly four years before disgorging has given it a mature sheen that has balanced the ripe fruit and enhanced a more mineral element. Drink now.

title: Quinta dos Murças 2016 Margem Red (Douro)
description: From vertical vineyards that run straight up the hillside, an innovation in the mountainous Douro, this ripe blend of Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca is rich in tannins as well as black fruits. It has a firm texture that boasts a black plum flavor, bright acidity and a hint of wood aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Quinta S. Joao Batista 2015 Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon Red (Tejo)
description: This stylish wine shows the quality of the two grapes in the blend. They both contribute perfumed black fruits and rich tannins that give this powerful wine both density and concentration. The wine needs to age, so drink from 2020.

title: Richard Hamilton 2016 Little Road Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This plump, juicy wine offers notes of blueberry, plum, milk chocolate and cracked black pepper. The fruit on the palate is ripe but well balanced by chewy, savory tannins and a meaty, peppery finish.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Royal Punishers Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Brown sugar, red berry, lavender and a touch of heat mark this velvety thick and smoothly tannic wine, a hearty showcase of the variety. Complex and interwoven in oak, it finishes in bits of black and white pepper.

title: Schild Estate 2015 Moorooroo Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: This is an open, savory Shiraz from vines planted in 1847. Intriguing notes of soy sauce, rare beef and a strong vegetal component are more in focus than the plummy fruit. The palate is supple in feel, with taut, grainy tannins. Drink now–2028.

title: Sketchbook 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This is a delicious and substantial wine that emphasizes subtlety and structure, while slowly revealing fruity, spicy and savory elements with each sip. It has reserved pear and almond aromas that carry to a palate accented by ripe peach, vanilla and cream. The texture is viscous and holds everything together.

title: Stoller 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This is a lightly minty, fruity and forward wine of medium concentration. Aging in 30% new French oak brings up sweet baking spices around blueberry and cherry fruit. Drinking well already, it should improve through 2024.

title: Talisman 2014 Adastra Vineyard Méthode Ancienne Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Exotic in aroma and grainy in texture, this tiny-production wine excites in its thick layers of crisp and crunchy tang of fruit, which spans from pomegranate to wild strawberry to boysenberry. Layers of cola add a richness that trails on the finish.

title: Terredora Di Paolo 2012 Fatica Contadina  (Taurasi)
description: Underbrush, mature black-skinned fruit and culinary spice aromas lead the nose. The dense palate offers dried blackberry, prune, licorice and powdered sage set against close-grained tannins. Drink 2020–2032.

title: Viaggio 2014 The President Merlot (Lodi)
description: Touches of dried herbs and black olives in the aromas and flavors give an authentic appeal to this full-flavored and full-bodied wine. A hint of spicy oak enhances the experience but doesn't overwhelm the fruity, savory aspects that are so enjoyable.

title: Jean Laurent 2006 Blanc de Blancs Millésime Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This crisp, textured wine still offers great freshness. Its acidity and taut white fruits are zesty, hinting at toastiness and with a fine texture. It is an elegant wine, ready to drink.

title: Niner 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)
description: This bottling from the extremely coastal Jespersen Ranch shows what a truly cool climate can do for Sauvignon Blanc. It's tightly woven but approachable on the nose, with aromas of honeydew, kiwi and wet stone. The palate is incredibly zippy, offering chalky flavors of apple and pear. A lime rind tartness holds the finish.

title: Voirin-Jumel NV Grand Brut Brut Zéro Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: As its name indicates, this is a bone-dry wine. Richness counterbalances the dryness, delivering ripe white fruits, intense citrus as well as a intensely mineral texture. Drink this bottling now.
designation: Grand Brut Brut Zéro Blanc de Blancs

title: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2015 Agnès Sorel  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: This is a ripe, smoky wine, with soft tannins and swathes of red fruits. It is still young, with a stalky character, but it will fill out as it matures because the weight and the tannins are very present. Drink from 2020. It is named after a mistress of King Charles VII of France.

title: Lallier NV Grand Rosé Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: Made of a blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, all from Grand Cru vineyards, this wine is balanced, with a tight texture as well as ripe berry fruits. Its acidity and minerality are balanced by the richness of the wine and its generous aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Portal 2016 Quinta dos Muros Vintage  (Port)
description: Perfumed berry fruits and ripe tannins give the wine great attractiveness. At the same time, tannins give the aging potential. It is rich, packed with dark fruits and firmly structured. Drink this wine from 2028.

title: Rivetto 2012 Leon Riserva  (Barolo)
description: This full-bodied red opens with aromas of ripe black-skinned fruit, dark spice, new leather, forest floor and balsamic notes. On the firm palate, assertive, close-grained tannins support dried Marasca cherry, licorice, chopped aromatic herb and a hint of espresso before a rather drying finish. Drink 2021–2030.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: From a site that sits at 1,600-feet in elevation, this wine is rich, round and ripe, as well as slightly reduced, and tightly wound in its youth. Leather, graphite and diesel wrap around a peppery, exotic core of dark chocolate and brambly blackberry that's ever changing in the glass. Enjoy best 2026–2030.

title: Ruby 2015 Flora's Reserve Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: One senses a bit of friendly competition between the husband (Steve of Steve's Reserve) and wife (Flora) who own this property. The nod in 2015 goes to Flora, for this elegant, sophisticated wine with old vine grace and detail. A cascade of aromas and following flavors trail orange peel, honey, plum, cherry, chocolate and sweet spices. The texture and length are superb, with fine balance throughout.

title: Ruinart 2004 Dom Ruinart Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is a classic style, ripe with a relatively high dosage and a mature taste. Its color shows maturity while the fruitiness has been transformed into a splendid nutty, toasty wine with attractive acidity and a soft aftertaste. Drink this rich wine now.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Home Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A longtime farming family debuts the first wines of its own with this impressively lush, plush white, tropical in flavor and seasoned in vanilla oak. Expansive on the palate, it manages to uphold tight, firm acidity throughout.

title: Shea 2016 Shea Vineyard West Hill Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a mix of Pommard and Dijon 115 clones, 18% whole cluster fermented, and aged in 60% new French oak. It's a ripe mouthful of blackberry and black cherry, backed with ample acidity and beautifully managed tannins. As it rolls into a lengthy finish more flavors compound—black olives, toast, coffee, chocolate and, finally, black tea tannins. Drink now through the 2020s.

title: Siduri 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a steep vineyard near the eastern edge of the appellation, this effort by Santa Rosa-based Adam Lee offers composting rose petals, bright red cherry and a hint of game on the nose. There's a gamy kick to the palate as well, giving depth to the cherry and dried ginger flavors.

title: Thiénot 2007 Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millésimé Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Mainly Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs, this wine has a good balance between the maturing rich apple and green-plum fruits and the mineral texture. Notes of spice and yeastiness are coming through to give the wine a generous aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée Stanislas Blanc de Blancs Brut Millésimé

title: Thiénot 2008 Brut Vintage  (Champagne)
description: A blend of all three of the main Champagne grapes, this wine comes from an exceptional year in Champagne. It is showing some delicious maturity in its toastiness and cookie aromas. The fruit is now well integrated, still mineral but also with richness. Drink now.

title: Trisaetum 2016 Estates Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The reserve, compiled with grapes from all three estate vineyards, seems to have a higher percentage of new oak, showing plenty of sweet spice in the nose and on the palate. Blueberry and cherry flavors, along with highlights of malted chocolate, gather into a concentrated core. The finish is a long, lingering jaunt with a touch of spice cake. Drink now–2025.

title: Trisaetum 2016 Ribbon Ridge Estate Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: The mouthfeel on this wine is simply lovely, and the mix of purple and black fruits comes with sappy acidity. There's a streak of iron, reflecting the terroir of the Ribbon Ridge AVA, and tannins are firm and ripe and set up a lingering finish.

title: Wolff 2016 Petite Sirah (Edna Valley)
description: Cool-climate Petite Sirahs are an utter rarity, yet like cool-climate Syrah, they show an amazingly savory character when bottled. This wine starts with tar, peppercorn, cola-spice and boysenberry aromas that lead into a vibrant palate of pepper, roasted lamb and dark fruit. Energetic and fresh.

title: Matias Riccitelli 2017 Viñedos De Montaña Chardonnay (Uco Valley)
description: Minerally apple and stone fruit aromas are aided by fine oak. In the mouth, this excellent Chardonnay from Tupungato feels full and round but bolstered by ripping acidity. Flavors of nectarine, melon and honey are aided by rich oak notes, while this is lively on the finish. Drink through 2022.

title: Voirin-Jumel NV Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: From vines in top Côte des Blancs vineyards in Cramant and Chouilly, this wine is rich and strongly mineral. Swathes of apple and citrus fruits are wrapped into a well-structured, crisply textured wine. Drink the bottling now.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut

title: 1789 Wines 2014 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A limited personal project from De Ponte winemaker Isabelle Dutartre, this elegantly finessed wine reveals ripe raspberry and Bing cherry fruit, subtly backed with 30% new French oak. It's a lighter style in the best possible way, and yet sturdy enough for long-term cellaring. Drink now–2030 and beyond.

title: Anne Amie 2015 Two Estates Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Aged as before for 16 months in 38% new oak, this is dense and detailed, though clearly still in a primary phase and pulling itself together. Sassafras, brambly fruit and baking spices are all in the mix, with a touch of hot pepper candy in the finish. Drink 2020 to 2030.

title: Archery Summit 2015 Premier Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Aromatically lovely, this sappy, juicy wine is loaded with ripe, late-summer berry flavors. It's concentrated and lingering, in a most delicious style, with the complexity and pure power of the vintage. Drink now through 2025.

title: Barons de Rothschild NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Pure Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs makes up this intense wine. Its tight texture and mineral character are shot through with white fruits topped by citrus. This is a well-balanced wine, elegant and ready to drink.

title: Bellacosa 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Blessed with 3% Petit Verdot, this wine represents the appellation with class and style, showing lush, smooth layers of crowd-pleasing complexity. With underlying elegance and a sense of balance, it offers red and black-cherry flavors alongside richer teases of mocha and tobacco.

title: Lynmar 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This delicious appellation wine is a tremendous testament to all it has to offer, from juicy strawberry and blueberry fruit to savory edges of black tea and cardamom. It excels in its depth of evolved flavor and complex balance and approachability.

title: Lynmar 2016 Summit Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has an ethereal quality to it, buoyed by thickets of bright citrus, pomegranate and strawberry. Full bodied, it retains a heightened grip of acidity that remains beneath earthy characteristics of forest floor and clove.

title: Melville 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Red cherry, dried rose petal and cinnamon-spiced melon show on the unique and alluring nose in this bottling. The palate offers a complex blend of earth and fruit, combining sour cherry with wild thyme, red flowers and dried sage.

title: Pali 2016 Huber Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a vineyard planted in 1986, this twist-top bottling is fresh and lovely, starting with aromas of grapefruit pith, nectarine, Pink Lady apple, orange and chalky minerality. The sip is bright, energetic and snaps with flavors of tangerine, chilled peach and light hazelnut, all wrapped in citrusy freshness and taut tension.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Indigène  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: As the name suggests, this wine is made using natural yeasts. It comes from a parcel in the small village of Tracy, close to the Loire river. The wine is ripe and full of fruit, with a tangy, orange-zest aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Pflüger 2016 Dürkheimer Spielberg Trocken Riesling (Pfalz)
description: Dry in style yet luscious and ripe, this full-bodied Riesling offers layers of juicy grapefruit and yellow peach flavors. It's creamy and rounded on the palate yet balanced by smoke, slate and crushed mineral as well as zesty lemon-lime acidity. The finish lingers on notes of peach and apricot. Enjoy now through 2024.

title: Quinta de Roriz 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This finely perfumed wine has ripe tannins and rich fruit. It is full of berry flavors, supported by a dry structure and acidity, all well packaged into a complex texture that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2028.

title: Quinta do Passadouro 2016 Passadouro Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine is floral with great fruit that is tending to dominate the essential tannins. That suggests a wine that will be drinkable earlier rather than later. It is certainly an attractive wine in a fruity way—ripe potentially sweet. Drink this wine from 2027.

title: Quinta Santa Eufemia 2016 Casa Santa Eufêmia Vintage  (Port)
description: Perfumed and structured, the wine sums up the quality of this ripe vintage. It is a drier style but its tannins are generous while also firm. This is a wine that will come together into a rich, luscious Port. Drink from 2028

title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2016 Talentus Vintage  (Port)
description: Packed with tannins, this is fully structured wine. Its dark texture and sweet berry fruits are cut with acidity and still touched by the spirit. It is sure to come together well to give a wine that is rich, fruity and structured for the long term. Drink from 2029.

title: Richard Böcking 2015 M Schlossberg Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: This sprightly medium-sweet Riesling bolts and darts on the palate with penetrating flavors of sweet tangerine, lemon and honey. It's such a zesty wine, yet is intensely juicy and fruity, too. A dense backbone of crushed slate and stone lends complexity and verve to the finish.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Grande Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Farmed by the grande dame Dorothy Rossi, this wine opens with a touch of matchstick reduction and smoky wood. Rustic, concentrated layers of leather, tobacco and crushed rock provide a savory core of depth and complexity, buoyed by a richness of graham cracker and blackberry jam.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2013 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Extremely concentrated, flavorful and full bodied, this brawny wine has an inky dark color, exotic aromas of cedar, clove and blackberry followed by dense, ripe fruit flavors and mouth-coating tannins. It will be fun to drink soon with a fatty chop or steak but will easily age and improve through at least 2023.

title: Ryan Cochrane 2016 Solomon Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Steely on the nose, this always impressive bottling by a San Francisco accountant-turned-winemaker shows delicate aromas of lime blossom, chalk, sea salt, Asian pear and blanched almond. There is a tense grip to the palate and laser-sharp acidity, delivering flavors of lime sorbet and nectarine with a flash of light marshmallow on the deep finish.

title: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2016 La Léontine  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Named after grandmother Léontine, this wine is made to be aged. It is still maturing, hinting at fullness to come. Spice and generous apple flavors are cut with acidity and a rich texture. As the develops further, it will fill out and become more powerful. Drink from 2019.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Rosso  (Etna)
description: Star anise, violet, crushed herb and Mediterranean brush aromas align with a whiff of crushed stone. It's silky smooth, offering juicy raspberry, wild strawberry, dark spice and white pepper framed in lithe, polished tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance while a flinty mineral note energizes the finish. Drink through 2026.

title: Townley 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Perfumed and floral in rose petal, this is a soft, supple and plush red with ample acidity to support and complement the texture. Strawberry, rhubarb, clove and black tea are met by a rewarding dash of white pepper.

title: Trapiche 2014 Terroir Series Finca Coletto Single Vineyard El Parel Malbec (Uco Valley)
description: The stout, concentrated nose is packed with berry fruit but also shows a slightly wild side that's rustic and suggestive of animal hide. The acidity is a bit bracing, carrying flavors of dark plum, currant and blackberry. Jam and chocolate finish with mellow tannins. Drink through 2022.
designation: Terroir Series Finca Coletto Single Vineyard El Parel

title: Vermeil 2015 XXXIV Frediani Vineyard Red (Calistoga)
description: This blends 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc, 23% Zinfandel and 14% Petite Sirah. Together, they harmonize into one whole of broad, leathery and complex texture and flavor. There's both softness and grip beneath the dark-black fruit and peppery spice.

title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2008 La Grande Dame Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Veuve Clicquot's prestige cuvée is a ripe, mature wine. With toastiness coming from soft fruit and a rich textured character, it is a classic of this producer's ripe style. The wine's acidity and crisp edge make a good contrast to the full-bodied character. Drink now.

title: Silver Thread 2016 STV Estate Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: A delightfully integrated nose of canned peach, yellow apple and potpourri spice translates to the rounded yet succulent palate. It's juicy and persistent in feel, with a healthy vein of acidity that extends the floral finish.

title: Tenuta Carretta 2012 Bordino  (Barbaresco)
description: This has a shy nose that eventually reveals baking spice and dark-skinned-fruit aromas. The straightforward palate delivers dried black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside round tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Tenute Sella 2016 Orbello Red (Coste della Sesia)
description: A blend of Nebbiolo, Barbera, Croatina, Vespolina and a drop of Cabernet Sauvignon, this bright red has aromas of wild berry, baking spice, aromatic herb and a whiff of scorched earth. The taut medium-bodied palate offers dried cherry, ground pepper and a hint of star anise alongside polished tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2021.

title: Terragena 2017 Abbassi Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From a single site, this is a saignée of wine that is stainless-steel fermented and retentive in high-toned acidity. Peach-skin and lemon-peel flavors highlight a dry austere style that doesn't overwhelm.

title: Ulithorne 2016 Dona Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: Sun-drenched plums and cherry-chocolate cake lead in this wine. It's also a little floral and woody. Chalky tannins and earthy notes are lifted by bright acidity on the palate, but overall this wine is tightly wound and relatively austere.

title: Upsidedown 2016 The Artist Collection Dead Poplar Estate Vineyard Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is a blend of Mourvèdre (55%) and Grenache. The aromas of white pepper, herb and red cherry seem quite reticent out of the gate. The red and black fruit flavors are on the lighter side of medium bodied, tapering toward the finish. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.
designation: The Artist Collection Dead Poplar Estate Vineyard

title: Villa Wolf 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Pfalz)
description: A delicate pale-pink color, this easy-drinking Pinot Noir rosé offers pleasant whiffs of watermelon, red cherry and a hint of smoky mineral. Raspberry and red cherry flavors are framed by refreshing acidity and a slight grip of tannins. Enjoy now.

title: Vincent Grall 2017  Sancerre
description: Lively acidity and crisp fruits mark out this attractive wine. It conveys citrus and bright lemon fruitiness, with a fresh aftertaste. Drink this lightly textured wine now.

title: Vollereaux NV Grande Réserve Brut  (Champagne)
description: A young wine, this is tangy and zesty, with a taut aftertaste. It also has a rich edge, offering ripe white fruits shot with citrus. Refreshing now, this magnum bottling will be better from 2019.

title: Wit's End 2016 Luna Chardonnay (McLaren Vale)
description: Lemon verbena, ginger tea, candied pineapple and dried flower tones are complemented by prickly acidity and slight tannic bite. It's not varietally typical, but in many ways, that's what makes it likable.

title: Forget-Brimont NV Grand Rosé Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This strawberry-flavored wine that comes from Premier Cru vineyards is crisply textured, with an appealing tang of acidity. Young and fresh with a soft aftertaste, it is ready to drink.

title: Ca'Romè 2013 Rio Sordo Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Subtle aromas of underbrush and camphor emerge from the glass. The firm palate delivers licorice, roasted coffee bean and cranberry alongside bracing, somewhat astringent tannins.

title: Castroviejo 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Raisiny aromas of prune juice and vanilla lead to a chunky, weighty palate that's almost syrupy. Blackberry, prune and raisin flavors are a touch soupy on a finish with low acidity. Drink now.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2015 Finca Torrea  (Rioja)
description: Ripe berry and raisin aromas are desiccated and jammy. An edgy tannic palate deals flavors of raisin, prune, toast and black pepper, while a short but dense finish confirms that this is a ripe modern-style Tempranillo.

title: Alain Girard et Fils 2017 Domaine des Brosses Sécrets des Tronbochards  (Sancerre)
description: This crisp and fruity wine is lightly herbal. It also offers lemon and gooseberry flavors along with considerable acidity. The aftertaste reveals a richer side that shows concentration. Drink now.
designation: Domaine des Brosses Sécrets des Tronbochards

title: Barfontarc NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Made with Chardonnay from the Aube, this offers ripe fruits, with apples and crisp pears dominant. A warm, fruity Champagne, it's lightly textured and rich, with a mineral edge at the end. Drink now.

title: Benanti 2016 Rosso Contrada Monte Serra  (Etna)
description: Wild berry, rose, nutmeg and French oak aromas slowly take shape in the glass. The lean palate recalls the nose, evoking raw sour cherry, star anise and a hint of powdered sage alongside racy acidity. Close-grained tannins give it a firm, somewhat astringent finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Besserat de Bellefon NV Cuvée des Moines Brut  (Champagne)
description: The standard nonvintage cuvée from this excellent producer, this is on the dry side. However rich fruit balances the wine between dryness and a soft texture. It is ready to drink.

title: Boizel NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: A blend from Premier and Grand Cru vineyards, this wine is finely textured with attractive apple flavors and a line of minerality. It has plenty of fruitiness although the aftertaste is dry. Drink now.

title: Cantine Povero 2015 Batù  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of dark fruit, baking spice and underbrush emerge from the glass. The linear palate offers sour cherry, clove and nutmeg alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2021.

title: Biondi 2016 Outis Rosso  (Etna)
description: This fragrant, exquisite red has captivating scents of wild red berry, rose petal, white pepper and menthol and a smoky mineral note. The linear, racy palate is all about finesse, delivering flavors of strawberry, red raspberry, star anise, crushed mint and graphite. It's ethereally elegant and well balanced, with vibrant acidity and polished tannins. It's not for everyone, but lovers of finesse will be in ecstasy. Drink through 2028.

title: Barão de Vilar 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: The structured tannins of this wine shine through the powerful fruits, holding the promise of excellent aging. It is a firm style of wine that is lifted by vibrant fruit flavors. Opulent, bold and ripe, drink from 2028.

title: Billecart-Salmon 2006 Cuvée Nicolas François Brut  (Champagne)
description: Named after the founder of the house, Nicolas François Billecart (who married Elisabeth Salmon), this wine is now at its peak. It is poised between fresh apple fruits and broader, riper maturity. This balance gives a ripe wine hinting at toast and almonds while still with a dry aftertaste. Drink now, although in 2019 it will be even better.

title: Domaine Serene 2016 Evenstad Reserve Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: This is one of the finest Evenstad Reserves to date, bringing a stunningly good mix of tree fruits nuanced by barrel flavors of butterscotch and toasted hazelnut. It all leads into a sappy, cinnamon-inflected finish that lingers gracefully and promises to age well through 2025.

title: Lima Smith 2016 Tecedeiras Vintage  (Port)
description: While the wine is floral, its perfumed fruits are seriously balanced by the dark and ripe tannins. It has a strongly mineral edge that goes with great black-currant fruit that give an edge of freshness to this otherwise dark, powerful wine. Drink from 2027.

title: Quinta do Vesuvio 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a jammy, ripe and deeply rich wine. Its firm tannins are fully integrated with the powerful black fruits to give a wine with great potential longevity. The end has an almost fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2027.

title: Domaine Divio 2016 Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: A bright aroma of raspberry jam underscores a core of wet rock. There's a light saline note of oyster shell on the palate, with well-rounded flavors of rich cherry and chocolate that extend through the finish. Though it may sound like an odd mix, this is flat-out delicious.

title: Archery Summit 2015 Looney Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This nonestate vineyard allows the winery to play with outstanding grapes from this exceptional AVA. Well-proportioned and bursting with details of nutmeg, cinnamon and red licorice, the Looney enchants with a supple core of black cherry fruit, chocolate and espresso.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Scharzhofberger Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Hints of sun-kissed honeydew and white peach are inviting on the nose of this delicate, sweet Riesling. The palate is rich and fruity, offering intensely concentrated stone-fruit and tangerine flavors marked by a salty, mineral tang that lingers on the finish. It's lovely already, balanced by sprightly acidity, but is sure to develop beautifully through 2030.

title: Boffa 2015 Ovello  (Barbaresco)
description: Intense aromas of rose petal, red berry, forest floor and mint emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and white pepper. It's well balanced, with fine-grained tannins and bright acidity. Drink 2021–2030.

title: Château de Tracy 2015 Haute Densité  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine comes from a densely planted vineyard, with nearly 7,000 vines per acre. Low yields and superripe fruit have yielded a concentrated wine, intense with white fruits and acidity. Age this wine until 2019, to let its richness mature.

title: G. H. Mumm NV RSRV Maison Mumm Cuvée 4+5 Brut  (Champagne)
description: This blend brings together all five of the main regions that supply grapes for Mumm Champagnes. It indicates the increased quality from this venerable producer. With a balance between dry acidity and ripe white fruits, it is poised and elegant, ready to drink now.

title: Guastaferro 2013 Primum  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of new leather, aromatic herb, exotic spice, prune and cocoa follow over to the palate along with cherry, prune and star anise. A backbone of assertive, fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity provides an age-worthy structure, while a tobacco note lingers on the close. Drink 2021–2033.

title: Louis Roederer 2011 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This wine is made from Chardonnay from the Côte des Blancs. The well-balanced palate is textured and mineral driven, with a crisp white-fruit flavor that comes together well. This can be enjoyed now, although it will be better from 2020.

title: Martha's Wines 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a balanced wine with both great ripe black fruits and some serious tannins. Its structure and poise between sweetness and a dry edge give this wine fine potential. It is definitely going to age well. Drink from 2028.

title: Mastroberardino 2011 Radici Riserva  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of exotic spice, mature black-skinned berry, cocoa and sandalwood lead the way. The palate boasts a weightless concentration, doling out mature black cherry, Mediterranean herb, clove and brown pepper. Firm, refined tannins provide seamless support. Drink through 2031.

title: Quinta do Pôpa 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Packed with bold tannins as well as rich fruit, this is a concentrated wine that is coming into balance. The structure of the wine and its foursquare character are both indicators of a long-term future. Drink from 2027.

title: Rozes 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine is beautifully balanced with ripe tannins and powerfully dense fruit. Layers of blackberry fruits are contrasted with the big tannins and perfumed acidity. There is a mineral edge to this powerful wine that will allow it to age very well. Drink from 2028.

title: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's high-elevation, 225-acre site on Spring Mountain, this is mineral in crushed rock and sanguine characteristics, with a hit of graphite and black licorice. The fruit is subtle, a mix of black currant and plum wrapped in contrasting notes of cedar and mocha. Medium-bodied, it shows structure and elegance.

title: Steindorfer 2015 Cuvée Klaus Beerenauslese Pinot Blanc (Burgenland)
description: Earthy botrytis and a touch of maple syrup spice inform the lusciously rich, honeyed aromas. A spirity strength tingles on the nose. The palate streams across the tongue in generous sweetness, while spirit and spiky acidity counter this and leave you with a very lasting impression of barley sugar. Lemon and caramel are the chief markers that echo long after the last sip.

title: Robert Oatley 2016 G-S-M (McLaren Vale)
description: This is a polished and tightly wound blend that is savory and meaty in flavors of tart cranberry, hoisin sauce and cigar box. It's a medium- to full-bodied wine, wrapped in drying, chalky tannins, but ends on a fruity finish.

title: Ada Nada 2015 Valeirano  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of rose petal, red berry and underbrush emerge from the glass. The juicy palate delivers red cherry, crushed raspberry and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2028.

title: 50 Harvests 2014 Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Petit Verdot commemorates the number of consecutive harvests by the Scotto family of Steele Canyon Cellars. Candied red fruit gives it broad, lasting richness that lingers across the structured palate.

title: Adega Mayor 2016 Reserva do Commendador Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This wood-aged wine is deliciously spicy. Antão Vaz dominates the blend and lends both rich apple and citrus flavors as well as an opulent character. The wine is poised, balanced and is just ready to drink.

title: Attilio Ghisolfi 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: Wild rose, red berry, new leather and dried aromatic herb aromas lead the way. On the taut palate, firm acidity provides the backbone for sour cherry, cranberry, white pepper and star anise. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Au Contraire 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: While steely in acidity, this wine offers a counterbalance of fleshy pineapple and mango flavors. It finds a balance between both sides of the equation and also shows great integration with the oak.

title: Balletto 2017 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Meaty layers of wild strawberry, peach and cherry shine in this well-integrated wine. It's light in ripeness and entirely refreshing in acidity.
designation: Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of

title: Bedouet 2017 Clos des Grands Primos Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: From a single vineyard, this rich wine balances acidity, concentration, ripe creamed-apple fruits and minerality. The wine is generous while never losing its great crispness. Drink now.
designation: Clos des Grands Primos Sur Lie

title: Bergström 2016 Cumberland Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Cranberry and raspberry hold down the center of this blend, which serves as the entry point to the winery's extensive single vineyard portfolio. Citrus and herb flavors are well integrated, with just a hint of stem in the finishing tannins.

title: Bernardus 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: The 2016 vintage is strong for this well-established winery's Chardonnays, and this twist-top appellation blend is a more affordable way to indulge. Broad, fleshy aromas of ripe Asian pear, sea salt and nectarine tart lead into a rich palate that's rip with lemon and yellow pear but defined by penetrating acidity and decent tension.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Pommard Clone Estate Selection Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: A rose-tinged floral aroma opens this wine, giving way to a juicy expression of the grape that is velvety in texture and substantial in tannins. Black cherry and cassis flavors take on a liqueur-like richness, with a lingering tease of tobacco.

title: Ca' del Baio 2015 Vallegrande  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, cooking spice, leather and a balsamic note come together on this full-bodied red. The concentrated palate offers dried Marasca cherry, clove and licorice alongside youthfully firm tannins and rather fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2029.

title: Canard-Duchêne 2009 Authentic Vintage Brut  (Champagne)
description: The crisp, mineral Chardonnay in this wine is keeping it fresh and still young. With acidity and tight citrus flavors, it has a dense texture that dominates the white-stone fruits, suggesting it should age a little longer. Drink from 2020.

title: Canard-Duchêne NV Charles VII Blanc de Noirs Brut  (Champagne)
description: One of the pair of prestige cuvées from this producer, this wine is full of ripe fruits, with touches of tannin as well as minerality. Extra time in bottle before release has deepened the wine's richness and introduced some secondary flavors. Drink now.
designation: Charles VII Blanc de Noirs Brut

title: Case d'Alto 2012  Taurasi
description: Truffle, underbrush, leather, prune and exotic spice aromas lead the nose. The palate has a firm structure, offering dried Marasca cherry, bitter cocoa and star anise, as well as hints of oak. Drying, fine-grained tannins provide support.

title: Castello di Verduno 2012 Monvigliero Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of scorched earth, chopped aromatic herb, exotic spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol lead the nose. The tight structured palate shows dried morello cherry, star anise, leather and clove set against firm, close-grained tannins. Give the tannins time to unwind then drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit. Drink after 2022.

title: Castoro Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Very easy-to-like aromas of lemon rind, lime pith and light apple blossom make for a refreshing and pleasurable entry to this bottling. There is great grip to the sip, where wet cement minerality meets with grapefruit-juice flavors.

title: Coeur de Terre 2015 Renelle's Block Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Labeled Willamette Valley, but entirely estate-grown McMinnville AVA fruit, this is a bit on the chewy, tannic side, but has plenty of blackberry fruit power as well. Barrel aging adds brown spices and coffee accents, with a vein of cola running through the finish.

title: Col dei Venti 2015 Tufoblu  (Barbaresco)
description: Leather, cedar and dark berry aromas lead the nose. The taut palate offers sour cherry, tobacco and clove alongside chewy tannins. Drink 2022–2028.

title: Crosby Roamann 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: Big in luscious flavor and ample body and ripeness, this white shines in pear, honeysuckle and vanilla cream, fermented and aged in neutral French oak barrels. It is fleshy and well integrated, with a moderate streak of supportive acidity.

title: Jean Laurent NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Réserve Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Crisper than some other Laurent wines, this textured, mineral Chardonnay is full of acidity and citrus fruits with a poised character. A fresh aftertaste enhances the fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Jean-Michel Sorbe 2017  Quincy
description: This small vineyard region on the banks of the Cher river is devoted exclusively to Sauvignon Blanc. The producer, one of the top names in the area, has made a ripe, juicy and fruity wine. Richness balances the crisp citrus flavors and delicious tight acidity at the end. Drink now.

title: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2017 Les Villots Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This ripe rosé is balanced by good acidity. Raspberry fruits dominate along with a crisp texture and an intensely juicy and young aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Kilikanoon 2014 Exodus Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: Amidst plenty of ripe, almost raisined plums and berries is a strong character of charred wood, black olive, coffee and chocolate. The oak influences—from 18 months in French oak—dominates on the palate, threatening to drown out the ripe fruit. Give this some time before that settles. Drink 2020–2030.

title: La Berrière 2017 Sur Lie  (Muscadet Côtes de Grandlieu)
description: Soft, fruity and with open citrus and greengage flavors, this wine is lightly textured and ready to drink. It comes from vineyards around the Grandlieu lake just south of Nantes.

title: Love That Red 2015 Daily Double Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Garden herb, spice and cherry aromas lead to plum and herb flavors that trail on the finish. It doesn't all hang together.

title: Mandois NV Brut Zéro  (Champagne)
description: Although technically this is a Brut Zéro with no dosage, the soft and ripe fruits tells the palate otherwise. This wine is rich, with acidity and hints of maturity in play together. Drink this bottling now.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Thérèse Vineyards Victoria Denice Vineyard Carignane (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The wood-spice aromas are prominent on this bottling, starting with cigar box on the nose, alongside black-plum fruit. The palate also shows a lot of cedar as well as dark-plum and clove flavors.

title: Max Ferd. Richter 2016 Mülheimer Sonnenlay Zepplinlabel Riesling (Mosel)
description: Sunny tangerine and yellow apple flavors are forward and fruity here. It's a pristine, light-bodied wine with balanced sweetness. Fresh but moderate acidity and just a hint of minerality lend to its elegant but uncomplicated feel. Drink now.

title: Monte Volpe 2014 Sangiovese (Mendocino County)
description: Winemaker Greg Graziano put a smooth polish on this medium- to full-bodied wine, adding light oak-spice notes to good, ripe red- and black-cherry and black-olive flavors. A smooth, mouth-filling texture makes it soothing to sip.

title: Negro Giuseppe 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas of coconut, leather and camphor slowly take shape. The austere palate offers raw sour cherry, vanilla, espresso and nutmeg alongside tight, grainy tannins that leave a somewhat raspy finish.

title: Oso Libre 2014 Nativo Primitivo (Adelaida District)
description: Elegant baked fruit aromas and gingerbread spice make for a powerful entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate is ripe and rich with black currant, roasted berry and grilled fig flavors, dusted with ample baking spice, and cut by a slight acidity.

title: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2016 Alain Lorieux Expression  (Chinon)
description: This ripe smoky wine is full of red fruits layered with some firm tannins. It has spice, an open and deliciously juicy character, and a short-term aging potential. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: A blend from three vineyards, this rounded wine is rich in apple and green-plum flavors, with an edge of spiciness. It is rich enough to be ready to drink now.

title: Paul Buisse 2017 Clos du Gaimont Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Almonds, spice and great fruitiness all contribute to the success of this wine. Acidity keeps it bright while a honeyed edge entices. It is refreshingly ready to drink.

title: Piattelli 2014 Grand Reserve Limited Production Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Minty, cheesy oak notes dampen blackberry aromas and render the nose foresty. A full mouthfeel has its share of pulp, while this Malbec tastes spicy, chocolaty and herbal. Oak takes the reins on a finish that tastes toasty and a lot like chocolate.

title: Pierre Chainier 2017 Clos Chapon Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Even in this dry Chenin, a hint of honey accompanies the apple fruitiness. A ripe wine, it also has plenty of acidity and attractive layers of fruitiness and almonds, with a crisp texture at the end. Drink now.

title: Primarius 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The aromas of strawberry, herb, cinnamon stick and spice bring appeal. The palate shows an elegant style. The concentration doesn't always seem there, but what is delivers.

title: Proelio 2015 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: An almost-black color and savory, meaty aromas of black fruits and prune announce a saturated Tempranillo with syrupy weight and thickness. Charred flavors of burnt wood and slightly overripe black fruits finish with full tannins.

title: Quinta da Pacheca 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Aromas of geraniums give this wine a very perfumed character that dominates the fruit. It is perhaps all too much, not giving the dusty tannins and berry fruits any room to speak.

title: Bethel Heights 2016 Justice Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This sappy, silky, supple selection focuses on black fruits and blacker barrel flavors. Cherry, licorice, tar, char and espresso combine, all in proportion and without showing any burnt edges. The big ripe fruit packs a punch.

title: Bianchi 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Lavish aromas of vanilla and pound cake with a black-currant frosting show with a pinch of pepper on the inviting nose of this bottling. There is a great range of flavor on the palate, from boysenberry juice to potpourri to roasted meat, and it all rides strong acid across the lightly tannic structure.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 Ayler Kupp Spätlese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Exuberant fruit and spine-tingling acidity calibrate beautifully in this zesty, light-bodied Spätlese. Yellow cherry, peach and grapefruit flavors are luscious and penetrating on the palate. The finish lingers on notes of honey and lime. It's lovely already, but should improve through 2030.

title: Bodegas Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia 2014 Macán Clásico  (Rioja)
description: Rooty aromas of foresty berry fruits are not that bright or lively, maybe a reflection of 2014's rainy conditions? However, this remains deep and flush on the palate. Oaky berry flavors are a touch soft and mushy, again reflective of the year. Wood spice and bacon flavors on the finish are welcome; drink through 2025.
winery: Bodegas Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia

title: Borgogno 2013 Fossati  (Barolo)
description: Enticing scents of violet, rose and wild berry mingle with aromatic herb and menthol notes. On the polished, elegantly structured palate, refined tannins and vibrant acidity support sour cherry, strawberry, mint and star anise. It's still youthfully austere and needs a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2021–2028.

title: Castell 2015 Casteller Schlossberg Gold Cap Trocken GG Silvaner (Franken)
description: Hints of smoke and crushed earth juxtapose zesty herb and lemon on the nose here. It's a dry, full-bodied wine with a rich, textural mouthfeel and juicy white peach and yellow cherry flavors. Slightly warming on the finish but balanced by fresh acidity and a rim of delicate bitters.
designation: Casteller Schlossberg Gold Cap Trocken GG

title: Contino 2014 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry and oak aromas are not overly deep. On the palate, this is more defined, with lively acidity and popping fruit. Plum, spiced berry and currant flavors end with chocolaty oak, nutmeg and blueberry notes. Unlike most Contino wines, this one seems ready for near-term consumption; drink through 2024.

title: Cristom 2016 Marjorie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This vineyard has the lowest production and gets the most (75%) new French oak. Black fruits abound, with generous streaks of cola and mocha. The tannins are substantial, the mouthfeel a bit grainy, and there's a pleasing, chewy toasty character to the finish.

title: Crocker & Starr 2014 Bridesmaid Red (Napa Valley)
description: Sophisticated, dry and well structured, this Bordeaux-style blend from winemaker Pam Starr is big and flavorful while achieving good balance, too. It has perfumed oak aromas, opulent black-cherry and blackberry flavors, lots of velvety tannins for grip and enough concentration for a lingering finish.

title: Daou 2016 Unbound Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black currant and smashed black plum meet with crushed slate and turned loam on the deep and dark nose of this blend of 81% Petite Sirah, 14% Tannat and 5% Tempranillo. Thick with grippy but smooth tannins, and wrapped in a buoyant acidity, the brawny blend offers the darkest and driest of fruit flavors.

title: Davies 2016 Goorgian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a very flavorful, medium- to full-bodied wine that blends ripe black cherry and clove with hints of vanilla and cinnamon. Supportive fruit acidity and light tannins add structure for an appetizing mouthfeel.

title: De Ponte Cellars 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Richly fruity and lushly textured, this palate-coating Pinot offers a wealth of fruit flavors revolving around berry jam. Details of spice and nougat compound the finish, and a rather light touch of new French oak keeps everything in perfect proportion.

title: Domaine de la Combe 2016 Réserve Personelle Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This wine is from the oldest vines in this Gadais family vineyard. It is full and concentrated. After 14 months lees aging and waiting for a year before release, it is now ready to drink. Its combination of mineral, apple and citrus is delicious and rich.

title: Domaine Eden 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Like its bigger Mount Eden sister, this more affordable, usually more immediately accessible bottling needs time to open up. With patience, aromas of honeysuckle, oak and nuts provide a savory impression. The palate combines grapefruit pith and Meyer lemon rinds with savory salt and nuts.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2016 Les Romains  (Sancerre)
description: One of a series of single-vineyard wines from this producer, this wine's name is a reminder that the Romans were here. Produced from biodynamically grown grapes, the wine offers pure, strong acidity as well as intense white fruits. It is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Serene 2015 Abbey Oaks Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This is the winery's only vineyard outside of the Dundee Hills AVA, and it stands out for its aromatic blend of Asian spices, backed with a hint of graphite. The fruit touches on a cherry cola flavor—not a criticism at all—and the wine continues through a finish with excellent depth and texture.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This reserve white is tangled in tones of brioche and crème brûlée, with a bright shock of lively acidity that supports an underlying cradle of toasted oak. Stone, quince and a spark of lemon meringue add intrigue to the midpalate. Best 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard

title: Duck Pond 2016 Front Yard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Lovely aromas include a whiff of meat along with ripe berries, oranges and Bing cherries. This is the winery's most limited selection and saw the most new French oak, adding a pleasing toasty note to the finish. There's a suggestion of coffee grounds, and everything is already in good proportion. Drink now–2025.

title: Epiphany 2015 Revelation Rodney's Vineyard Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of 53% Syrah and 47% Grenache is well integrated on those nose with candied blackberry and lilac aromas. A chalky mouthfeel presents flavors of dark berry, cedar and slate on the palate, which is extremely well structured and should last for years. Drink now–2030.

title: Fera Mena 2015 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Stemmy and carbonic in nature, this wine exudes earthy forest, with bright, fresh up-front notes of strawberry, lemon and grapefruit peel. Light and on the precipice of ripeness, it dances that fine line well, offering up plenty of subtle flavor within a world of complexity.

title: Vistamar 2017 Brisa Carmenère (Central Valley)
description: Burnt aromas of tire rubber and creosote are forceful. On the palate, this is sturdy and seems fresh enough. Minty, herbal berry flavors are fiery and spicy on the finish.

title: ZinPhomaniac 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Strong smoky oaky aromas and flavors pervade this full-bodied wine, nearly covering the plummy, almost-sweet fruit flavors that lie underneath.

title: Calcu 2015 Reserva Especial Carmenère (Colchagua Valley)
description: Leafy berry aromas are lacking in purity, letting you know more or less where this is headed. A narrow palate is kind of scorching, while dark, medicinal black fruit flavors are peppery on a blazing finish.

title: Cantine di Ora 2017 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Light-bodied and simple, this has subdued aromas suggesting mature orchard fruit. Reflecting the nose, the informal palate evokes ripe yellow pear and a hint of dried pineapple before abruptly finishing on a bitter note.

title: Casas del Bosque 2016 Reserva Chardonnay (Casablanca Valley)
description: A gold color and a blowsy nose with oak but not much fruit or freshness form the opening to this shaky but decent Chardonnay. A chunky, pulpy palate and woody flavors of stale stone fruit and citrus finish with little more than a hint of vanilla.

title: Château Bois Malot 2016 Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This producer was over-enthusiastic with wood aging. The wine is all about high toast, giving little space for the fruit. That lack of balance may not change.

title: Château Les Graves de Barrau 2016  Bordeaux
description: Light and fruity, this gently structured wine offers spice and wood flavors. Drink from 2020.

title: Gillmore 2014 Hacedor de Mundos Old Vines Estate Bottled Dry Farmed Cabernet Franc (Loncomilla Valley)
description: Tarry olive and herbal cherry aromas are about what you'd expect from Chilean Cab Franc. In the mouth, this is sassy and highly acidic, with almost no depth. Woody, blackened berry flavors are heavily oaked, while this turns more green and herbal on the finish.
designation: Hacedor de Mundos Old Vines Estate Bottled Dry Farmed

title: Grape Creek Vineyards 2016 Viognier (Texas)
description: Marigold flowers mingle with orange peel and white pepper on the nose. Naval orange and lemon flavors are muddle and tinged with a vegetal note on the palate. The finish offers pithy pink grapefruit and white pepper.

title: Lewis Grace 2016 Barbera (Amador County)
description: A strong spicy oaky aroma is followed by equally strong oak flavors, so this medium-bodied wine is one-dimensional, without the fruit character that most people like to taste in their wines.

title: Viña Tarapacá 2016 Gran Reserva Made with Organically Grown Grapes Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Pointy herbal berry aromas include a strong whiff of iodine. A raw and grabby palate features rock-hard tannins, while this blend of Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cab Franc and Carmenère tastes highly herbal and slightly murky. An edgy, tannic finish qualifies as rough.
designation: Gran Reserva Made with Organically Grown Grapes

title: Vistamar 2017 Brisa Merlot (Central Valley)
description: Spicy plum and berry aromas are green and grassy. A basic palate with adequate structure is drawing. Plum and berry flavors are generic, while this value-priced Merlot tastes herbal and saucy on the finish.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2017 Verdejo (Rueda)
description: Oily, slightly sweaty aromas of phenolic green fruits and peanuts raise some questions regarding quality. A creamy palate is low in acid, while this tastes largely of bell pepper and melon prior to a wan finish.

title: Vistamar 2017 Brisa Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Valley)
description: Simple plum aromas come with an oak scent. Baked berry and clove flavors finish with roasted notes.

title: Amalur 2016 Single Vineyard Reserva Pinot Noir (Colchagua Valley)
description: Grassy aromas include notes of green herb and bell pepper. A flat, chunky palate weighs in as flabby, while this tastes like the nose suggests: green. Lightly weedy plum flavors are at the forefront of an overweight finish.

title: Carmen 2017 Wave Series Right Wave Pinot Noir (Leyda Valley)
description: Dusty berry aromas are basic and bland. This feels creamy, sticky and candied. Flavors of clove and forced oak sit on top of limited red fruit notes, while confected flavors of clove, chocolate and vanilla stand out on a fruitless finish.

title: Château Rouquette 2014 La Tour aux Palombes  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: High-toast flavors still dominate this wine, although they should by now have melded into the fruit. It suggests the wine will continue to have strong, bitter wood flavors.

title: Chilcas 2017 Reserva Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Lolol Valley)
description: Herbaceous notes of juniper and eucalyptus push the limits of what's acceptable in terms of green aromas. A crisp palate with tomatoey acidity is fresh and punchy, while this tastes of herbal, saucy plum and currant. Tomato and green herb notes make the finish taste much like spaghetti sauce.

title: Fitz Roy 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Valley)
description: A yeasty nose is less than fresh and indicates a wine in decline. A grabby palate with the feel of grape skins tastes wheaty, grassy and fruitless. Low acidity on the finish confirms that this is fading.

title: Juvé & Camps 2017 Gregal D'Espiells White (Penedès)
description: This blend of Gewürztraminer, Malvasia and Muscat is highly aromatic but not at ease, meaning the nose is soapy and smells unnatural. A flat palate with no edge holds dull flavors of lychee and little else. On the finish, this turns bitter and oily.

title: Tantara 2016 Zotovich Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of white peach, gardenia, jasmine and butter are leveled by a sharp lemone note on the nose. The palate is tense at first, eventually releasing waves of butter, lemon balm and melon, proving creamy and bright at once.

title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2015 Daphne Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This is a great vintage for this limited selection of old-vine Pommard clone Pinot Noir. Pretty raspberry and cherry fruit anchors the flavors, with superb length, texture and detail. Grace notes of rhubarb, earth and herb seem to develop into the background as the wine breathes.

title: Thiénot 2006 Vigne aux Gamins Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This low-production wine comes from a small Chardonnay vineyard in the Côte des Blancs. It shows the beauty of mature Chardonnay, with the minerality totally subsumed by the richness and elegance of the texture. It's ready to drink now.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2015 La Demoiselle  (Sancerre)
description: Produced, like all Alphonse Mellot wines, from biodynamically grown grapes, this single-vineyard bottling is rich, full of black fruits and dense tannins. The stony soil is unusual for a Pinot Noir and gives a dark, complex texture to the wine that will take some time to soften. Drink from 2022.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 La Demoiselle  (Sancerre)
description: A single-vineyard wine from one of the highest points in Sancerre, this is concentrated and dense, full of taut fruit and rich acidity. Apple flavors are cut with tangy, spicy citrus lifted by the taut aftertaste. Drink from 2020.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Le Paradis  (Sancerre)
description: This wine is richly endowed with ripe yellow and quince flavors, tightly textured and concentrated. The fruit dominates although there is also room for the tight texture that will soften. Drink this rich wine from 2019.

title: Bergström 2016 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Full bodied and complex, this mixes raspberries and cherries with flavors of light herbs, bouillon and savory mushroom. Sophisticated and detailed, this wine offers plenty of length and development.

title: Bethel Heights 2016 Casteel Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: A reserve-level barrel selection, this is a deep dive into black cherry, blackberry preserves and subtle layering of herbs, coffee grounds and dark chocolate. Absolutely luscious, it complements its ripe, forward fruit with a long, lovely, detailed finish.

title: Biondi 2016 Rosso Cisterna Fuori  (Etna)
description: Ethereally elegant and tantalizing fragrant, this understated beauty opens with mesmerizing scents of strawberry, rose petal and flint. The classy, subtle palate shows remarkable pedigree, offering crunchy red cherry, mint, star anise and minerality framed in racy acidity and refined tannins. It has amazing energy as well as a compelling delicacy that keeps you coming back for more. It will be even better in a few more years. Drink 2021–2026.

title: Brittan Vineyards 2015 Basalt Block Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Brittan's wines may seem a bit austere when first opened, which is no fault in this instance. The 2015s are a touch richer and fuller than the previous vintage, yet retain the laser focus on terroir, and specifically the basalt-driven minerality of this estate. Here are raspberries galore, with pinpoint definition. Drink now–2030 and perhaps beyond.

title: Casa Agricola Alexandre Relvas 2016 Pé de Mãe Red (Alentejano)
description: This richly smooth wine was fermented in open top lagars. That has the effect of rounding out the tannins and giving a wine with immense power and a generous ripe character. Black fruits, juicy acidity and a impressive concentration create a wine to age. Drink from 2022.

title: Churchill's 2016 Quinta da Gricha Vintage  (Port)
description: Ripe blueberry fruits are balanced by the dark tannins of this rich wine. It is a powerful statement, celebrating great fruit and rich tannins. Drink this fine wine from 2028.

title: Franck Bonville 2012 Pur Mesnil Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This wine comes from Le Mesnil, one of the top villages in the Côte des Blancs, and is produced from only Grand Cru vineyards. It is as textured and mineral as a young wine like this should be. White fruit shows through the concentrated texture and will become more dominant as the wine matures. Drink from 2020.

title: Grimaldi Bruna 2012 Badarina Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of menthol, balsamic herb, exotic spice and a floral note lead the nose. On the full-bodied palate, assertive close-grained tannins provide the backbone for dried black cherry, licorice and espresso. Drink 2022–2032.

title: Mastroberardino 2015 Stilèma  (Fiano di Avellino)
description: The latest in Mastroberardino's lineup, this gorgeous, mineral-driven white delivers aromas and flavors of ripe apple, oyster shell, a hint of toasted almond, saline and a smoky note that's present in the greatest expressions of Fiano. Elegant and loaded with energy, this will age beautifully and develop even more complexity. To fully enjoy its depth, serve chilled but not too cold.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Olivet Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Broadly fleshy and expansive on the palate, this is a lovely, powerful wine, spicy in forest pine and clove. Succulent on the midpalate, it offers an array of well-defined citrus and wild strawberry, with a lingering quality to the finish that impresses in rose petal and lavender.

title: Perrier Jouët 2011 Belle Epoque Brut  (Champagne)
