description: Always a light, ethereal style of wine, this is also very fresh and still young. It will age with its taut minerality from the Chardonnay in the blend. A softer background will become toasty over the next few years. The vintage date on this bottle is 200 years after the foundation of this producer. Drink from 2021.

title: Prinz Salm 2016 Binger Scharlachberg Grosse Lage GG Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: This is an intensely ripe, penetrating wine full of concentrated yellow peach and even red berry notes. At the same time, it's deeply earthy with stony mineral undertones and striking acidity. Dry and full bodied in style, it finishes on a delicate fringe of tannins. A bold, satisfying wine that should improve well through 2030, likely longer.
designation: Binger Scharlachberg Grosse Lage GG Trocken

title: Quinta do Portal 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Packed with powerful tannins, this is a dark and concentrated wine. It has sweetness as well as great ripe black fruit and a dark texture. This is a rich wine that is destined for a long aging. Drink from 2028.

title: Ruinart 2006 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This ripe opulent wine has rich white fruits and a warm, rounded texture. It's very much in the rich Ruinart style, made extra special by the maturity of the wine. There is still a mineral texture to the wine but the fruit has become toasty and rich. Drink now.

title: Foxen 2016 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Dark mulberry, black raspberry and slate start the nose of this bottling from one of the region's most coastal vineyards, but then comes a tremendous amount of black sage, Earl Grey tea and the slightest touch of game on the nose. Dark-berry flavors are cut by thyme and lavender on the palate, which is rich yet fresh, tart and lovely.

title: Hors Categorie 2015 Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The domaine name means “without category,” and it is no doubt apt. The nose offers compelling notes of ember, olive tapenade, blackberry bush, flowers, ham hock, broken rock and smoke. The palate is full, rich and layered, showing an impeccable sense of balance and structure that carries through the extremely long, salty, meaty, smoky, tapenade-filled finish. A profound wine, with a long life in front of it. Best from 2025–2034.

title: Kopke NV CNK 380 Very Old Tawny  (Port)
description: This is a blend of old tawnies from the 1920s and 1930s with some from 1900. It was bottled to celebrate the company's 380th anniversary in 2018. The wine tastes old, but there is some extraordinary freshness as well. Bitter-orange marmalade comes through the old-gold wood flavors while the intense acidity is stunning. Drink now, sip by sip.

title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 9 Welschriesling (Burgenland)
description: Purest, headiest notes of botrytis rise from the glass with all their honeyed intensity, while notes of ripe apricot and caramelized apple play in the background. The palate comes in with concentration and bundled, energetic sweetness, which carries notions of candied apricot and Mirabelle plum in its wake. This is cut by sharp, zesty and equally concentrated acidity. These united elements give an elixir-like density and liveliness to this viscous, golden liquid. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Proprietà Sperino 2012  Lessona
description: Structured, vibrant and boasting extreme elegance, this radiant Nebbiolo opens with enticing scents of iris, violet and crushed aromatic herb. The chiseled palate has wonderful intensity and precision, delivering red cherry, raspberry compote, star anise and Lessona's classic salty finish. It's still young and nervous but impeccably balanced, with taut, refined tannins and firm acidity. Give it time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2023–2043.

title: Warre's 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a juicy wine, with dense black fruits that are cut by bright acidity. The tannins give power and long-term aging potential to this impressive wine. Drink from 2028.

title: Poças 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Densely textured with dusty tannins and full of black plum skin and prune flavors, this is a ripe, complex wine. Its sweeter character does not spoil the great structure and dry core that will allow this exemplary wine to age. Drink from 2029.

title: Andresen 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This floral ripe wine is finely structured and has powerful concentration. Dark and firm, this is a style of relatively dry Port that will age for many years. The fruit is all there, well integrated with the spirit. Drink this dense, impressive wine from 2028.

title: Cavallotto 2012 Bricco Boschis Vigna San Giuseppe Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Enticingly fragrant, this gorgeous wine opens with classic Nebbiolo aromas of woodland berry, wild rose, forest floor, pipe tobacco, dark spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol. Reflecting the nose, the delicious, structured palate delivers dried cherry, raspberry compote, truffle, star anise and a note of crushed mint. Firm but noble tannins provide the framework and bestow impressive aging potential. Drink 2022–2037.
designation: Bricco Boschis Vigna San Giuseppe Riserva

title: Domaine Serene 2015 Récolte Grand Cru Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: This is the top Chardonnay from this producer, offering a deep golden hue, lush, aromatic fruit tones and flat out decadent flavors. Beautifully layered with concentrated notes of peach, apricot and pear, it dives deeper into seams of butter, toasted nuts, coffee and caramel. A most powerful and utterly delicious wine.

title: Horsepower 2015 The Tribe Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The aromas are exultant in notes of fire pit, ham hock, green olive, mineral, peat, soot, sea breeze, steak tartare, coffee bean and potpourri. The palate is full of intensely rich yet still vibrant, savory flavors and an abundant peppery tone. The olive and fire-pit finish easily lingers for a minute, if not beyond.

title: Quinta do Silval 2016 Magalhães Vintage  (Port)
description: A black, firm and rich wine, this is immense and with enormous concentration. It is balanced with a strongly floral edge as well as a touch of acidity. The dark fruits give the wine richness while the tannins promise longevity. Drink this very fine wine from 2028.

title: Weixelbaum 2016 Wahre Werte Wechselberg Himmel Auslese Sauvignon Blanc (Niederösterreich)
description: Luminous lemon freshness dominates the nose of passion fruit on this tropical Auslese. Sauvignon Blanc's varietal greenness—think tomato leaf and grass—edge and shape the wonderfully luscious midpalate, while spiky, sharp freshness delivers satisfying thrill. What lovely, flavor-bursting passion fruit tension. This crackles with life.

title: Chappellet 2014 Pritchard Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's site which is situated at 1,800-feet in elevation, this is a beautifully put together wine, blended with 14% Petit Verdot and 5% Malbec. It serves to celebrate the soil, exuding strong elements of sage, earth, graphite and crushed rock. Amidst the terroir is a richness of blackberry, clove and chocolate. Full bodied, it retains structure and grace.

title: Henriot 2008 Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: Packed with fruit while hinting at mature toastiness, this wine is now in perfect balance. Its white fruits are from half-and-half Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, shot through with acidity while having a ripe character. Rich while also crisp, it is ready to drink.

title: La Rata 2015 Red (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: Made by Cayuse assistant vigneron Elizabeth Bourcier, this wine is a blend of 54% Grenache, 36% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Syrah—the only one of its kind in the appellation. The aromas leap up, with notes of earthy funk, campfire, moist earth, sea salt, cherry, peat and crushed rock. The raspberry and earth flavors are light and juicy, showing a lot of delicacy as well as depth and detail. Tobacco and raspberry notes linger on the insanely long finish that opens up, broadens, expands and sails with grace.

title: Mastroberardino 2012 Radici Riserva  (Taurasi)
description: Underbrush, charred earth, spiced plum, tobacco and star anise are just some of the aromas you'll find on this delicious red. It's enveloping yet structured, delivering dried black cherry, licorice and cocoa set against a backbone of velvety tannins. Hold for even more complexity. Drink 2022–2032.

title: Prunotto 2012 Riserva Bussia Vigna Colonnello  (Barolo)
description: Wild strawberry, pressed rose, dried aromatic herb and a potpourri of dark culinary spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this well-structured wine. On the tightly knit palate, taut yet polished tannins frame flavors of raspberry compote, black cherry, licorice, graphite and a hint of orange rind. It's balanced but still young, so give it a few more years to fully develop. Drink 2022–2030.

title: Steindorfer 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Grand Cuvée White (Burgenland)
description: Golden peach, blossom honey, candied lemon and ripe apricot already suggest the lusciousness that is to follow. The sweetness and concentration are immense, but a lively dash of orange and lemon freshness adds much needed zest and pulls this all into a lip-smacking finish. Drink until 2035.

title: Teso La Monja 2015 Alabaster  (Toro)
description: Dark, concentrated aromas of blackberry, vanilla and leather saddle are rich and complex. As expected from Alabaster, the palate is saturated and dense, with rubbing tannins that need more time to soften. A bounty of toasty blackberry, peppercorn and chocolate flavors lead to a finish of toast and coffee. Drink from 2020–2030.

title: Prinz Salm 2017 Grünschiefer Riesling (Nahe)
description: Dusty mineral and dried-herb notes on the nose contrast pristine lemon, lime and white grapefruit flavors on the palate of this silky dry Riesling. It's a mouthwatering but elegant wine with a stony, slaty finish.

title: Purple Hands 2016 Kropf Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Blueberries and currants come with a lemony edge in this aromatic, rather delicate wine. Refined highlights add citrus rind, and as it breathes there's a nice cherry component also.

title: Régine Baron 2010 Cuvée Topaz Millésime Brut  (Champagne)
description: Now mature, this rich wine is beautifully balanced. Ripe fruitiness contrasts with minerality and a tight texture. The touches of toast and lively acidity are part of the maturing process of the wine. Drink now, although it will be better from 2020.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Quinta do Côa Red (Douro)
description: Made from organically grown grapes in the dry Douro Superior region of prehistoric Côa, the wine is a generous blend of Touriga Nacional, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Franca. Is firm tannins give the wine a dry edge which is mitigated by the ripe black fruits and spicy flavors from wood aging. Drink this serious wine from 2020.

title: Sean W. McBride 2016 Gremlin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: This is a bright and lightly layered wine that offers tones of Asian spice, earth and black tea. The acidity is tart and tenacious, interwoven between gentle jolts of mint, chocolate and dark cherry.

title: Shea 2016 Shea Vineyard Block 7 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This block selection is 100% Wadenswil clone, 13% whole cluster fermented, and aged in 50% new French oak. Strawberry and blueberry fruit plays out broadly across the palate, with notes of root beer and cola. It's open and forward, quite tasty, though not as dense or complex as some of Shea's other selections.

title: Siduri 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Elegantly layered aromas of rose petal potpourri, cranberry, raspberry and sandalwood arise on the nose of this single-vineyard study. Creamy and soft with well-integrated acid on the palate, this wine offers flavors of plum and mulberry, making for a smooth sip.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Oak-rich aromas of maple, chocolate and vanilla rest on top of ripe berry scents. This is a medium-deep Rioja with bouncy tannins and lively acidity. Flavors of blackberry and cassis show a flowery hint of violet on a finish with depth and character. Drink through 2026.

title: Tomero 2015 Gran Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Smoky, savory aromas of grilled beef, graphite, clove and baked fruit are the opening on this saturated Malbec. Baked black cherry, blackberry and cassis flavors are compact prior to finish, with strong acidity and tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Upsidedown 2016 The Gold Drop Collection Kitzke Vineyards Mourvèdre (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Heaping amounts of black pepper and raw meat aromas are followed by pillowy soft dark fruit and savory flavors that remain light on their feet, stretching out on the finish. It's a compelling offering of the variety.
designation: The Gold Drop Collection Kitzke Vineyards

title: Salmon 2013 Special Club Rosé de Saignée Zéro Dosage  (Champagne)
description: This small-production wine is rare for another reason: it is 100% Pinot Meunier. The producer, based in the Vallée de la Marne, has made a dark-colored rosé, softly textured although with considerable acidity. A young, fruity wine, it will be better from 2020.
designation: Special Club Rosé de Saignée Zéro Dosage

title: Global Wines 2017 Cabriz Reserva Encruzado (Dão)
description: The wood aging has made a world of difference to this fruity wine. It has added complexity to the white fruits and acidity and give the wine fine depth of flavor. Toast and spice show strongly as well as a rich aftertaste. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Jean-Noël Haton NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This producer based in Damery in the Marne Valley has made a well-balanced wine, poised between minerality, acidity and white fruits. Tangy, zesty and fruity, it is ready to drink now.

title: Adega Mayor 2013 Pai Chão Grande Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: This wine is immense but manages to also have an elegant side. That comes from the fine balance between acidity and the concentrated black fruits from the Alicante Bouschet. Wood aging and ripe juiciness give the wine a lift and, again, restrain the huge power backed by 15% alcohol. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Alexana 2016 West Blocks-Sedimentary Soils Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This block selection shines in 2016, sneaking up on the taster with flavors that build concentration through the finish. Black cherry, chocolate and a hint of mint all combine, and the overall balance argues for further bottle aging before popping the cork. Drink from 2022 on through the decade.

title: Alexana 2017 Revana Vineyard Riesling (Dundee Hills)
description: This estate-grown bottling is ripe and juicy, with a luscious mix of orange and grapefruit flavors, along with a generous slice of melon. The mouthfeel is lightly creamy, and there's a suggestion of some residual sugar, though it is not specifically indicated.

title: Alexana 2017 Terroir Series Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: This is part of the winery's Terroir Series, but oddly, no specific terroir other than the generic Willamette Valley AVA is indicated. The flavors are leesy and balanced among fruit highlights of citrus, lime and papaya, with a strong minerality. Precise and stylish, it's already drinking quite well and should hold through 2023.

title: Anne Amie 2016 Winemaker's Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This aromatic young wine brings a mix of cherries and figs, with highlights of hazelnuts. Aged 10 months in one-sixth new French oak, it lightly suggests Snickers bars and malted milk ball candies, without overdoing either. Overall it's refined and well balanced, and should be consumed now–2025.

title: Antichi Poderi dei Gallina 2015 Gallina  (Barbaresco)
description: This has aromas suggesting dark-skinned berry, leather, exotic spice and a balsamic whiff of menthol. The solid palate shows morello cherry, cinnamon and licorice alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Besserat de Bellefon NV Cuvée des Moines Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Mineral, textured, rich and full of white-fruit flavors, this wine is taut and nervy with intense acidity that is balanced by the ripeness. This bottling, with its tight texture, needs to age. Drink from 2019.
designation: Cuvée des Moines Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2016 Coudel Mor Clássico Red (Tejo)
description: This rich and ripe wine is softly textured and made to be drunk. Attractive berry flavors are shot with acidity and bolstered by the right tannic structure. Drink the wine now.

title: Barrelhouse 2016 Red (California)
description: This generous and fruity wine doesn't overdo the barrel treatment but packs a lot of blackberry and raisin flavors into a medium-bodied frame. Mild tannins add some good structure to the mouthfeel to balance a touch of sweetness.

title: Bodega Cuarto Dominio 2016 Tolentino Winemaker's Selection Malbec (Mendoza)
description: A cloudy red color and earthy aromas of wet cement, raisin and berry fruits set up a fleshy palate without much intensity or depth. Charred, minty berry and plum flavors finish hollow.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2016 Stony Point Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: This wine doesn't taste fully integrated, its marriage of fruit, oak and tannin still elbowing each other for space. The aromas are earthy and tinged in a flash of forest.

title: Dolmo 2016 Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Savory, meaty aromas are strained, roasted, oaky and low on fruit. This young Ribera del Duero from the Vicente Gandia family of wines is raw and underdeveloped on the palate. Roasted berry flavors are short on ripeness and taste gritty in front of a hollow finish.

title: Encosta do Sobral 2015 Syrah (Tejo)
description: Perfumed and intensely rich, this dense wine is massive and should come with a caution about its alcohol. The ripeness of the fruit leaves little room for any acidity, so the wine comes across as flat and one-dimensional. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Et Fille 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The low alcohol seems to be an indicator that these grapes were not quite ripe when picked. Flavors confirm that impression, with sour, thin, herbal fruit that needed more sunlight to flesh out the flavors.

title: Game of Thrones 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Whether Game of Thrones watchers are Pinot Noir lovers remains to be seen, but this utterly ordinary, vanilla-soaked wine is not likely to make any converts. It was vinted and bottled in Hopland, California, from purchased Oregon fruit. Sweet berry, cocoa and vanilla flavors combine in a syrupy wine that bears little resemblance to mainstream Oregon Pinot Noir.

title: LangeTwins 2015 River Ranch Vineyard Montepulciano (Lodi)
description: Dramatic oaky aromas and flavors make this estate-grown wine a bit of a one-note song, as wood smoke and black pepper dominate. It is full bodied, moderately tannic and has a mouth-filling texture.

title: Marshall Davis 2015 Seven Hills Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: Vanilla, tire rubber, char and cherry aromas are followed by ripe black fruit flavors with a lightly tacky feel. The tannins give a squeeze. It finishes warm.

title: Maryhill 2015 Serendipity Proprietor's Reserve Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Cabernet Sauvignon makes up just over half of this wine, with the balance being Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Dried herb, graphite and cherry candy aromas are followed by somewhat woody, straightforward fruit flavors.

title: Original House Wine 2016 Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of green herb, sweet black currant and sugared plum are followed by lightly sweet fruit flavors. It's a straightforward, easy drinker.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Rector Creek Block 4 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 52% Petit Verdot with 48% Zinfandel for an intensely tannic expression of dried herb and clove that overwhelms.

title: Raphael 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (New York)
description: Aromas of milky white flowers and savory white beans carry to the light-bodied palate and join broader flavors of melon and lemon. There's a pleasing roundness to the midpalate, yet disjointed acidity takes hold on the finish.

title: Roberto Sarotto 2015 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals raisin and candied-orange aromas. The extracted palate offers marinated prune, espresso and vanilla alongside grainy, astringent tannins.

title: Sobon Estate 2015 Red A Premium Red (Amador County)
description: Fairly rich and ripe tasting, this medium-bodied wine has strong oak aromas and flavors that register as cedar, tobacco, dill and pine. It is light in terms of tannin and acidity, has a touch of sweetness and feels very smooth in texture.

title: Bougrier 2017 Cuvée V Douce France  (Vouvray)
description: Crisp and clean, this is a ripe, honeyed wine. With citrus to balance the honey and a touch of minerality, it is attractive and balanced. Packed with acidity at the end, it is ready to drink.

title: Canard-Duchêne NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: A soft wine that has a high dosage, this offers plenty of strawberry flavors and gentle acidity. It is open, full of fruit and ready to drink.

title: Coelho 2016 Paciência Coelho Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: It's not clear what happened here, other than that the vegetal aromas and flavors suggest unripe fruit in the mix. The wine spent 14 months in 30% new oak, which can be detected in a certain toasty component, but sticks out from the herbal/vegetal core like a sore thumb. Maybe more bottle aging will smooth it over a bit.

title: Dios Ares 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Berry aromas are fiery and scratchy at first, then break down and become suggestive of olive. High acidity and not much body create crispness but also tart plum and cranberry flavors. Loud acidity is maintained on a raw finish.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2014 Piocho Reserve Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: The nose on this blend of 61% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Franc, 5% Petit Verdot and 5% Malbec is showy at first with candied black currant, but then it is elegantly straightforward, with layers of violet. It's tightly wound on the palate, with a clean yet taut structure and pitch-perfect acidity, carrying purple-fruit and dried herb flavors, all expertly integrated.

title: Noble & Murat 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Firm, perfumed and structured this is wine with a fine future. Its firm tannins are beautifully integrated with the generous black fruits and lightened by acidity. It is a very fine wine that will age slowly and impressively. Drink from 2028.

title: Pfeffingen 2016 Beerenauslese Scheurebe (Pfalz)
description: This is a delectably fruity, concentrated wine, full of candied orange peel, melon, peach and pineapple flavors. Sweet honey tones penetrate deeply, balanced by fresh lemon-lime acidity. Hints of green banana and a lacy, delicate coating of sugar linger long on the finish. Delicious now but structured enough to improve for decades.

title: Quinta do Mourão 2016 São Leonardo Vintage  (Port)
description: This balanced wine is sumptuous with ripe fruit while also being seriously structured. It is packed with ripe berry flavors that are lifted by the acidity and filled out with tannins. This wine with its perfumed, mineral edge should age well. Drink from 2028.

title: Roar 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Intensity is tantamount in this wine, starting with focused aromas of black raspberry, sun-warmed rose petals, spice cake and a slate-driven minerality. There is a strong acidic zip to the sip before it settles into a smooth groove, loaded with spice-soaked mulberry, Luxardo cherry and clove flavors.

title: Rosenhof 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Welschriesling (Burgenland)
description: Immense concentration rises headily from the glass, projecting musk, lemon and crushed banana peel. The twin forces of sweetness and acidity then attack the palate with undiminished vigor, unraveling their power play across the tongue with notions of Mirabelle plum jam and candied lemon. Precision and vigor imbue this with longevity. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Green Acres Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: The longtime grape-growing Sangiacomo family has partnered with winemaker James MacPhail to produce this beauty. A floral aroma carries to the balanced, full-bodied palate of Asian pear, fig and pineapple flavors, finishing on a crème caramel note.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2015 Génération Dix-Neuf  (Sancerre)
description: A very fine wine from a very fine year, this is richly impressive. Still young, it shows its wood aging in the burnt-toast edge. But the rich cherry and blackberry fruits are harbingers of great things to come from the 19th Mellot generation. Drink from 2022.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Edmond  (Sancerre)
description: Named after Alphonse Edmond, the father of present owner of Alphonse Mellot, this is the top wine from an always-impressive estate. Richness and concentration almost overwhelm the wine at this young stage, showing that it is set for aging. The acidity and biodynamically grown fruit of this powerful wine need to open up. Drink from 2020.

title: Blandy's 1977 Malmsey Malvasia (Madeira)
description: Malmsey is the old English name for Malvasia grapes, which produce a supersweet style of Madeira. Toffee, caramel and dried fruits are shot through with acidity. This is a beautiful wine, aged in wood since the harvest, and ready to drink.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: A candied black-cherry aroma meets with wild thyme, dried marjoram and tea leaves on the nose of this bottling by Winemaker Blair Fox. It's light bodied on the palate, allowing elegant red-fruit and purple-flower flavors to ride the vibrant acidity into the finish.

title: Foxen 2016 Melville Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fresh aromas of pomegranate and raspberry meet with loads of sagebrush and wild mint on the layered and alluring nose of this bottling by Billy Wathen and crew. Flavors of smashed wild berries, dewy herbs, blistered tomato and forest floor moss show on the sip—a great balance between earth and fruit.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2015 Beerenauslese Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: Lime blossom tea, candied apple and an alluring edge of smoke lend extra dimensions to the nose. The palate brings forth the full force of luscious, concentrated botrytis with its generous sweetness and bundled force of balancing, spicy freshness. This possesses wonderful balance and leaves lasting, lemon-flavored sweetness.

title: Heidi Schröck 2016 Spätlese White (Burgenland)
description: Notions of honeyed, candied richness reach the nose, spiked with a vivid dollop of citrus sharpness. This sweet Spätlese promises thrill and delivers it with notions of apple jelly, tart passion fruit and tropical hints of candied pineapple. Sharp acid counters the richness in the most delicious fashion. Follow the suggestions on the label and pair this with Szechuan pepper and red hot chilies to achieve Asian magic. Fruity, tropical desserts will also be elevated by this sexy and sharp little number.

title: Krug NV Grande Cuvée 166eme Edition  (Champagne)
description: This is the latest incarnation of Grande Cuvée, now in its 166th edition. Toasty aromas signal an enticingly mature wine, rich with intense secondary flavors. It preserves the wonderful richness and the style of this producer. The wine is ready to drink now, but it will be also enjoyable for many more years.

title: LaRue 2016 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Winemaker Katy Wilson impresses with this bottling, coaxing together a wine that's briny and salty, perfectly consistent with this coastal-influenced Occidental site. A flavor of Asian pear accents a moderate structure and lingering complexity.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Coopersmith Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Velvety smooth in feel and resplendent in a rose petal aroma, this is a lovely, full-bodied wine with depth and concentration. Deftly defined layers of dark cherry and tangerine shine bright, allowing for a refreshing complement to the wine's overall depth and power.

title: Podere ai Valloni 2010 Vigna Cristina  (Boca)
description: Raspberry compote, crushed strawberry, tilled earth and dark spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this compelling, radiant red. The aromas follow over to the vibrant elegant palate along with Alpine herb, star anise and a hint of game. It's nicely balanced, with firm polished tannins and bright acidity. Boasting remarkable energy and tension, it will age well for years. Drink 2020–2035.

title: Prinz Salm 2016 Binger Kirchberg GG Grosse Lage Trocken Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Zestier and juicier in fruit than Prinz Salm's other grand cru Rieslings, this vintage, light-footed but powerful wine offers loads of fresh grapefruit and peach flavors. It's a deeply mineral sip, too, with laser-like acidity and a refreshingly tonic finish. Drinks beautifully already but should improve well through 2030.
designation: Binger Kirchberg GG Grosse Lage Trocken

title: Quinta dos Murças 2013 VV47 Red (Douro)
description: Produced from the Quinta's oldest vines, this field blend of 14 grape varieties is deftly textured, rich in tannins and concentrated in black fruit flavors. With its current powerful structure, it is still developing and will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Forget-Brimont NV Grand Cru Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: A blend of 60% Pinot Noir and 40% Chardonnay from Grand Cru vineyards, this textured wine is rich. The low dosage gives a dry, fresh character to the red-fruit flavors. Drink now.

title: Gremillet NV Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: Pinot Noir is widely grown in the Aube and this wine reflects the ripeness of the grape in this relatively warm region. It has a tangy character to contrast with the apple and apricot flavors. The balance with full fruitiness and a zesty texture is impeccable. Drink the wine now.

title: Guilbaud Frères 2017 Clos de Beauregard Vieilles Vignes Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This wine comes from a vineyard that was already recognized in the Middle Ages. This latest vintage is deliciously crisp and lightly peppery. The acidity and refreshing lemon flavors are well balanced and the wine is ready to drink.
designation: Clos de Beauregard Vieilles Vignes Sur Lie

title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 La Chapelle des Augustins  (Sancerre)
description: Named after the chapel once part of an Augustinian monastery, this single-vineyard wine is rich with intense green gooseberries and minerality from the flinty soil. The wine is still young, rich but and needing to develop. Drink from 2020.

title: I Carpini 2013 Rugiada del Mattino White (Colli Tortonesi)
description: Intriguing scents of spring blossom, dried aromatic herb, wet stone and mature yellow stone fruit slowly unfold in the glass. On the enveloping palate, notes of honey and white almond wrap around mature orange rind while a tangy saline note wraps around the dry finish. Fresh acidity keeps it balanced. Pair this with herb-based risottos.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Hallberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tart in rhubarb and strawberry and bushels of dried herb, this is a light-bodied delicate wine, restrained and balanced in ripeness and tone. The oak is well integrated and supportive.

title: Joseph Mellot 2017 Domaine des Emois  (Sancerre)
description: This smooth, ripe wine is full of creamed apple and spicy pear flavors. It comes from an organic vineyard on chalky, stony soil. Apart from its generous character, the wine also has a young, mineral texture that will soften soon. Drink from 2019.

title: Kay Brothers 2015 Hillside Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This wine is upfront in aromas of ripe plums and bramble berries, along with coffee and dark chocolate tones. The fruitiness continues through to the palate but the tightly wound tannins take over, along with a good lick of acidity, making for an austere feel at the moment. This is a solid wine built for cellaring. Drink 2022–2028

title: Kessler-Haak 2015 Estate Grown Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dark red and purple fruits meet with caramelized and brown-sugar touches on the rich and lovely nose of this bottling. The palate is more tart than expected, with black-plum-skin flavors, and a dusting of white pepper, all framed in a firm dry structure.

title: Kessler-Haak 2015 Rosé Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of strawberry and peach flesh are cut my lime pith on the nose of this sparkling wine. Full raspberry and cherry-juice flavors on the palate are cut by a strong streak of sour and tart citrus spray, offering a balanced bubbly sip.

title: Knights Bridge 2016 West Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: Creamy and lush in texture, this boldly ripe white flirts with tropical flavors of pineapple, guava and mango. Its full-bodied complexity is additionally marked by exotic elements of anise and fig.

title: LangeTwins 2015 Red Tail Vineyard Nero d'Avola (Lodi)
description: A distinctive and powerful fruitiness that's as rich as blackberry jam without being actually sweet gives this medium-bodied wine a big personality. Hints of spearmint and blueberry join the fun, and there is very little tannin or oakiness to get in the way.

title: Langman Estate 2015 Raymond's Rows Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This full-bodied wine is saturated with dark fruit and dark chocolate flavors while complex aromas of toasted oak, damp earth and new leather add to the enjoyment. It feels solid and firmly tannic, but velvety in texture. Best now–2025.

title: Le Roi des Pierres 2017  Sancerre
description: This ripe wine full of white fruits as well as citrus comes from silex flint soil, which gives minerality to the fruit. The wine is tense and edgy, lined with final acidity. It will be ready to drink from 2019.

title: Left Coast 2012 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This nicely captures the toasty, lip-smacking power of vintage Champagne, hitting the palate immediately with an impression of both power and finesse. Youthful still, it offers tart fla-vors of lemon rind, pineapple and grapefruit. Though all stainless-steel fermentation and aging is indicated, that pleasing toasty note continues on through the finish.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2016 Piesporter Goldtröpfchen Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: While light in body, there's a rolling richness to this sun-kissed Auslese. Penetrating yellow peach and apricot flavors are offset by tart tangerine and pineapple acidity. It's rolling and expansive with a long, lingering finish.

title: Lingua Franca 2016 Avni Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Both the white and the red Avni bottlings provide fine and accessible introductions to the Lingua Franca lineup. This well-crafted example mixes medium-bodied blue fruits and supporting, citrus-infused acidity. It's not a big wine, but is on point throughout a focused finish.

title: Luca Bosio 2015  Barbaresco
description: Aromas of red berry, leather and tobacco lead the nose. The savory palate offers raspberry, clove and star anise framed by polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2028.

title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Velvety and full bodied, this is a robust, ripe wine, high-toned in notes of rhubarb, black tea and turned earth. It presents as lush and persistent on the palate, with a fruit-forward flavor and an impressive underlying complexity.

title: Marilena Barbera 2017 Coste al Vento Grillo (Menfi)
description: Opening with delicate but alluring scents of ripe apricot, pressed Spanish broom, candied lemon drop and wild Mediterranean herb, this deeply golden-colored wine is an unusual but intriguing expression of native grape Grillo. Mirroring the nose, the linear palate evokes yellow peach, lemon and saline alongside crisp acidity.

title: Delfino 2016 Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: Though slightly high toned, there's much to like here. Black cherry fruit and a dusting of cocoa powder focus the flavors in a smooth and spicy wine. As it moves across the palate, a streak of vanilla, followed by a lingering flavor of bacon, comes up. It's probably best to drink this now through the early 2020s.

title: Dios Ares 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy, rubbery berry and plum aromas are spicy and dry. A tight palate with firm tannins and bold acidity offers plenty of grip. Baked plum and currant flavors are dry and spicy on a finish with residual oak character. Drink through 2023.

title: Domaine de la Combe 2016 Cuvée Pierre Henri Saint-Fiacre Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: Named after Pierre-Henri Gadais whose family also owns Domaine Gadais, this is a bright, lively wine, rich with layers of ripe fruit, minerality and tight acidity. It is intense, with great fruitiness and a cool edge of final acidity. Drink from 2019.
designation: Cuvée Pierre Henri Saint-Fiacre Sur Lie

title: Duck Pond 2016 25th Anniversary Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This one-time cuvée blends a single barrel from each of the winery's six vineyards. Perhaps more symbolic than anything, it's a good wine but somewhat unfocused. The flavor mix includes red fruits, citrus, a hint of mint and tea leaf tannins.

title: Elizabeth Chambers 2015 Temperance Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Aromas of raw wood and stem make this wine seem younger than it is. There's raspberry fruit with ample acidity, but these initial flavors lighten and thin out through the finish, giving an impression that the wine is somewhat dilute. With a lot of breathing time, the wine fleshes out considerably, adding bright cherry fruit to the mix.

title: Epiphany 2015 Rodney's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Thick, inky and almost chunky in the glass, this is a powerful wine, starting with aromas of tar, charred meat, oak and blackberry paste. The roasted and charred elements of the palate are balanced by blackberry jam, white pepper and dried herbs, with tarry, sticky tannins coating the entire sip.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Ashley's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Smoke plays a large role in this wine, starting with the oak and hickory aromas that decorate the sour cherry elements of the nose. Baked cherry shows on the sip before the smoky aspects take hold, which are pleasing and would make a great pairing for a barbecue.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Quite dense on the nose, this well-priced county-wide blend offers aromas of black currant, roasted berries, charred meat, and lilacs. It's thick on the palate, where the creamy mouthfeel reveals coffee and charred berry flavors.

title: Feudi di San Gregorio 2014  Taurasi
description: Underbrush, blackberry, menthol and a whiff of smoke lead the nose. The aromas carry over to the tightly knit palate along with dried cherry, blood orange, tobacco and licorice. It's youthfully austere, with assertive tannins and firm acidity, so give this time to fully develop. Drink 2022–2029.

title: Fullerton 2016 Five Faces Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Aromatic and interesting from the first sniff on, this blends flavors of red berries, brown spices, and threads of cola and iron. The tannins are soft and supple, beautifully rendered. The ferment included 30% whole clusters, and the finished wine spent almost a full year in one quarter new French oak.

title: Giant Steps 2016 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: The nose of this wine is ripe and fruity in notes of plump ripe strawberries, red cherries, flowers and spices. The palate gets a more serious, with a fine line of savory tannins balancing bright red fruit. A long, spicy, mouthwatering finish has you immediately reaching for a second sip.

title: Groth 2016 Hillview Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Fleshy and full bodied, this wine shows a pronounced toasted-oak character, with swirls of pineapple and caramel contributing additional richness. Still, it retains enough acidity to offer a juicy core and lasting freshness amidst the fruit.

title: Guastaferro 2010 Primum  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of stewed prune, chopped herb, pressed blue flower and nail polish remover lead the way. Reflecting the nose, the palate offers raisin, blood orange and clove set against firm acidity and tight, drying tannins. Give this plenty of time to unwind. Drink after 2022.

title: Gyéjacquot Frères NV Anatom Premium Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Layers of ripe apples and crisp citrus mark out this blend dominated by Chardonnay with some Pinot Noir. Light wood aging has filled out the wine and softened the intense acidity, giving a Champagne that is rich while still tight. Drink now.

title: Jean Laurent 2006 Millésime Brut Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: This producer with vines in the Aube has made a specialty of pure Pinot Noir Champagnes. Rich yet dry, this wine is full of generous white fruits cut with toastiness. Now mature, it is ready to drink.

title: Joleté 2016 Summit View Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The aromas start out high toned, with notes of bittersweet chocolate, black cherry and spice. There's a pleasing sense of structure to the elegantly styled fruit flavors. Give it some additional time in bottle or a short decant.

title: Krone 2017 Twee Jonge Gezellen Vintage Rosé Cuvée Brut Méthode Cap Classique Sparkling (Western Cape)
description: Made from 85% Pinot Noir and 15% Chardonnay, this brilliant brut rosé offers bright and snappy aromas of red currant, strawberry hull and fresh-cut apple. The palate offers more of the same, the tart flavors and mouthfilling mousse cut by citrusy acidity and nervy tension. Drink now–2022.
designation: Twee Jonge Gezellen Vintage Rosé Cuvée Brut Méthode Cap Classique

title: Lallier NV Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: A blend of Chardonnay from the Montagne de Reims and the Côte des Blancs, this is still young, with a soft fruitiness that contrasts with the mineral texture. Its acidity is cushioned by the relatively high dosage. Drink this perfumed wine now.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Grand Cru Brut

title: Lanson NV Black Label Brut  (Champagne)
description: Lanson's big seller remains crisp and fruity, with a tight, bright character and a mineral texture. Without any malolactic fermentation, the wine retains freshness and delicious acidity. Drink now.

title: Ledge 2017 MCA James Berry Vineyard Rosé (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: A yellowish shade of pink, this rosé, which is 95% Counoise and 5% Cinsaut, starts with fresh aromas of pluot and bubblegum. The palate is very grippy, slowly releasing flavors of red plum, tangerine and a flash of bubblegum.

title: Brandborg 2016 Love Puppets Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: There's a scent and flavor of leather running through this wine, along with pepper, bitter greens and tightly wound cranberry fruit. The earthy character continues in the tannins, and finishes with residual flavors of astringent green tea.

title: D'Aione 2012  Taurasi
description: This opens with aromas recalling exotic incense, weedy underbrush and camphor. On the dense, one-dimensional palate, grainy but evolved tannins provide fleeting support for fleshy plum and raspberry jam before a short, raspy finish.

title: Fulkerson 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: A sharp nose of crushed limestone, tomato leaf and citrus zest makes for a bracing start. The palate is equally stony and tense in feel, with a plethora of tart citrus flavors.

title: Guerra 2014 De Pura Cepa Roble Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Generic cherry, berry and spice aromas make for a solid nose. This Mencía is fleshy but lacking in depth and intensity. Plum, currant and cherry flavors are diluted on the finish.

title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2015 Barrel Fermeted Chardonnay (Finger Lakes)
description: An ultraripe nose of melon drizzled with drawn butter and lemon juice starts this off. The palate is broad and fleshy in feel, offering ripe stone fruit and melon flavors that end slightly hot.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2017 Monte Velho Branco White (Alentejano)
description: This is a rounded wine, reflecting the warm sun of the Alentejo while not losing all sense of freshness and acidity. It is certainly rich with ripe yellow fruits, mangoes and spice and pepper. It is ready to drink.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2017 Monte Velho Tinto Red (Alentejano)
description: Full of rich fruit, this open and ripe wine is made to be drunk young. That means the tannins and structure of this blend of Aragonez, Trincadeira, Touriga Nacional and Syrah are full, generous and easy-going. Drink now.

title: Hunt Country Vineyards 2017 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)
description: An aroma of freshly pressed apples and pears greets the nose, with orchard blossoms riding in the background. This is persistent and juicy on the palate, with a rounded red apple flavor balanced by a bright lemony tang.

title: Knights Bridge 2016 East Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: This wine has pretty floral elements that come to fore ahead of a heavier, riper style that's viscous and plush on the palate. Golden-apple flavors take on a baked note, accompanied by pineapple and crème brûlée.

title: Leese-Fitch 2016 Merlot (California)
description: A charred wood aroma and toasted bread flavors stand out in this medium-bodied oaky-flavored wine, masking much of the fruit flavor that might lie beneath.

title: Maiden + Liberty 2016 Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Aromas of ripe melon, pollen and limestone carry the fresh, focused nose. This is light in feel on the palate, dominated by citrus and creamy melon flavors, with a zesty wet-stone note from start to finish.

title: Markus Huber 2017 Sparkling Rosé (Weinland Österreich)
description: Confected berry notes on the nose give an impression of candy and signal the easy-drinking nature of this pale pink sparkler. The palate could do with more precision but is fresh and just about dry. Drink soon.

title: Nieto Senetiner 2016 Don Nicanor Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Gaseous aromas of iodine and latex cloud black plum and berry scents. This feels stocky but grabby and obtuse. Limited black fruit flavors are generic and finish hollow despite this Malbec's bold color and weight.

title: Paris-Simoneau 2017 Antoine Simoneau Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This softly textured, fruity wine has crisp apple flavors and an herbal edge. Citrus zestiness combines with tense acidity and a clean, deliciously fruity character. Drink the wine now.

title: Patrice Moreux 2017  Sancerre
description: The pale color follows through to a light wine, smoothly textured and with just a touch of tannin. A small amount of wood aging has added spice to this red-cherry-flavored wine. Drink from 2019.

title: Pestoni Family 2016 1892 Field Blend Red (Lake County)
description: An aroma of freshly sawn oak boards leads to equally spicy and bold flavors that tamp down the moderate plum flavors underneath. The wine is full bodied, moderately tannic and definitely full of oaky spiciness.

title: Pezzi King 2017 Angela's Estate Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from a saignée of Zinfandel, this offers a briary berry-filled character that tastes somewhat diluted on the midpalate. The wine is easygoing and moderate in acidity, going for power over grace.

title: Pierre Chainier 2017 Clos Chapon Demi Sec  (Vouvray)
description: This is an odd style of wine, neither dry nor sweet. It offers hints of honey as well as orange-zest flavors that are currently confused with acidity, tight apple tastes and acidity. Things should coalesce in time leaving a fresh and honeyed wine.

title: Pietradolce 2015 Vigna Sant'Andrea White (Terre Siciliane)
description: Aromas of French oak, butterscotch and coconut carry over to the lean, linear palate along with hints of orange peel and mineral. It doesn't have enough fruit richness to stand up to the oak.

title: Prospect 772 2017 Baby Doll Rosé (California)
description: Almost dark enough in color to be a red wine, this rosé is the antithesis of the pale Provençal-style wines that are in vogue. It shows effusive floral and raspberry aromas, and plum-skin and watermelon flavors on a medium-bodied frame.

title: Sallier de la Tour 2015 La Monaca Syrah (Monreale)
description: Made entirely with Syrah, this opens with earthy aromas of black-skinned berry, tilled soil and leather. The forward palate delivers black plum, black currant and a hint of white pepper alongside smooth tannins. Drink through 2021.

title: San Biagio 2015 Montersino  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of eucalyptus, underbrush and dark berry emerge from the glass. The solid palate evokes dark cherry, licorice and a hint of white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink after 2021.

title: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei 2015 Rosé Klassik Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Toasty notes accompany the lemon and red apple freshness on the nose and promise generosity. The palate, with its very lively froth, obliges and gives rounded, creamy notes of apple and yeast. There is a lovely backdrop of yeasty autolysis, rounded out with generous dosage. The finish is dry and fresh.

title: Torres 2015 Celeste Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Cool, murky berry aromas are gamy. A blast of fruitiness propels a big palate loaded with spicy chocolaty oak. Bold berry flavors are short-lasting on a tight, intense finish. Crianzas are made to drink young, but this will benefit from more aging; drink through 2028.

title: Trisaetum 2016 Wichmann Dundee Estate Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Among an excellent lineup of 2016 Pinots, the Wichmann seems to be the least ripe. Its flavors are tart berry, with lemony acidity and hints of wet leaves. Drink 2021–2025.

title: V. Testulat NV Brut Nature Blanc de Blancs  (Champagne)
description: Tight and nervy, this mineral-textured wine keeps the fruit in the background. It is very dry, with the acidity showing strongly. Another few months or a year will do this steely wine the world of good.

title: Viña Mayor 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy berry aromas are forward but inexact. A tight powerful palate is narrow in scope, with peppery red-berry flavors propelled by lively acidity. Finishing notes of oak spice and cocoa are notable through a choppy but bold ending.

title: Viñadecanes 2014 Tres Racimos Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Grapy berry aromas are oaky and a touch harsh. A fleshy pulpy palate is sturdy and tannic, while this tastes of airy dark fruits that are more fluffy than tough. Toast and blackberry flavors make for a no-nonsense finish.

title: Vokel 2016 Eastside Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A tiny production from a small producer, this wine has a hearty entry and is hugely oaky and bursting in tannin. Its flavor profile is leathery, savory and smoky.

title: Abacela 2015 Garnacha (Umpqua Valley)
description: The winery has dropped “Barrel Select” from the label, but this remains a barrel selection. In 2015 the finished wine pushes hard against 15% alcohol, and it's fully ripened and then some, with deep plum and black cherry fruits at the core. The tannins bring black tea, smoke and tobacco notes, with a strongly astringent aftertaste.

title: Ada Nada 2013 Chicin Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Subtle, earthy aromas evoking underbrush, baking spice and dark berry set the tone. The linear palate shows dried black cherry, clove and ground pepper alongside firm, rather evolved tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Alexana 2016 East Blocks-Volcanic Soils Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery does an East and West block selection, this being the more open and broadly fruity of the pair. Rather soft, rounded fruit flavors of raspberries with a backing of citrus oil keep the flavors fresh and lively. Drink now and over the next half decade.

title: Alvides 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Dark oaky aromas of minty black fruits are gritty and concentrated. Following that nose, this is grinding on the palate. Acid-pushed dark-fruit flavors come with an offset of oaky vanilla, while this is clipped and gappy in feel on the finish.

title: Ancien 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: The latest release of Oregon Pinot from this Napa Valley producer is done in a lush and creamy style, with flavors of raspberries, cherries and vanilla in abundance. It's forward and tasty, though rather lightly ripened throughout, and best consumed 2021–2025.

title: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Crisp, dry and full of red-currant fruits and tight acidity, this is a delicious, young Champagne. It is textured and zesty, with layer of acidity vying with the perfumed fruit. This bottling really should age, so drink it from 2019.

title: Bodega Rolland 2014 Mariflor Pinot Noir (Mendoza)
description: Cocoa, cinnamon and oak aromas are more prominent than fruit on this ripe, full-bodied Pinot Noir. A hard-driving palate is not about elegance, acidity and restraint. Flavors of black cherry, mocha and chocolate are tasty but atypical of most Pinot Noirs. A peppery finish with heavy oak spice seals the deal on this uniquely Rolland-style wine.

title: Bruno Paillard NV Dosage Zéro  (Champagne)
description: While this producer's style is for dry Champagnes, this one is perhaps excessive. Even the ripe fruit can't quite take away the shocking acidity and intensity, making it best for those who like their Champagne to be seriously dry and tight. A few months more might help reduce the shock.

title: Château Tanunda 2014 The Château 100 Year Old Vines Shiraz (Barossa)
description: As the name suggests, this wine is from some seriously old, low-yielding vines. The liberal use of American and French oak, however, does mask the character of those old vines somewhat. It's dense and chocolatey, with plum, black pepper, vanilla and a dusting polish note throughout. The palate is plushly textured and warming, with soft, dusty tannins and a lingering peppery spice.

title: Cochon 2016 Les Sirenes Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Delicately layered and earthy, this wine takes on power as it opens in the glass, ending up in a full-bodied style of robust forest, cardamom and pomegranate. The structure is moderate in acidity.

title: Coelho 2016 Delfina Vineyard Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: The best of the winery's 2016 vineyard selects, this well-defined wine has flavors of mulberry, sour plum and a touch of lemon. Aging in one-quarter new oak adds some pretty spices, and the overall concentration is enough to carry it for another half decade or so.

title: Planeta 2014 Menfi Burdese Red (Sicilia)
description: This blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Cabernet Franc opens with aromas of dark berry, bell pepper and tilled soil. The firm, balanced palate offers black plum, mocha, ginger and green peppercorn alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Planeta 2016 Frappato (Vittoria)
description: Heady aromas of ripe strawberry, red cherry, clove and white pepper follow over to the vibrant palate alongside supple, polished tannins. Bright acidity lends balance and gives it a crisp, juicy finish. Chill slightly for a perfect summer red.

title: Planeta 2017 Noto Allemanda White (Sicilia)
description: This expressive white opens with heady scents of apricot, rose and grapefruit that follow through to the savory palate along with peach, crushed herb and a mineral note suggesting sea salt. It closes crisp and clean.

title: Riley's Rows 2016 3x3 Red (North Coast)
description: This is a well-made blend of equal parts Merlot and Syrah, the wine smooth and brawny in a grip of leathery tannin, spicy cinnamon and pepper. It has a meaty profile complemented by tastes of dried herb, cedar and dark cherry.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Diego's Reserve Carmenère (Dunnigan Hills)
description: A leafy, minty streak adds interest to this nicely fruity, silky smooth and medium-bodied wine. It seems to melt in the mouth and coat the tongue with an almost jammy but not too heavy plum character that's easy to enjoy.

title: Rodney Strong 2014 Brothers Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: From a high-elevation site, this is a broadly structured, full-bodied wine, with strong elements of cedar, dried herb and brown sugar. A cherry jam flavor accents the luxuriously lush palate, ending on an earthy leather note.

title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2017 Les Belles Côtes  (Sancerre)
description: A ripe wine, full of apple and tropical fruit, this is a rich style of Sancerre. Still young with its mineral texture intact, it has delicious fruit, finely balanced acidity and an opulent character. Drink from 2019.

title: Rowen 2015 Red (Sonoma County)
description: From a high-elevation site called Cooley Ranch, this combines 55% Cabernet Sauvignon with 26% Malbec, 17% Syrah and 2% Viognier. Clove, sage and peppercorn dot the smoothly textured palate, never holding back on the bold, juicy black-fruit flavor and the chocolate finish.

title: Saget la Perrière 2017 Domaine de la Perrière  (Sancerre)
description: This is the home domaine of what has become a large negociant house. The wine is all about fruit, crisp and full of citrus and white stone-fruit flavors, with intense acidity. Drink now.

title: Salomon-Undhof 2016 Wolke Für Zwei Sparkling (Österreichischer Perlwein)
description: A naturally cloudy hue and some funky, still reduced yeast notes give a very honest impression of ripe grapes. The palate is light and dry, slightly sparkling and tangy, with a real, pervasive freshness. A lovely, honest Riesling-based pét-nat.

title: Schloss Saarstein 2017 Saarsteiner Grosse Lage Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Racy streaks of lemon and white grapefruit are accented by layers of crushed salt and mineral in this exceptionally easy-drinking Kabinett. Just a shade off dry, it's a thirst-quenching Riesling to enjoy now–2023.

title: Skinner 2015 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: A touch of violet in the aroma is about the only delicate thing in this deeply colored, intense and tannic wine. It shows a spicy oak influence, and has the varietal's usual inky hue, concentrated black-pepper and blackberry flavors and strong but well-integrated tannins. Best after 2023.

title: Soléna 2016 Prince Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Sourced from a vineyard planted in 1983, this displays ripe black fruits, silky tannins and enough acidity to balance out the finish. It spent 10 months in half new French oak. Though not especially big or ripe, it's balanced and lively and shows some interesting texture.

title: Stoller 2016 Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Rich cherry fruit is punctuated with pungent, slightly bitter phenolics, sending streaks of herb and earth under well-ripened fruit flavors. The ample supporting acidity leaves a trail of citrus through the finish.

title: Tait Wines 2014 The Wild Ride Red (Barossa Valley)
description: Despite the steep 15.5% alcohol that adds some heat, this blend has a lot to offer. On the nose, ripe red currant and cranberry fruit mingles with more savory, earthy characters of green olive, tobacco and eucalyptus. The palate is grainy in textured, with a strong savory current propelled by soft, supple tannins and bright acidity.

title: Tinto Rey 2015 Super Tinto Red (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This wine is big and bold yet still easy to drink. It has oodles of black fruit aromas, dense fruit flavors and generous dashes of spicy, smoky oak. The texture is firm enough to offer balance, yet is silky enough to remain enjoyable.

title: Van Loveren NV Christina Limited Release Méthode Cap Classique Brut Sparkling (Robertson)
description: This wine is pretty, fresh and toasty all at once. It opens with aromas of hazelnut brittle, toasted challah and grilled red apple, all of which carry through to the medium-weight palate alongside additional flavors of pie crust and peach pit. Voluptuous in feel, the rich tones are balanced by medium carbonation and bright orange- and lime-flecked acidity.
designation: Christina Limited Release Méthode Cap Classique Brut

title: Vollereaux NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This Chardonnay-based wine is crisp and mineral driven, yet balanced by a softer texture that will develop as the wine matures. Attractive fruitiness contrasts with the bright acidity and tangy aftertaste.

title: Weinreich 2016 Trocken Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen)
description: Aromas of honey and pears are marked by spice, cashew and hops in this deep gold Grauburgunder, or Pinot Gris. The palate is intensely fruity, almost tropical, boasting notes of pineapple and melon, but balanced by a deep mineral undertone and crisp acidity. The finish is moderate in length but edged by a delicate grip of tannins.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2012 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Briary berry aromas are spicy but also earthy and a bit stewed. A chewy dense palate is more chunky than structured, while this tastes of charred wood and baked berry fruits. Given that 2012 was a very warm year, this is in good shape. Drink through 2022.

title: Black Box 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Chile)
description: Aromas of vanilla, asphalt and milk chocolate are infinitely more fake smelling than natural. A thick, grabby palate lacks definition, while this tastes of stewed fruit and Nesquik.

title: Landon 2015 Reserve Tempranillo (Texas High Plains)
description: Aromas of creosote introduce a neutral palate of petrol and red fruit flavors. Bitter green tannins and a little bit spice on the finish attempt to add some excitement, but this is underwhelming and ultimately bitter.

title: San Pedro 2016 1865 Limited Edition Syrah (Elqui Valley)
description: San Pedro's Elqui Valley Syrahs are always challenging. This version from a rainy El Niño vintage is difficult in many ways. The nose is like tomato soup infused with mint and grass. A stewy, syrupy palate is far from balanced and elegant, while this tastes green and tomatoey, with mint and canned pea notes on the finish.

title: Heidi Schröck 2015 Ruster Ausbruch Auf den Flügeln der Morgenröte Welschriesling (Burgenland)
description: On the nose, a hint of dark fir honey shows with a streak of its pleasant bitterness. Fresh notes of apple and lemon zest mix with the earthy notes of botrytis. On the palate, this zestiness unfolds completely, crashing with the full force of its fruit like roaring surf against a rock. That lovely element of noble bitterness still holds sway, creating a sensation of the most intense but also precise sweetness. Drink until 2040, at least.
designation: Ruster Ausbruch Auf den Flügeln der Morgenröte

title: Pol Roger 2008 Cuvée Sir Winston Churchill Brut  (Champagne)
description: One of the great Champagnes both for its richness and its longevity, this latest incarnation is superb. The wine's richness is linked to the ripe fruit and the dominance of Pinot Noir in the blend. It also shines in the perfect balance between the texture, the minerality and the integration of the fruit. It can be enjoyed now, but it will be better from 2020 and then for many years to come.

title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 4 Scheurebe (Burgenland)
description: An exquisitely floral honeysuckle aroma surrounds a creamy yet sharp note of passion fruit, while a peppery verve tingles around the edges. The palate has the same playful character: a floral tease here, a full-blown passion-fruit kiss there, a total embrace of sweetness balanced by a sure-footed command of acid that draws everthing together and assembles a newly precise picture with every sip. This is so heady, so delicious, so pure, so moreish that it should be a controlled substance. This should hold well through 2040, at least.

title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 8 Muscat Ottonel (Burgenland)
description: Damask rose, honeysuckle and blood orange peel unite in an almost otherworldly headiness. The palate keeps shimmering with these floral overtones while a solid wave of sweetness assails the taste buds with an insisting urgency, only to follow this with a sharp, welcome smack of pure lemon freshness. These notions alternate and fill the head with the pleasure of their tension. Sublime. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: W. & J. Graham's 2016 The Stone Terraces Vintage  (Port)
description: A superbly intense wine of great concentration, this has a generous structure and abundant ripe-fruit tones. Its tannins are fully intact, promising an immensely long aging period. It's rich, but also fresh in acidity and juicy black-fruit flavors. Drink from 2029.

title: Sattlerhof 2013 Trockenbeerenauslese Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark)
description: The allure of caramel and smoke hits first, after which a cloud of the purest apricot essence reaches the senses. The viscous palate tingles with disarmingly sharp acidity, balanced by incredibly luscious sweetness. Layer upon layer of apricot, passion fruit and candied lemon unleashes itself in this clean, precise TBA. It offers marvel concentration and purity. Drink until 2040.

title: Quinta do Noval 2016 Nacional Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a ripe and fruity yet strucutred wine that has amazing aging potential. It offers a strongly floral element that contrasts with the tense, mineral texture and dense tannins. It is an immensely concentrated wine that will not be ready until 2029.

title: Salon 2007 Le Mesnil Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This legendary Champagne, only produced in exceptional years, comes from the village of Le Mesnil in the Côte des Blancs. It is made from 100% Chardonnay and aged for many years before release. Its minerality, concentration and beautiful fruit are still astonishingly young and deserve further aging. Drink from 2020.
designation: Le Mesnil Blanc de Blancs Brut

title: Barão de Vilar 2016 Maynard's Vintage  (Port)
description: A beautifully balanced, rich wine, this has great tannins, a dense, firm texture and luscious blackberry fruits. It shows the structure of the vintage while also bringing a fresher element. Jammy but never cloying, this is an impressive wine for the long term. Drink from 2029.

title: Ferreira 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: A ripe wine that has great fruit as well as tannins, this is rich and perfumed. It has a layer of minerality that brings it close to the tough schist of the Douro. At the same time, the rich fruits are generous. The potential is excellent. Drink from 2029.

title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 11 Welschriesling (Burgenland)
description: A touch of smoke, freshly brewed Darjeeling and candied peel of bitter orange unite in a most intriguing nose. The viscous liquid is of an unusual density, brimming at every atom with its barley sugar flavors and caramelized black tea leaf and citrus notes. There is a wonderfully alluring element of bitterness that sets as much of a counterpoint to the otherworldly sweetness as the rapier acidity. The purity of expression is astonishing; concentration and intensity are extraordinary. An elixir. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Sandeman 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a ripe and generous wine, with tannins that are well integrated into the powerful black-fruit core. It is rich in a black plum flavor that's cut by fine acidity. Complex, balanced and full of long-term potential, drink this impressive wine from 2029.

title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 5 Traminer (Burgenland)
description: Vanilla and dried, sweet tobacco leaf wrap baked apple notes in their warm spice. The palate boosts the vanilla even more and unleashes its sweetness with an uncommon creaminess. Cinnamon around the edges tingles as much as the dried and candied orange notes. There almost is a fiery hit of ginger in the lip-smacking finish. A spicy magic potion here that lasts and lasts on the palate. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Contrada R Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)
description: Compelling aromas of Mediterranean brush, dark spice, pressed flower, graphite and aromatic herb draw you in for more of this elegant red. Focused and intense, it boasts great energy, offering juicy wild cherry, rosemary, white pepper and star anise, framed in bright acidity and extremely refined tannins. It's gorgeous and already enjoyable but will offer a decade or more of exquisite drinking.

title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 10 Scheurebe (Burgenland)
description: A hint of orange peel on the nose has the earthy tang of botrytis along with a leafy, slightly floral lift of honeysuckle. The concentrated sweetness that follows is cut by piercing, lively freshness that seems pervasive, and while cutting into the passion-fruit generosity it also defines and sharpens it. This is tense and concentrated with everything at full volume. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Louis Roederer 1995 Cristal Vinothèque Brut  (Champagne)
description: This amazing wine is timeless. Just hinting a golden hue, the nose offers layers of toastiness balanced by an impressive amount of fruit and freshness. At 23 years old, it still has some life in it, showing bright citrus and minerality. Let it breathe before drinking to bring out all the subtleties.

title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 7 Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: Marmalade, toffee, vanilla and tonka bean swirl on the nose. Rich and smooth, rounded and mellow, yet with an incredibly bright, aromatic core of fine citrus. Think dried and candied orange peel and candied blood orange. What a magical balance the citrus freshness strikes with the cushioning, gentle vanilla. Textural bliss and aromatic fireworks. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Aberrant Cellars 2016 Confero Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This young wine needs a bit more time to soften up the stiff tannins and meld its components. At the moment it lacks grace, though it has interesting flavors of black cherry, chocolate and graphite. Aging in roughly one-quarter new French oak brings up baking spices through the finish.

title: Angove 2015 The Medhyk Old Vine Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: Made from 55-year-old vines in relatively small quantities, Angove's top wine is a classic South Aussie. It oozes ultraripe fruits that veer into blackberry jam territory at the moment. Behind all that fruit peeks cola, mocha and peppery spice. The palate is equally plush-fruited and rich, with structured tannins that are balanced by a good lick of acidity.

title: Antichi Vinai 1877 2017 Petralava Bianco  (Etna)
description: Citrus, Spanish broom and Mediterranean brush aromas lead the way on this tangy white. The juicy palate offers ripe yellow apple, green melon and a hint of saline alongside fresh acidity.

title: Barão de Vilar 2016 Feuerheerd's Vintage  (Port)
description: A smoky aroma shows a surprising amount of wood aging for a Vintage Port that has to be bottled after two years. But the contrast with the fine black fruits is good, giving a wine that just needs time to come together. So drink from 2027.

title: Bertrand-Delespierre NV Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Based in Chamery on the Montagne de Reims, this producer makes deliciously ripe, balanced wines. This rosé with its hints of red fruits and tannin is a good example, rich while at the same time full of crisp acidity and with a bright aftertaste. Drink now.
designation: Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Brut Rosé

title: Black Elephant NV Méthode Cap Classique Sparkling (Franschhoek)
description: Made from 75% Chardonnay and 25% Pinot Noir, this spends 12 months on its lees and then 16 months in bottle before release. It's surprisingly brisk and precise in character, with laser-beam notes of lime and green apple that are coupled with richer tones of rose petal and peach pit. The palate is zippy, with a full but aggressive mousse, high acidity and a mouthwatering finish.

title: Burnside Road 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Intriguing mineral, savory and figgy aromas announce that this is not an average wine. The flavors are equally complex but well harmonized, blending fruity and earthy elements and supported by good acidity and a nice richness in texture.

title: Casa do Valle 2017 Grande Escolha Alvarinho (Vinho Verde)
description: Richly endowed, this full, perfumed wine celebrates 20 years since this estate first bottled wine. With ripe apples balanced by fine citrus acidity, the wine is both rich and tensely crisp. Drink from 2019.

title: Cascina Saria 2015 Colle del Gelso  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of dark-skinned berry, scorched soil and leather emerge from the glass. The firm palate offers morello cherry, tobacco and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink 2021–2027.

title: Castle Rock 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The newest vintage from Castle Rock offers a sturdy and flavorful wine without overdoing the oak treatment. Flavors of blackberries, black cherries and mocha make this a great go-to option, rich enough for most Pinot-friendly main courses.

title: Delfino 2016 Syrah (Umpqua Valley)
description: Tight and concentrated, this pure varietal shows strong flavors of vanilla, crème de cassis and purple fruits. It's smooth and highlighted with details of bark and stem. A finishing note of smoky bacon adds further interest.

title: Elio Filippino 2013 Serra Capelli Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas evoking baking spice, cedar and dark fruit slowly take shape on this full-bodied red. The firm palate offers dried black cherry, mocha and tobacco alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2021.

title: G. H. Mumm NV Brut Le Rosé  (Champagne)
description: A ripe rosé with a mix of crisp fruit and a bright texture, this wine has a soft character. It is well balanced, poised between richness and red-currant acidity. The wine is totally ready to drink.

title: Gigi Rosso 2014 Arione  (Barolo)
description: Prune, leather and balsamic aromas appear in the glass. The aromas carry over to the rather tired palate along with dried cherry and a hint of baking spice. Dusty, grainy tannins give it a firm but not very persistent finish. Give the tannins a few more years to soften then drink to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Parcelle Le Graveron  (Sancerre)
description: Rich and generous, this full-bodied, ripe wine is rich in black-cherry flavors with layers of toast. It is still young and could age further. Drink from 2019.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2017 La Porte du Caillou Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This delicious, soft wine is well balanced between fresh red fruits and acidity. Lively and packed with fruitiness, it is ready to drink.

title: Henry's Drive Vignerons 2016 Morse Code Shiraz (South Australia)
description: This is a firmly medium-bodied Shiraz that shows tones of plum, red currant, chocolate and peppery herbal spices along with a little meatiness. The palate is silky-textured, with bright acidity and an earthy, savory core. A great weeknight sipper.

title: Jacquart NV Brut Mosaïque  (Champagne)
description: A blend of fruit from the Montagne de Reims and the Côte des Blancs, this ripe wine is getting better every year. It is moving towards dryness, gathering rich fruit on the way. The acidity and taut texture are balanced by the fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Joseph Carr 2015 Family Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Oodles of jammy berry-like flavors pump up this rich and full-bodied wine from the maker of Josh wines. It has a broad mouth-coating texture, and hints of dark chocolate and vanilla on the finish.

title: Joseph Jewell 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Delicate up front with a backbone of thick weight and tannin, this wine is pleasant on the midpalate in cherry and pomegranate, with a floral tease of rose petal. This is a barrel selection of several sites, including Hallberg and Bucher.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Gesture Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Quite showing on the nose, this Grenache-based rosé offers strong aromas of passion fruit, orange and guava juice. It tightens a bit on the sip, but that tropical-juice combo remains, proving very flavorful and likable for those seeking a pink wine with clout.

title: Krone 2017 Twee Jonge Gezellen Borealis Vintage Cuvée Brut Méthode Cap Classique Sparkling (Western Cape)
description: Made from Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this MCC opens with pronounced fruit aromas of grilled peach, pineapple core, orange peel and lightly toasted brioche. The palate is bright and refreshing, with brisk carbonation and a bitter-melon flavor that lingers on the close.
designation: Twee Jonge Gezellen Borealis Vintage Cuvée Brut Méthode Cap Classique

title: La Spinetta 2014 Campè Vursù  (Barolo)
description: This opens with aromas of toasted oak, weedy underbrush, crushed dill and a whiff of camphor. The firm palate is on the lean side, evoking tobacco leaf, star anise, powdered sage, oak and roasted coffee bean but it lacks fruit. Drying astringent tannins grip the close.

title: La Spinetta 2014 Vigneto Garretti  (Barolo)
description: Underbrush, toasted oak, crushed dill and balsamic aromas lead the nose. The assertive palate evokes dried sour cherry, clove and a bitter hint of powdered sage before grainy tannins leave a drying astringent finish. It doesn't have the fruit richness to stand up to the aggressive, drying wood tannins.

title: Landshut 2017 Riesling (Mosel)
description: This is an easygoing, medium-sweet wine boasting loads of juicy apricot, tangerine and grapefruit flavors. It's a touch confected and honeyed, but its light body and fresh acidity make it pleasant.

title: Lieb 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (North Fork of Long Island)
description: A toasty popcorn note rides over a fresh core of citrus cream and cantaloupe in this barrel-aged wine. Medium in weight and boasting bright acidity, the palate is racy in flavors of citrus, rounded out by a creamed corn flavor and finishing on grilled lemon.

title: Meeker 2015 Hone Series #1 Sakura Red (Dry Creek Valley)
