description: From two vineyards, this oddly blends Viognier, Carignan, Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Grenache, cofermenting it all together before aging in French oak. The result is light in color and bright in acidity, with distinct flavors of sour cherry, cranberry and green apple.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Arianses Vineyard Red (Wahluke Slope)
description: Merlot makes up 40% of this wine, with the rest being equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Aromas of garden herb, soil, violet and cherry lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors that run straight down the middle, missing on the edges, with slightly gritty tannins throughout.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Merlot (Red Mountain)
description: The aromas are light and difficult to get at, while the palate brings dark fruit flavors that are reserved in style, tapering on the finish. It doesn't all seem to come together.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Dineen Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of blackberry jam and fruit roll-up are followed by ripe dark fruit flavors, with the warmth of the vintage on display. The tannins bring a lightly tacky feel.

title: Nova Vita 2013 Firebird Shiraz (Adelaide Hills)
description: This wine would've been an oak monster in its early years, but time has softened things some. It's still rich, with notes of black pepper, baking spices, chocolate, mint, cherry and hot stones, zipped up with savory, spicy tannins. The oak still shows prominently, particularly on the finish.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Madonna Auslese White (Rheinhessen)
description: The nose is quiet here, but fresh yellow apple, pineapple and tangerine flavors are juicy and sweet on the palate of this Kerner-Riesling blend. Medium-sweet in style, it's a fruity, uncomplicated wine with a honeyed disposition. A nectar-like finish lingers.

title: Patrice Moreux 2016  Sancerre
description: This rich wine is smoothly textured. After an extra year, the wine has lost its brightness and has spread out into mature fruits, almonds and a touch of yeast. Drink now.

title: Primarius 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: Apple and pear aromas are up front, along with whiffs of petroleum jelly. The palate is medium bodied, with the concentration seeming to wax and wane throughout.

title: Quinta Seara d'Ordens 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Structured tannins don't quite meet the fruit in this wine. So it has full dark tannins as well as a powerful structure. Smoky flavors come through strongly. Drink from 2028.

title: Global Wines 2017 Q do E Encontro Bical (Bairrada)
description: The wine is made from the very local Bairrada grape which is also used to make sparkling wines in the region. It is lightly perfumed, spicy with flavors of nutmeg and plenty of crisp citrus fruits. An attractive wine, it is fruity and ready to drink.

title: Gunter Triebaumer NV Muscato Sparkling (Österreichischer Perlwein)
description: The heady, perfumed notes of Moscato are evident from the start. Floral exuberance and grapy fruitiness jump from the glass. This is an Austrian version of the Italian Moscato d'Asti phenomenon, and it pulls off the aromatic ease, sweetness and foamy fizz perfectly. Enjoy with a fruity dessert.

title: Hosmer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Cayuga Lake)
description: Ripe tones of banana and melon meld with an underscore of chalk dust on the nose. This shows some textural weight on the palate, broadened out by juicy tropical fruit on the midpalate and elongated by a zesty line of acidity.

title: Jip Jip Rocks NV Sparkling Shiraz (South Australia)
description: This is a solid example of Australia's famed sparkling red. Notes of ripe currant, plum, mocha and dusty spice lead into a palate that is surprisingly dry yet still richly fruited. The grainy, earthy tannins are a little rough on the palate.

title: Joseph Mellot 2017 La Chatellenie  (Sancerre)
description: The flint soil of this wine's vineyard has given it a tight minerality. It also offers plenty of crisp citrus and apple fruits, with a herbal hint. The wine is made to drink young and is ready now.

title: Joseph Perrier NV Cuvée Royale Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine has a touch of maturity that adds to its natural richness. Almost equal proportions of the three main grapes of Champagne come together in a harmonious whole that gives this nonvintage cuvée its balance.

title: Joseph Perrier NV Cuvée Royale Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This wine is all about crisp red fruits. It is ripe, with a lively mousse cut by refreshing, crisp acidity. A balanced wine, it moves easily from bright fruit to a soft aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Kramer 2015 Heritage Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Sourced from a 1984 Pommard planting, this offers concentrated strawberry fruit and lighter flavors of cocoa and coffee. Aging in one-quarter new French oak for 19 months adds baking spices to the mix.

title: Le Roi des Pierres 2017 Rosé (Sancerre)
description: In this smooth and rounded rosé, ripe red-berry flavors are lifted by both acidity and minerality. A creamy, caramel edge contrasts with the fresh fruits. Drink the wine now.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Riesling (Mosel)
description: Crushed mineral and stone notes lend a very earthen tone to this off-dry wine. The palate is quite fruity, however, offering approachable white grapefruit, lemon and lime flavors. The finish is zesty and quite dry.

title: Louis Nouvelot NV Saphir Brut  (Champagne)
description: A creamy mousse gives a great lift even before the attractive fruit kicks in. This wine is zingy, bright with a dry edge that indicates a low dosage. The crisp apple, lemon and freshness are well integrated. It is ready to drink.

title: Lujon 2017 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Though not as ripe as past vintages, this brings appealing flavors of cinnamon-dusted apple pie and poached pear. Sourced from a single northern Tualatin Valley vineyard, its physical maturity exceeds its low alcohol. A touch (11 g/L) of residual sugar rounds out the finish.

title: Maddalena 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A bit faint on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of candied blackberry, lilac and a touch of balsamic glaze. That tangy balsamic character shows on the sip as well along with a pinch of dried herbs.

title: Markham 2015 Cellar 1879 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth, structured and easygoing in red fruit, this offers decadent chocolate undertones within well-integrated, softly elegant structure. The richness is offset by bursts of black pepper and gamy meat.

title: Mietz 2014 Claret (Sonoma County)
description: This blends equal parts Merlot and Petit Verdot seamlessly into a moderately ripe, structured wine, high-toned in dried herb and red currant, with a grippy oaky finish.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Heart of the Hill Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
description: The aromas suggest notes of cocoa, vanilla, graphite, dill and dark berry, with the oak out front. The palate is reserved in style, showing a pleasing sense of balance to the dark fruit flavors, with plentiful vanilla accents. The oak juts out a bit on an otherwise quite enjoyable offering.

title: Nubori 2014 Cata Nobilis Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Spiced-plum, soy sauce and prune aromas settle on soupy as this breathes out. A full palate with sinewy tannins, notable acidity and some creaminess deals flavors of stewed plum, raisin and vanilla. On the finish, it's more of the same, with a stewed final impression.

title: Oso Libre NV Grande Red (California)
description: Very concentrated on the nose, this thick Bordeaux blend shows raisin, black currant, milk chocolate and caramel on the nose. Blackberry paste and prunes arise on the sip alongside baking spice, clove and licorice.

title: Parmeson 2015 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From a field blend of mostly Zinfandel with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Alicante Bouschet and other varieties, this wine is surprisingly bright in red and black fruit, and with lifted acidity. Earthy elements of grilled mushroom, cedar and sage add complexity and seasoning.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2017  Sancerre
description: This well-balanced wine has both structure and freshness. It has a crisp edge to the ripe white fruits and zesty aftertaste. This wine is ready to drink now.

title: St. Francis 2015 Tres Viejos Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Juicy, smoky and exuberantly fruity on the nose, this wine is smooth and integrated, with rich lush layers of crushed rock, mocha and blackberry that burst on the robust full-bodied palate.

title: Stasis 2015 Murmur Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe cherry, star anise and boiled plum aromas show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is also rather ripe but enjoyable, showing cranberry, hibiscus and a hint of orange rind, wrapped in compelling structure and acidity.

title: Steininger 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: A hint of ripe plums plays about the nose amid notes of yeast. The palate continues in that same ripe but restrained fruit vein and presents an ample, round but focused body. The fizz is fine and smooth, and the finish dry and lasting.

title: Tahbilk 2017 Estate Grown and Bottled Marsanne (Nagambie Lakes)
description: This wine, from one of the country's most historic wineries, offers bright aromas of freshly sliced apple, guava and lemon zest, which follow through to the palate. The chalky texture is brightened by taut, citrusy acidity and a long finish that refreshes the palate for more. Drink now–2023.

title: Tenuta Cavalier Pepe 2012 La Loggia del Cavaliere Riserva  (Taurasi)
description: Tobacco, baked plum, French oak, aromatic herb and coconut aromas shape the nose. The extracted, brooding palate shows steeped prune, bitter cocoa and licorice alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Tenuta di Fessina 2015 A' Puddara Bianco  (Etna)
description: Made with Carricante, this understated white has delicate scents of Spanish broom, mature pear and a whiff of crushed stone. Bright and linear, the fresh palate delivers lemon, lime, pistachio and mineral before a crisp, clean finish.

title: Two Hands 2016 Angel's Share Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This wine offers warming aromas of baking spice, cherry, chocolate brownies, ripe plums and some leafy notes. The palate is well-balanced by savory, chalky tannins.

title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2017 Arlene Chardonnay (Suisun Valley)
description: Richness of flavor and an especially creamy, melting texture help this wine stand out in a crowd. The wine is 80% barrel fermented and aged on the lees. It has concentrated and ripe pear, peach and apple flavors and a silky mouthfeel.

title: Viberti 2014 Buon Padre  (Barolo)
description: Wild berry, dark spice, new leather and truffle aromas take center stage along with a whiff of violet. The linear medium-bodied palate is on the racy side, offering cranberry, star anise and crushed herb alongside tight, close-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Family Reserve G-S-M (Temecula Valley)
description: There's a dried fennel note that shows on many Temecula Valley wines, but this blend of 48% Grenache, 34% Syrah and 18% Mourvèdre uses that spice note to its advantage. Plump red-plum and hickory-smoke aromas touch on that anise-like note on the nose, while the palate shows cherry wood, elegant red-fruit and roasted fennel-bulb flavors.

title: Ziata 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This medium-bodied white brings a stony mineral texture, with fleshy flavors of guava and mango. It offers complexity and nuance against a full embrace of ripeness.

title: Marqués de Riscal 2013 Baron de Chirel Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Fine oak helps an otherwise ripe and earthy nose. A rich saturated palate ranks as syrupy, while this Tempranillo-led blend tastes of coconut, chocolate mint and blackberry jam. While thick and stout throughout, this off-vintage wine always seems a bit flat. Drink through 2021.

title: Newton 2016 Skyside Claret (North Coast)
description: Mint, chocolate and cherry flavors intermingle in this dry, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine blended from Bordeaux grape varieties. It offers plenty of blackberry notes shaded by black pepper and smoke and will stand up to the juiciest protein you can order.

title: Sidewood NV Sparkling  (Adelaide Hills)
description: This is a rich sparkling for those who like their bubbles full throttle. Enticing notes of bruised red apples, apricots, figs and honeyed nuts run throughout the wine. The mouthfeel is creamy, carried by fine bubbles. Less honeyed than the nose, the palate brings earthier flavors of wet hay and strawberry leaf.

title: Abacela NV Vintner's Blend #18 Red (Umpqua Valley)
description: This is a sort of ad hoc field blend, composed of estate-grown fruit that didn't find its way into any of the many single varietal blends. Ten different grapes are in the mix, but more than half, unsurprisingly, is Tempranillo. It blends seamlessly, a potpourri of black fruits, cacao and graphite, with a whiff of cigar box. At this price it's worth loading up by the case.

title: Ancien 2016 Musque Chardonnay (Coombsville)
description: Fleshy in defined flavors of peach and pear, this is a bright white wine, defined by perfumed aromas of jasmine and white flower. Fresh acidity supports a moderate structure of balanced ripeness.

title: Argyle 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: The production of this well-made wine keeps bumping up, while the price and quality remain consistent. Pungent, peppery fruit flavors center around bright cranberry and plenty of citrus. There's a gentle touch of cinnamon candy also, adding extra life to the finish.

title: Au Contraire 2014 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens with a nutty, woody nose that delves quickly into a brazen blue-fruit flavor. Clove and pepper season it well and contribute to its length and depth.

title: Balletto 2015 18 Barrel Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A departure for this producer who tends to focus on its single-vineyard sites, this wine combines the best of several sites, with longevity and complexity in mind. It showcases the best of the coast's savory qualities, offering muted spice, firm tannins, orange, currant and a velvety midpalate.

title: Balletto 2016 Winery Block Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy, grippy and expansive in red and black cherry, this medium-bodied wine is smooth and seductive, an ideal representative of its reasonably warm site. It finishes on tones of black tea and rose petal.
designation: Winery Block Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Sparkman 2014 Evermore Old Vines Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Vanilla, black licorice, herb, pencil lead and dried cherry aromas lead to somewhat lighter styled fruit flavors that trail on the finish. Fruit and barrel seem to tussle at times.

title: The Four Graces 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The winery reserve, priced significantly lower than its top cuvées, has more fruit and less charred wood flavors, all to its benefit. Raspberry and cherry fruit, backed with moderate acidity, sends it into a finish with lightly green tannins. Drink now–2022.

title: Thorn Clarke 2015 Shotfire Quartage Red (Barossa)
description: This is a Bordeaux-style blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Merlot. It's a dense, full-bodied wine showing tones of ripe red and black cherries, red currants and mocha. There's a little tobacco leaf herbacousness, too. The palate is plush in feel, with grainy, woody tannins amidst the juicy berry fruit.

title: Tionio 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Concentrated black-fruit and oak aromas are gamy. A jammy palate tips the scales towards heavy, while this tastes of ripe, slightly baked black fruits. Notes of toast, spice and game mark the close.

title: Toad Hollow 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Rounded aromas of tart red fruit, red and purple flowers, damp sagebrush and forest floor show on the nose of this very fairly priced bottling. Rustic flavors of dried plum and cranberry meet with earthy elements, all wrapped in a chalky texture.

title: Trus 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: A dark color and bulky aromas of jumbled black fruits and Christmas spices set up a stacked palate with hard tannins and lots of weight. Blackberry flavors mixed with mocha and spice notes are classic for Ribera del Duero. A warm finish with grating tannins suggests that aging may help; drink through 2026.

title: Upsidedown 2016 The Artist Collection Candy Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Yakima Valley)
description: Aromas of ember, herb, black pepper, grilled asparagus and char lead to plentiful but still elegant fruit and savory flavors that persist on the finish. It provides a lot of intrigue, but the concentration doesn't all seem to be there at times.
designation: The Artist Collection Candy Ridge Vineyard

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Yes Dear Happy Wife Vineyard Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: Clean aromas of peach, lemon and pineapple move toward tropical ripeness on the nose of this bottling—a well-balanced white from the warm region. It's bright and fresh on the palate with guava, tuberose and sweet cream flavors.

title: Woodstock 2013 The Octogenarian Grenache (McLaren Vale)
description: From 80-year-old Grenache vines (with a touch of Tempranillo), this supple, juicy wine is a crowd-pleaser, if not as multifaceted as one would hope from old vines and five years of age. Nevertheless, it's bursting with ripe red berries, watermelon and vanilla notes, along with a soft-sided palate and gentle, slightly savory tannins. Drink now.

title: Zolo 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Black fruit aromas are spicy and hint at raisin the longer this sits. A stout, scratchy palate is rough but not scrubbing. Roasted berry and plum flavors are accented by spicy oak and baked notes on a full finish.

title: Altavins 2016 Almondí Petit Red (Terra Alta)
description: Black-fruit aromas are spicy and earthy, with a hint of mushroom. This is full but basic on the palate. Black cherry, plum and dark-berry flavors are largely generic, while this Garnacha-led blend is plump and savory tasting on the finish.

title: Antica Masseria del Sigillo 2017 Sigillo Campano Aglianico (Campania)
description: This opens with earthy aromas of tilled soil, dark berry and game. The simple palate offers blackberry jam and a hint of star anise alongside hearty tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Araldica 2014 Corsini  (Barbaresco)
description: Pressed violet, crushed herb and camphor aromas shape the nose. The chewy palate delivers crushed raspberry, black cherry and a hint of star anise alongside firm tannins. Drink 2021–2027.

title: Bedouet 2017 Le Domaine Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This is a soft, rich wine, full of ripe pear and touches of honey. The smooth, open texture offers just enough acidity while also having a full-bodied, generous aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2013 Cosme Palacio Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Berry fruit aromas are slightly gamy, with a hint of vanilla. On the palate, this is choppy and tough. Gamy, herbal plum and raspberry flavors transition to oaky and chocolaty on a severely dry, tannic finish that pushes up against sandpaper.

title: Canard-Duchêne NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: This blend of mainly red grapes, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier offers attractively crisp apples and pears, with a fine layer of acidity. It is balanced and ready to drink.

title: Château Moncontour 2017 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)
description: From vineyards above the grand chateau of Moncontour close to the Loire, this medium-dry wine offers acidity and crisp white fruits. Its freshness is as important as the perfumed fruitiness, giving the wine the potential to age. Drink from 2020.

title: Conde Bel 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Gritty, slightly cooked aromas make for a nose that's not bad but not that refined or elegant either. A soupy palate brings a sticky mouthfeel, while this tastes of oak and herbal red fruits. On the finish, this is more or less the same. Tempranillo and Garnacha is the blend.

title: Cortes de Cima 2014 Dois Terroirs Red (Alentejano)
description: A blend from two vineyards with different soil types, this wine is soft, smoky and with a spicy character from the partial wood aging. It is balanced, juicy and is ready to drink.

title: Domaine Brochard 2017 Tradition  (Sancerre)
description: This easygoing, fruity wine has a soft texture and plenty of acidity. It is balanced between the crisp citrus fruit and ripe apples while the mineral texture shows in the background. Drink now.

title: Besserat de Bellefon NV Cuvée des Moines Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This bone-dry Champagne has had some bottle age before release, adding a nutty character to the ripe fruit and intense acidity. It is a crisp wine with added richness to sustain its dryness. Drink this bottling from 2019.

title: Bodegas Faustino 2008 Faustino I Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Brandied berry and raisin aromas lead the nose of this mature Gran Reserva. The texture is austere and grippy, a reflection of a cold vintage. Spice, earth, berry and plum flavors finish with a note of tobacco. Drink through 2024.

title: Cascina Bruciata 2015  Barbaresco
description: Aromas of leather, tilled soil and dark berry emerge from the glass. The savory medium-bodied palate delivers ripe red plum, clove and white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink 2022–2028.

title: Cebada 2014 Blanc et Noirs Extra Brut Sparkling (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light yellow in the glass, this bubbly is a mix of 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, and starts with yeasty aromas of sourdough and a light squeeze of grapefruit on the nose. The bready flavors show on the sip too, alongside tart lemon touches.

title: Cedarville 2015 Naylor Vineyard Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: This generous, concentrated and full-bodied wine has rich dense flavors and a very firm structure. A touch of spicy earthiness in the aroma leads to luscious notes of blackberry jam and dark chocolate on the palate.

title: Cedergreen Cellars 2016 Old Vine Chenin Blanc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas draw you into the glass, with notes of honeycomb, apple and the underside of a pineapple. It drinks dry, with a textured feel to the pineapple flavors. Yum.

title: Château de Bligny NV Grande Réserve Brut  (Champagne)
description: A well-balanced wine, this is poised between fresh fruits and a tangy texture. The dosage is just right, emphasizing the minerality of the wine while keeping a soft aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Guipière 2016 La Grange Vieilles Vignes Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: A blend of old vines from across the estate, this wine is beautifully mature, rich and concentrated. The texture, still with a hint of minerality, is well integrated into the ripe apple flavors with touches of lime. Drink now.
designation: La Grange Vieilles Vignes Sur Lie

title: Chehalem 2016 Three Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A blend of estate-grown grapes, this new vintage is nicely layered with complex flavors of black cherry, cold-brewed coffee, licorice and barrel toast. There's a hint of clean earth under a smooth, lingering finish.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2015 Eola-Amity Cuvée Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: This wine offers a minerally mix of plum, blueberry and cherry accented by fresh, lively acidity. Part of the winery's AVA Collection, it is delicious already and should hold well through 2025.

title: Domaine Gibault 2015 Le Graal Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine Chenonceaux)
description: Now aged three years, this wine is ripe and generous. It has lost its initial taut character and filled out with tropical fruits over rich acidity and just the lightest mineral texture. Drink now.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Coles Valley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Umpqua Valley)
description: This recent planting is the winery's only Umpqua Valley site. Vibrant and juicy, it's fruit-driven and fresh as can be, and it offers a most satisfying gulp of young Oregon Pinot Noir. There may or may not be an advantage to further aging, but what's certain is how lovely it is right now. One-third was whole cluster fermented, and one-third was aged in new French oak.

title: Etude 2017 Grace Benoist Ranch Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From estate fruit, this is a dry, textured and meaty wine, layered in strawberry and raspberry flavors. Teases of dried herb and mint season the fruit.

title: Fetzer 2016 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine matches ripe black-plum and -cherry flavors with light yet firm tannins. A sense of concentration and density comes through on the palate and encourages the lingering finish.

title: Gadais Père et Fils 2017 Cuvée Granit Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: The Gadais family has been established in Saint-Fiacre for five generations. This wine from granite soil in two vineyards is young, intensely fruity and has a strong streak of minerality. Its acidity and tangy fruitiness show potential for some bottle aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Giant Steps 2016 Primavera Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: This single vineyard Pinot is approachable now, but will get more interesting in another five to eight years. At the moment, there's a lifted fruitiness to it, like cherry cola mixed with hoisin sauce on raw beef, and some rose petals and pickle juice, too. The palate is plush and velvety, but with a sturdy, earthy, savory core.

title: Hawley 2014 Broadwing Estate Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This successfully combines 60% Cabernet Sauvignon with 35% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc, aging the whole for 27 months in French oak. Hugely concentrated, it shows a rocky mineral character of ash, leather and white pepper, the fruit black and burly and the tannins structured.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 La Demoiselle de Bourgeois  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This wine has the weight to be expected in a Pouily Fumé as well as the flinty texture that comes with the terroir. Just ready, this wine will be even better from 2019.

title: Hyland 2016 Wädenswil Old Vine Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Now approaching 40 years of age, this single clone, block selection is quite pretty, with Bing cherry fruit cascading into even sweeter maraschino territory. The body of the wine has a streak of cola and a nice hint of caramel.

title: Kühling-Gillot 2016 Qvinterra Scheurebe (Rheinhessen)
description: Buoyant aromas of pineapple, cantaloupe and tangerine abound in this intensely fruity but zesty dry white. Pristine white grapefruit and green plum flavors are offset by a backdrop of leafy green herb and a hint of smoky minerality on the finish. It's a sprightly, light-bodied wine to enjoy now–2020.

title: Mastroberardino 2017  Falanghina del Sannio
description: Aromas of honeysuckle, honeydew melon and tropical fruit lead the nose. On the bright palate, a note of bitter almond accompanies ripe Granny Smith apple and citrus.

title: Negro Giuseppe 2015 Pian Cavallo  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of coconut, toasted oak and menthol. The tightly wound palate offers raspberry jam, mocha and star anise alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins.

title: Nicosia 2017 Fondo Filara Contrada Monte Gorna Bianco  (Etna)
description: Made with organically grown Carricante and Catarratto, this opens with delicate aromas of spring flower, citrus, white stone fruit and a whiff Mediterranean brush. The bright, linear palate evokes yellow apple, grapefruit and a hint of honeyed nut.
designation: Fondo Filara Contrada Monte Gorna Bianco

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Heart of the Hill Vineyard Mourvèdre (Red Mountain)
description: Blackberry and black pepper aromas are followed by ripe but somewhat lighter styled fruit flavors that taper toward the cranberry filled finish. There are some interesting things going on, but they don't all come together.

title: Oregon Territory 2017 Pinot Gris (Oregon)
description: This falls on the green fruit and herb side of the spectrum, but is nonetheless quite well made. Flavors of cucumber, green apple and wet stone come along with light, fresh green herbs.

title: Paringa 2016 Sparkling Shiraz (South Australia)
description: Tangy red and dark berries, chocolate and herbal, peppery characters accompany light fizz and a touch of sweetness. Balanced somewhat by silky tannins, the palate is lacking acidity, so the sweetness borders on syrupy.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Attitude by Pascal Jolivet Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)
description: Fruit for this wine comes mainly from Touraine. In the hands of a master from Sancerre, the naturally herbal character of Touraine Sauvignon is tamed and given richness. Fruit and minerality come through strongly. Drink now.

title: Pasquale Pelissero 2015 San Giuliano  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas of dark fruit and baking spice slowly emerge from the glass. The taut palate delivers sour cherry, clove and espresso alongside assertive, rather astringent tannins.

title: Paul Goerg NV Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Situated in the Côte des Blancs, this cooperative specializes in Chardonnay-based Champagnes. This wine, their main cuvée, is soft, creamy and fruity. Touches of minerality show only lightly through the crisp fruitiness and dry aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Prima Materia 2015 Sangiovese
description: This maverick medium-bodied wine has leathery aromas, a touch of iodine in the sour cherry flavors and a firm, moderately tannic texture. The wine is big and brawny in mouthfeel and not very oaky.

title: Ramirez de la Piscina 2014 Selección Crianza  (Rioja)
description: A severely charred and woody nose means this blocky Crianza has strong scents of mint, clove and barrel spices. Expect a battle from start to finish; the palate is resiny and grabby, while oak-infused berry flavors taste a lot like clove. The same can be said for a big-time woody finish.

title: Roger Champault & Fils 2017 Les Pierris Rosé (Sancerre)
description: Bright, crisp and with considerable acidity, this wine offers red-currant fruits and a tense texture. It is too young and needs to soften its youthful intensity. Drink from 2019.

title: San Silvestro 2014 Neboise Rosé Brut Metodo Classico  (Nebbiolo d'Alba)
description: Whiffs of exotic incense and white pepper accent berry and pastry dough aromas. On the bright, vigorously sparkling palate, vibrant acidity lifts raspberry compote, sour red cherry, candied citrus and a hint of ginger.

title: Settlers Rise 2016 Shiraz (South Eastern Australia)
description: A bit quiet at first, this wine opens in glass to reveal notes of ripe raspberries, blackberries and herbal spices. The fruit is plump and ripe on the palate, balanced by grainy, savory tannins and a good lick of acidity to keep things fresh.

title: Tapiz 2015 Alta Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Uco Valley)
description: A dense color and aromas of raisin, baking spice and coffee land on a thick, sappy palate that's short on acidity. Soupy, lightly green and minty berry flavors are chewy on a weighted-down finish.

title: Tenute Casoli 2011 Armonia  (Taurasi)
description: Packaged in an extremely heavy bottle, this has evolved aromas of steeped prune, scorched earth, cocoa and used leather, along with a whiff of nail polish. The densely concentrated palate offers dried cherry, blood orange, a hint of baking spice and a rather bitter note of powdered sage set against drying tannins. You'll also notice the heat of evident alcohol. Drink sooner rather than later.

title: Three of Cups 2016 La Monde Cameron Ridge Vineyard Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of fresh plum, orange peel, tar and herb lead to quite light, tart fruit flavors backed by lightly grainy tannins. It's an intriguing interpretation of this variety, but the concentration doesn't seem all there.

title: Three of Cups 2017 Stillwater Creek Vineyard White (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: A blend of 79% Sauvignon Blanc and 21% Sémillon. Light aromas of herb, citrus and grass are followed by medium-bodied, lemony fruit flavors with a tart finish. It's equal parts intrigue and delivery.

title: Torlasco 2015  Barbaresco
description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, scorched earth and dark berry lead the nose. The straightforward palate offers dried black cherry, clove and vanilla alongside chewy tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Tournon by Michel Chapoutier 2015 Mathilda Viognier-Marsanne (Victoria)
description: A blend of 85% Viognier and 15% Marsanne, this wine is bright and fruity in tones of lemon-lime, florals and honey. There's a good lick of acidity on the palate, along with a slipper texture.

title: Duck Pond 2016 St. Jory Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Blackberry and chocolate are front and center, but this wine offers much more. It's creamy and lush on the palate, with mocha, toast and a touch of orange peel. The long, full finish brings in some black tea astringency.

title: Folded Hills 2016 Estate Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A beautiful shade of light purple in the glass, this first estate bottling off of this new property in the southwest corner of the appellation shows red currant, cherry and star anise on the nose. The palate starts with tangy black-raspberry fruit, but the focus is the compelling tannic tension and bright acid.

title: Folded Hills 2016 Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Roasted berries, dark cocoa, white pepper and a touch of tar make for a compelling aromatic entry to this bottling from the new project owned by Andy Busch from the famous brewing family. It's firmly textured on the palate, offering flavors of black plum, lilac and a hint of charcoal.

title: Fontanabianca 2015  Barbaresco
description: Enticing aromas of woodland berry, rose petal, underbrush and a balsamic note lead the nose. On the juicy, savory palate, notes of star anise, white pepper and mint accent a red-cherry core. It's well balanced, with fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Giant Steps 2016 Applejack Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: This brightly-hued Pinot shows upfront fruitiness in a ripe red-berry tone, with underscores of pepper, flowers and herbal tea. As the wine opens in the glass, it gets smokier. The savoriness is even more defined on the palate, gliding alongside silky tannins.

title: Huett 2016 Folie Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Winemaker Ryan Huett labels this his “ultra” reserve—no doubt a reference to its single vineyard, single barrel origins. It's a mouthfilling explosion of black cherry cola, with pleasant, persistent highlights of tobacco, tea and lemon oil.

title: Infinito 2014 Winemaker's Selection Malbec (Mendoza)
description: A massive nose with huge blackberry and cassis aromas is ripe to the max. This Malbec is flush but still fairly fresh, so it succeeds in blending power with structure and balance. Flavors of blackberry and cassis show a chocolaty touch on the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: LaRue 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Winemaker Katy Wilson crafts a delicate, grainy and textured wine from coastal fruit in this light-bodied, crisp and fresh take on the variety. Impressive on the midpalate in establishing just the right amount of weight to give it complexity and bite, it finishes in a seductive layer of clove and cola.

title: Les Frères Couillaud 2015 Château de la Ragotière Vallet  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This wine from Vallet, one of the new crus of Muscadet, has been aged for three years. That gives its richness a boost and introduces minerality, spice and intensity. The wine is packed with fruit and tightly textured. Drink now.

title: Melville 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Toasty aromas of seared lemon, citrus pith and ashy Brie rind show on the nose of this bottling from the longtime grape-growing family. The palate is extremely focused and sharp, offering lime sorbet, green pear and more pithy qualities, wrapped in a compellingly grippy texture.

title: No Girls 2015 La Paciencia Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: A bit lighter in color, the aromas offer notes of earthy funk, blackberry, wet stone, blood and smoke—not quite seeming fully ready to reveal their charms on first pour. Fruit and savory flavors coat the palate, showing a sense of elegance, energy and freshness.

title: Occhipinti 2014 Siccagno Nero d'Avola (Terre Siciliane)
description: Sunbaked soil, leather, game, crushed black olive and black-skinned berry are some of the aromas you'll find on this earthy, soulful red. The vibrant palate has great energy, delivering creamy black cherry, spicy blueberry, orange zest and carob alongside fresh acidity and lithe tannins. You'll be rewarded if you open this up at least a few hours ahead of time to let it breathe and fully open up. Drink after 2020.

title: Occhipinti 2016 SP68 Red (Terre Siciliane)
description: A blend of Nero d'Avola and Frappato, this soulful red has earthy aromas of scorched soil, forest floor, new leather, truffle and grilled herb. The succulent, vibrant palate doles out crushed raspberry, juicy strawberry, orange zest, game and dark spice set against bright acidity. Soft tannins provide supple support. Some may find it rustic, but many others will love its terroir-driven personality.

title: Prinz Salm 2017 Quarzit Binger Riesling (Rheinhessen)
description: Reverberating flavors of apricot and tangerine are framed by firm acidity and a pleasant bite of tannins in this stately, sleek dry wine. Full bodied and strident, the finish is long and steely. Drink now–2030.

title: Prinz Salm 2017 Vom Roten Schiefer Riesling (Nahe)
description: The nose is a tad savory here, suggesting delicate whiffs of dried herb, crushed stone and smoke. It's a zesty, citrusy wine full of crisp grapefruit and lemon flavors as well as a touch of peach. Full bodied and dry, it drinks well now but should improve from 2022–2030.

title: Proidl 2014 Senftenberger Rameln Auslese Riesling (Niederösterreich)
description: A slightly reduced nose dulls the bright notions of citrus that vividly dance on the tongue and unleash a panoply of passion fruit, candied grapefruit and lemon. The sweetness is cut perfectly by the zesty sharpness, while the body is luscious but light. Just made for a tarte au citron and other lemon zest-flavored desserts.

title: Proprietà Sperino 2014 Uvaggio Red (Coste della Sesia)
description: Heady scents of rose, iris, forest floor, white pepper and a whiff of wild herb take center stage on this fragrant ethereal red. Vibrant and savory, the linear racy palate offers morello cherry, raspberry, orange zest and star anise offset by polished tannins and bright acidity. A hint of iron defines the finish. It's already delicious but will offer fine drinking for the next several years. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Purple Hands 2016 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This reliable vineyard delivers powerful brambly berry flavors in abundance. It's a big, textural, palate-filling wine, smooth and a bit tannic. There's a touch of green tea in those tannins, and it finishes with a hint of heat. Drink now–2025.

title: Roar 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Noticeably cloudy in the glass, this single-vineyard exploration shows rich mulberry, black plum and candied rose-petal aromas. It's soft and creamy on the palate, where tart red plum and fresh thyme flavors prove a promising pairing.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from a majority of the variety blended with dozens of interplanted varieties that date back to the site's planting in 1890, this impresses in its lovely, lifted aromatics of nutmeg and clove. On the palate, expect blackberry cobbler and plum with an underbelly of balanced ripeness.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Well rounded aromas of red cherry, wood smoke, cowboy leather and earth make for a very accessible entry to the nose of this affordably priced wine. There is a strong snap to the palate and an impressively chalky grip, offering flavors of dark cherry, cranberry and, on the finish, some vanilla.

title: Cayuse 2015 The Lovers Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The bulk of this wine is 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, which is finished off with Syrah. Aromas of moist earth, funk, black currant and herb lead to soft, smooth cherry and green pepper flavors. It possesses a lovely feel.

title: Charles Heintz 2015 Searby Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A thick, rich and oak-laden white on entry, this coastal-influenced white is crunchy in green apple, melon and mango. Ultimately balanced and medium bodied in ripeness and body weight, it finishes in a pleasing note of Meyer lemon.

title: Charles Heintz 2015 Swan Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: An estate wine made entirely from the Swan selection of the grape, this is a delicately layered high-toned red, stratified in rhubarb, strawberry and a burst of dried herb. It is light bodied and coastal in influence and style.

title: Charles Heintz 2015 Valentina Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the Heintz Estate, this is a floral, herbal wine with an edge of carbonic brightness and acidity to it, which works well in its light-bodied frame. Lithe on the palate, it offers a subtle take on pomegranate, rhubarb and black tea.

title: Colombera & Garella 2015 Rosso Red (Coste della Sesia)
description: Crushed mint, pressed rose, wild red berry and dark spice aromas appear in the glass. On the juicy linear palate, licorice and savory mineral notes back up ripe raspberry and Marasca cherry. Polished tannins provide elegance and support. Drink through 2021.

title: Colombo 2014 Apertura Pinot Nero (Piemonte)
description: Made entirely with Pinot Nero, this bright red opens with aromas of rose petal, red berry and baking spice. The linear, light-bodied palate evokes juicy raspberry, cooking spice and a touch of cinnamon alongside vibrant acidity and polished tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Côte West 2016 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Crisp and floral, this wine has mid-tier structure and is ultimately clean, focused and unfussy in style. Restrained ripeness allows room for lemon zest, grapefruit and persistent acidity to shine.

title: Cullen 2016 Ephraim Clarke Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
description: This wine is a complex—and a tad woody—combo of lemon verbena, pineapple cake, wet hay and lavender soap. Slightly slippery in texture and sitting firmly in the medium body spectrum, the integrated herbal and wet stone flavors finish with lick of toast and a salty tang.

title: Cusumano 2016 Benuara Tenuta Presti e Pegni Red (Terre Siciliane)
description: A blend of 70% Nero d'Avola and 30% Syrah, this opens with aromas of dark berry, Mediterranean scrub and cooking spice. The full-bodied, chewy palate delivers blackberry jam, licorice and black pepper alongside dusty tannins. Enjoy through 2022.

title: Devona 2015 Freedom Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: As Devona wines are still produced in Walla Walla, its single vineyard efforts bear only the generic Oregon AVA on the label. The blend here is principally Pommard clone and spent time in 30% new French barrels. Light berry fruit flavors, annotated with herb and stem highlights, finish with stiff tannins and suggestions of cedar and tobacco.

title: Domaine Anthony Girard 2018 Le Chène Fourchu  (Sancerre)
description: Named after a legendary oak tree, this wine is full of ripe tropical and spice flavors. Its rich character is balanced with sophisticated acidity. Densely textured, the wine could do with a few more months, so drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Terlato & Chapoutier 2014 Lieu-Dit Malakoff Shiraz (Pyrenees)
description: This wine leads with a broody nose of plum, earth, coffee, warm stone and baking spice. The palate is woven together by tight tannins, but the acidity keeps things firmly in the medium-bodied spectrum. It finishes with a savory soy sauce note. Drink now.

title: Domaine Terlato & Chapoutier 2014 S-Block Shiraz (Pyrenees)
description: From a single vineyard in the cool climes of Victoria's Pyrenees region, this offers heady notes of cherry, meat, tree bark, chocolate, ground black pepper and spice. The palate is silky and savory, with earthy tannins and a slightly bitter oak note on the finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Edetària 2014 Finca La Pedrissa Old Vines Carignan (Terra Alta)
description: Initial aromas of wet cement, baking spices and creamy oak are as prominent as red-berry scents. This old-vines Carignan from Terra Alta is full to the brim on the palate, with no wiggle room. Saucy, oaky plum flavors come with a full dash of cocoa, while this is warm, oaky and savory tasting on the finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Enrico Serafino 2014 Brut Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: Enticing scents of field flower, orchard fruit and a whiff of bread crust waft out of the glass. On the creamy palate, bright acidity lifts ripe yellow apple, white peach and candied citrus slice alongside a silky mousse.

title: Hans Wirsching 2016 Scheurebe (Franken)
description: Candied citrus and pineapple aromas juxtapose bramble and crushed mineral in this dry, medium-bodied white. Crisp quince and green plum flavors are tart and crunchy but balanced by riper tones of melon rind and grapefruit. The finish is invigorating and mineral. Drink now–2023.

title: Huett 2015 The Silver Lot Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This wine seems to be holding itself back, even after some hours of breathing. There are well-woven suggestions of blackberry, fig, smoke, black tea and charred wood, supported with ample acidity. The tannins are tongue-dryingly astringent. Give this a few more years of bottle aging, and drink in the early 2020s.

title: Hyland 2015 Founders' Selection Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: A reserve selection that blends Coury, Pommard and Wadenswil clones, this is a full-bodied, fleshy wine with berry and black cherry fruit. Barrel aging adds notes of cola, coffee and black licorice, and the wine is buoyed nicely by a seam of citrusy acidity. It's still pulling itself together, and this vintage is one that should cellar well. Drink from 2020 on.

title: Illumination 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Well integrated with a subtle fist of power, this wine is fleshy and fruit forward in apple and lime with a stony mineral edge. A twinge of fresh grapefruit flavor brightens the glass and adds to the overall complexity.

title: Vranken NV Demoiselle Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This soft rosé with strawberry flavors is gentle and ripe, with a relatively high dosage, This rounded wine that has a light texture is ready to drink.

title: Wine by Joe 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Much improved over the previous vintage, this is a bit rough and tumble, but packed with fig, cherry and black olive flavors. The tannins are astringent, with a taste of black tea, suggesting that this might well accompany a fat cut of Alaska salmon.

title: Gambino 2016 Tifeo Bianco  (Etna)
description: A blend of Carricante and Catarratto, this offers subtle aromas of yellow spring flower and citrus zest. Crisp and light bodied, the vibrant palate offers lemon and a hint of saline alongside tangy acidity.

title: Ca'Romè 2015 Maria di Brun  (Barbaresco)
description: The shy nose eventually reveals toasted oak, scorched earth and a hint of spearmint. The assertive palate delivers coconut, sour cherry and espresso alongside grainy, astringent tannins that clench the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Ca'Romè 2015 Rio Sordo  (Barbaresco)
description: Subdued aromas evoking toasted oak and mocha slowly appear in the glass. The tight assertive palate offers roasted coffee bean, clove and licorice alongside raspy tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: De Bortoli NV DB Family Selection Brut  (Australia)
description: This is a straightforward bubbly that's fruity and crisp in feel, with a slightly slippery texture. It ticks all the boxes.

title: Schmitt Söhne 2017 Relax Riesling (Mosel)
description: Whiffs of saffron and pollen lend a savory tone to this medium-sweet wine. It's easy-drinking yet vibrant, with notes of orange peel, lemon and dusty minerality. Racy acidity offers levity on the finish.

title: 4 Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Asian pear, spice and pineapple aromas lead to medium-bodied fruit flavors that drop off on the back half. It comes off as a bit light, but there's interest to be had.

title: Abbeyville 2016 Tanner's Passage Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This is a good medium-bodied wine that emphasizes fresh fruit flavors and a smooth, natural-feeling texture. There's not much oak or butter to trick it up, so pure apple and pear notes take the lead.

title: Alara 2016 Grenache (Central Coast)
description: Woody aromas meet with primary dark-berry fruits and grape seed on the nose of this bottling. It's rather floral on the palate and offers very ripe berry fruits, yet is cut with strong acidity as well.

title: Batasiolo 2014 Briccolina  (Barolo)
description: Forest-floor, dark spice, toasted oak and menthol aromas lead the nose. The taut linear palate offers raw sour cherry, powdered sage and a hint of roasted coffee bean alongside firm acidity and dusty, close-grained tannins that leave an abrupt drying finish. It's on the lean side in terms of fruit richness so let the tannins unwind for another few years then drink sooner rather than later.

title: Benanti 2017 Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Bright and easygoing, this fresh rosato has juicy flavors of wild red berry, dried herb and a hint of white pepper. Tangy acidity and a salty mineral note give it a succulent finish.

title: Bianchi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling offers light citrus, burned toast and wet cement aromas. Sour Granny Smith apple flavors show on the palate, which offers a touch of tension.

title: Biokult 2017 Rosé Secco Sparkling (Weinland Österreich)
description: A very vivid pink and exuberant notes of cherry candy and raspberry lead onto a very fruit-driven, berry-laden palate. This is light, lively, fun and off-dry for uncomplicated enjoyment.

title: Bodegas Veganzones 2015 Viejo Mundo Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Soapy red-fruit aromas are questionable. In the mouth, this is tough and pulling, with no holds barred. Candied berry and sugar beet flavors finish with intensity but also a green residual note.

title: Borgogno F.lli Serio e Battista 2014  Barolo
description: This has delicate scents of wild rose, underbrush and crushed mint while the taut, rather light-bodied palate offers cranberry, pomegranate and a hint of white pepper. Dusty tannins and racy acidity provide the setting.

title: Cave des Vins de Sancerre 2017 Les Marennes  (Sancerre)
description: A blend of wines from across Sancerre, this wine is soft, with rich yellow fruits as well as citrus. It offers warm fruitiness, fully integrated acidity and texture that is lightly mineral at the end. Drink now.

title: Chehalem 2016 Ridgecrest Vineyards Gamay Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: Gamay Noir remains fairly rare in Oregon but occupies a useful niche; it's more of a simple country red great for midweek quaffing. High-toned plum and sour cherry fruit flavors are on display, with plenty of backing acidity.

title: Claude Baron NV Cuvée Saphir Brut  (Champagne)
description: Still young and very crisp, this Pinot Meunier-based wine is open and textured. Its acidity and bright white fruits show an edge of minerality and a taut aftertaste. Drink this bottling from 2019.

title: Cline 2016 Cashmere Red (California)
description: Mild wood smoke and black pepper aromas give this Rhône-style blend a spicy start, while good broad black-plum and roast-beef flavors are framed by moderate tannins and acidity for good balance.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2017 Spätlese Traminer (Burgenland)
description: The intense note of candied lemon peel and honeyed but sharp citrus on the nose already promises richness. This duly follows on the palate, gushing with ripe and luscious apricot, melon and mandarin. These generously alluring notions of sweetness are perfectly countered by vivid freshness. This is light in body and entirely precise, yet luscious. A wonderful high-wire act. Perfect for slightly sweet desserts and washed-rind cheeses.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2017 Piocho Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling, which includes 12% Sémillion, starts with fresh and snappy aromas of wet grass, ripe passion fruit and cold rain—a stunning aromatic combo. The palate is extremely zippy, with powerful acid slicing through flavors of lemongrass, lime and wet stone.

title: Jonathan Didier Pabiot 2016 Prédilection  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Using wild yeasts and biodynamically grown grapes, this wine is intense and impressive. The richness is restrained by taut minerality and acidity, cutting through the ripe white and citrus fruits to give balance and the potential for further aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Louis Roederer 2013 Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: A smoothly textured wine, this is perfectly in balance, with red berry and currant fruitiness assimilated into the lightly tannic and crisp texture. Drink from 2019.

title: Luigi Baudana 2014 Baudana  (Barolo)
description: New leather, menthol, woodland berry and tobacco aromas all come together on this focused red along with a floral note. The medium-bodied, firmly structured palate offers red cherry, cranberry and dark culinary spice set against tightly knit fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2034.

title: Lynmar 2016 Quail Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Heady floral and toasted oak aromas are inviting on the nose. Flavors of crisp apple and pear meld with additions of sea salt and pretzel.

title: Mastroberardino 2011 Naturalis Historia  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of scorched earth, new leather, underbrush and a whiff of oak lead the nose. The firm palate shows prune, mature blackberry, cocoa and clove set against tight, fine-grained tannins that still need a few more years to unwind. Drink 2021–2031.

title: Melville 2017 Clone 76 Inox Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: If freshness is the challenge, this very light yet vibrant bottling by Chad Melville is a champion. Aromas of pear flesh and lime blossom lead into a sip that dances across the tongue with flavors of Asian pear, white melon and lemon juice, finishing with a hint of intriguing ash. The wine still zips days later.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Bucher Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This fleshy medium-bodied red from the Westside Road site tastes of cherry liqueur, cassis, stemmy black tea and forest floor. This is a pretty wine that's also powerful, with undeniable balance.

title: Pfeffingen 2016 Auslese Scheurebe (Pfalz)
description: Light as a feather yet intensely penetrating, this medium-sweet wine is a laser-edged explosion of fresh white peach, pineapple, strawberry and lychee flavors. It's lavishly fruity and floral, but nuanced by savory hints of saffron and caramelized sugar. Fresh, lemony acidity and a lingering honey tone lead the long, piercing finish. It's gorgeous already, but it should evolve well through 2030.

title: Planeta 2014 Santa Cecilia Nero d'Avola (Noto)
description: Red fruit, exotic spice and blue flower aromas mingle together on this elegant wine. Made entirely with Nero d'Avola, the focused, linear palate evokes black cherry, pomegranate, star anise and wild herb framed in taut, fine-grained tannins and vibrant acidity. It has great tension and will be even better in a few more years.

title: Produttori del Barbaresco 2013  Barbaresco
description: Rose, iris, red woodland berry and cake spice are just some of the alluring aromas you'll find on this radiant red. The vibrant elegant palate delivers succulent strawberry, red cherry, licorice and cinnamon alongside silky tannins. Bright acidity gives it impeccable balance. Drink through 2023.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Rosso Feudo di Mezzo  (Etna)
description: Exotic spice, French oak, menthol and Mediterranean scrub aromas all come out on this. Boasting an intriguing combination of structure and weightlessness, the elegant palate evokes Marasca cherry, star anise, tobacco and espresso framed in fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity.

title: Veuve Clicquot Ponsardin 2008 La Grande Dame Brut  (Champagne)
description: This rich Champagne is dominated, as usual, by Pinot Noir. Its ripe fruit is approaching maturity, the hints of toast and croissant becoming more apparent. It is balanced, rich but textured and with an opulent, ripe aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Vieira de Sousa 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: There is a fresh character to this wine with its black-currant fruits lifting the tannins. At the same time, the spirit edge and the juicy fruit are balanced by the firm structure. Drink this wine from 2027.

title: Jean-Noël Haton 2012 Noble Vintage Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is an exemplary wine in its balance, texture and concentration. While it is still somewhat young, its rich fruit and taut texture indicate considerable potential. Age this wine for the intense acidity to soften. Drink from 2020.

title: A.R. Lenoble  NV Intense Mag 14 Brut  (Champagne)
description: This intense wine is also rich, with a good layer of spice and a mature character. It includes 40% reserve wine aged in bottle before blending, giving richness and wonderful ripeness. Drink now.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Génération Dix-Neuf  (Sancerre)
description: This wine celebrates the 19 generations (mostly called Alphonse) that have run this top Sancerre estate since the 17th century. The wine offers ripe fruit, bold quince and spice flavors, with hints of apricot. Structured and concentrated, it is a wine to savor, but not before 2019.

title: Ancien 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Layered and expertly textured, this impressive wine offers focused flavors of apple, pear and more exotic earth and spice components of anise and nutmeg. Medium bodied, it's defined in complex acidity and a marked length of integrated oak.

title: Archery Summit 2015 Archer's Edge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This vineyard, planted in 2007, is still delivering young, fresh and fruity wines, well ripened here to a flavor of raspberry jam. There's a suggestion of orange marmalade also, the fruit concentrating through the midpalate, and exiting with a light touch of tobacco and barrel spices.

title: Giacomo Fenocchio 2014 Bussia  (Barolo)
description: Enticing scents of star anise, perfumed berry, blue flower and a whiff of menthol take center stage on this fragrant Barolo. The tense medium-bodied palate offers red cherry, strawberry, licorice, iron and a hint of balsamic herb framed in polished tannins and vibrant acidity. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Gran Cruz 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This is a dry style, full of tannins that are still masking the perfumed black fruits. It is intense, full of violet aromas as well as dark-plum flavors. The wine will need plenty of time, so don't drink before 2029.

title: Kevin White 2016 Reserve Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is near equal parts Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre from Elephant Mountain, Boushey and Sugarloaf vineyards. The black pepper, white pepper, garrigue, blueberry, cassis, dark strawberry and smoked meat aromas show a lot of complexity. Smoked meat, orange peel, strawberry and plum flavors follow, showing mesmerizing purity and verticality. An extended finish caps it off. It's a complete knockout.

title: Lange 2016 30th Anniversary Estate Vineyards Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This landmark effort celebrates the winery's 30th vintage. It's stylish and distinctive, yet, in keeping with the house tradition, it is in no way overblown. Juicy raspberry and cherry fruit flavors abound, finished with a light touch of barrel toast after 20 months in French oak. Delicious already, it should continue to provide pleasure over the next full decade.

title: Ledge 2016 Dante Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Templeton Gap District)
description: There is a strong but not overripe fruit character on the nose of this bottling from historic vines, with baked strawberry, plums and mulberry as well as a dusting of sweet clove. The palate is more lightly bodied than many Zins of the area and is also full of energy, showing bright and fresh red-fruit flavors and baking spice, eliciting elements not often seen from the grape these days.

title: Mandois 2007 Cuvée Victor Mandois Vieilles Vignes Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Not only is this 11-year-old Champagne made from old vines, giving it concentration, it also has oak aging, adding to the toasty character. It is rich, well balanced and now mature. Drink now.
designation: Cuvée Victor Mandois Vieilles Vignes Brut

title: Massimo Clerico 2011 Riserva  (Lessona)
description: Underbrush, grilled herb, new leather, violet and spiced berry aromas lift out of the glass. On the supple palate, polished tannins lithely weave through morello cherry, black raspberry, tobacco and white pepper, while a savory mineral note backs up the close. Drink through 2026.

title: Metzker Family Estates 2016 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Perfumed and floral, this is bursting in stemmy earth and ash, forest pine and black tea. Concentrated, intriguing and fleshy, it shows its wild provenance, complemented in tart cherry and rhubarb layers that linger on the finish.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This classic bottling is still a baby and needs plenty of time to open. When it does, aromas of toasted hazelnuts, light oak, lemon pith and exotic apples show on the nose. The palate combines oak smoke with savory sea salt and sumptuous golden apple fruits. Drink 2019–2030.

title: Mumm Napa 2011 DVX Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: A 50-50 blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, given time to age, this shows layers of richness that can only be earned over time. Rounded supple acidity supports broad complex layers of green apple, Meyer lemon and peach. It finishes crisp and dry.

title: Offley 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: A floral wine with violet perfumes, this wine shows the influence of Touriga Nacional. Its great fruits are balanced by tannins giving the wine a dry core. The perfumed character needs to soften out before this wine will be drinkable. Drink from 2027.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2016 Sauvage  (Sancerre)
description: This wine has great richness. It is produced using natural yeasts from selected parcels. Ripe and full of concentrated white fruits and tense acidity, it needs aging to soften the intensity. Drink from 2020.

title: Pflüger 2016 Dürkheimer Fronhof Trocken Pinot Noir (Pfalz)
description: Succulent black cherry and blackberry aromas juxtapose toast and smoke on the nose of this luscious, full-bodied Pinot Noir. Equal parts fruit and earth, its opulent black fruit flavors are accented by hints of beetroot, violet and anise. The finish is gorgeously clingy, framed by soft, feathery tannins and a touch of licorice candy. Quite delicious already but should improve through 2030.

title: Pol Roger 2009 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This perfumed wine has just the right color and lively, crisp acidity. The full-bodied feel is very much the house style of this producer, giving richness from ripe red fruits as well as balanced acidity to finish. The wine is generous and ready to drink.

title: Pommery 2004 Cuvée Louise Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is the palest possible rosé, with a hard-to-discern hint of pink. On the palate, the wine is now more about mature richness than any connection to rosé. That said, it is a fine wine, ripe with secondary flavors and layers of toast. It is now ready to drink.

title: Satyre Wines 2015 Aristeaus Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: With a perfumed nose of rose and lavender, this lovely light-hearted wine is fleshy and complex, the texture plush and softly silky. Sourced from Morelli Lane and Manzana vineyards, both farmed by the Duttons, it's brimming in blueberry, rhubarb and strawberry, with a dusting of clove and cardamom.

title: Shea 2016 Shea Vineyard Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This blend of various blocks on the estate is the most widely available and least expensive of the winery's Pinots. It's a silky, seductive wine, aromatic and balanced. Supple berry fruit is backed by barrel spices (50% new French oak was used). Streaks of cola and cocoa ride out the finish, with supple, polished tannins.

title: Tantara 2016 Dierberg Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Smoked almonds, wood spice, peach and Meyer lemon preserves show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from vines planted in 1997. It's very tightly wound on the palate, with plenty of peach, mango and salted lemon flavors riding balanced acidity.

title: Bründlmayer NV Extra Brut Reserve  (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Creamy, aromatic and fresh notes of fine, ripe yellow apple and pastry on the nose lead onto a fresh, bright and equally creamy palate, where a streak of lemon freshness provides structure and direction. This is complex with its hints of flint and lemon-flecked short crust. The mousse is fine and detailed; the style is slender and elegant but rich. A very classy sparkler that will also develop. Drink now–2025.

title: Franz Keller 2016 Vom Löss Pinot Noir (Baden)
description: The nose of this wine is beautifully perfumed, suggesting whiffs of cherry blossom, graphite, plum and smoke. Black cherry and berry flavors seem delicate initially, but amass concentration and complexity with aeration, building layers of savory earth and tannin. A full-bodied, rich and expansive wine, it should improve well through 2030.

title: Falua 2012 Conde de Vimioso Extra Bruto Sparkling (Tejo)
description: A creamy blend of Touriga Nacional and Chardonnay to give a fruity wine with melon and spice flavors as well as light acidity. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Leconfield NV SYN Rouge Shiraz (Coonawarra)
description: This is a rich, heady wine offering Shiraz's notorious trio of ripe plum, chocolate and peppery spice. The palate feels heavy and a little syrupy sweet. The light fizz and tannic edge do little to lift the palate.

title: Lorimar 2015 Red (California)
description: Blatant oak aromas and flavors dominate whatever fruit flavors might lie underneath. It smells sweet and spicy, tastes spicy and has moderate tannins and high alcohol.

title: Naggiar 2017 Estate Rosé (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a fruity, soft-textured and sweet wine with cherry and raspberry flavors. The mouthfeel is rich and plush and the acidity is quite low.

title: Paul Buisse 2017 Domaine Paul Buisse Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: For a Touraine Sauvignon, this is rich and ripe with tropical fruits as well as the necessary acidity. It is fruity, with a lightly zesty texture and a soft aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Trentadue 2016 Old Patch Red (California)
description: This wine is very fruity, smooth and polished, showing light oaky touches on ripe plum and black-cherry flavors that finish on the sweet side. The texture is soft and acidity feels low.

title: Vite Colte 2017 Merlana  (Erbaluce di Caluso)
description: Lightly scented, this informal white offers aromas evoking beeswax and a whiff of field flower. The simple palate suggests yellow pear and apple before a fresh finish.

title: Cruzat NV Cuvée Nature  (Uco Valley)
description: Yeasty aromas of lemon and apple are solid enough. This sparkler is fairly mellow in feel, with modest grip and acidity. Bready, slightly briny apple flavors settle on a mild finish that some might say is lacking.

title: Bedell 2016 Viognier (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Quiet tones of white flowers and citrus carry the nose and palate. This is a simple, straightforward white that would appeal to those looking for a light, crisp refresher.

title: Chopo 2016 Red (Jumilla)
description: Heavy berry aromas give way to scented soap and cola notes. This blend of 80% Monastrell and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon is quite heavy, with a syrupy mouthfeel cut by rough acidity. Black-fruit flavors lack flow on a flush but stunted finish.

title: Cruzat NV Brut Rosé Méthodo Tradicional  (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Bland, harmless aromas are a touch soapy and sweet but don't signal anything in particular. A basic palate is plump, while generic flavors are much like the nose, meaning simple and lacking in definition.

title: D'Arenberg 2014 The Custodian Grenache (McLaren Vale)
description: Considering Grenache's soft and cuddly reputation, this rendition is rather hard-edged. The variety's characteristic ripe berry and white pepper combo is there, accompanied by a little meat and flower stalks, but there's an unexpected bite to the acidity, that, when combined with the tight, drying tannins, make taking another sip a challenge.

title: Flegenheimer Bros. NV Out of the Park Sparkling Shiraz (South Australia)
description: This sparkler shows off luscious characters of ripe plum, raspberry jam, cherry, chocolate cake and coffee. It's sweet and fairly syrupy in feel, with ample bubbles and soft tannins.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Sauvignon Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine)
description: This light, fruity and herbal wine shows a good balance between citrus and gooseberry fruits and a bright, fresh character. Drink this simple wine now.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2016 Petit Bourgeois Cabernet Franc (Val de Loire)
description: This simple, perfumed wine has attractive red fruits to go with its barnyard character and light acidity. Soft with just a hint of tannins, it has a fruity finish. Drink now.

title: Kenwood 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Creamy thick with a candied midpalate of watermelon Jolly Rancher and strawberry jam, this has elements of dried herb and jalapeño.

title: Magister Bibendi 2014 Navarrsotillo Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Baked, earthy berry aromas are cooked and nutty, not fresh. A palate with heft is awkward and a bit out of balance, while this Garnacha tastes of roasted berry fruits and burnt wood. Lingering oak spice is the most notable flavor on a heavy finish.

title: Maryhill 2017 Tudor Hills Vineyards Pinot Gris (Yakima Valley)
description: Ripe peach and apple aromas are out front, followed by whiffs of tropical fruit. The palate brings dried apple flavors with a lightly smoky finish.

title: Settesoli 2017 Pinot Grigio (Terre Siciliane)
description: Lightly scented, this informal, light-bodied white opens with whiffs of white spring flower and orchard fruit. The fresh, simple palate suggests white peach and a hint of citrus rind.

title: Spann Vineyards 2014 S & M Syrah-Malbec (Sonoma County)
description: This blends 67% Syrah with 33% Malbec to powerful effect. The wine is thick in nondescript red berry and blueberry notes and oaky tannin.

title: Shea 2016 Shea Vineyard Block 23 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This single-block wine is made from 100% Pommard clone Pinot Noir. Full, round and forward, it's bursting with baking spice, blackberry pastry, fig and raisin. It's focused, long and simply delicious.

title: Travaglini 2012 Riserva  (Gattinara)
description: Dark spice, crushed rose, Alpine herb and mature berry aromas appear in the glass. The structured, elegant palate delivers dried Marasca cherry, cranberry, licorice and tobacco set against firm noble tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance.

title: A.R. Lenoble  NV Chouilly Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Mag 14 Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This is one of a pair of wines in which this producer ages a significant amount of reserve wine in bottle before blending. The result is a concentrated wine, superrich while never losing sight of the strong minerality that comes from top Chardonnay on the Côte des Blancs. Drink this bottling from 2019.
designation: Chouilly Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Mag 14 Brut

title: H. Blin NV Rosé de Saignée Edition Limitée Extra-Brut Pinot Meunier (Champagne)
description: The color of this limited-edition production is darker than many rosés, the product of skin contact rather than adding red wine. The color also heralds the richness of the wine, with its several years of bottle aging. Toast comes through the red fruits and the well-balanced acidity. Drink now.
designation: Rosé de Saignée Edition Limitée Extra-Brut

title: Quinta Santa Eufemia 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: A ripe wine, this Port is packed with rich fruits and tannin that are both spicy and luscious. This is wine that has great fruitiness, ripe tannins as well as a firm core of structure. Expect this wine to age for many years and don't touch before 2027.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2015 En Grands Champs  (Sancerre)
description: From a parcel within the La Moussière estate, this is a luscious wine. Its wood is still present but will be absorbed by the generous black fruits and tannins. The wine has profited from the fine vintage and shows impressive richness. Drink from 2020.

title: Alphonse Mellot 2016 Satellite  (Sancerre)
description: This is a new cuvée from Alphonse Mellot, derived from old vines in Chavignol. Like with all the Mellot wines, the fruit is ripe, organically grown and very pure. The structure and concentration will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2020.

title: Boizel 2004 Joyau de France Brut  (Champagne)
description: For the pleasure of drinking a mature Champagne, this is just right at this moment. Any longer and it will tip over, but through 2019 it is poised between rich fruit and nuts, toast and spice. Drink now.

title: Brovia 2014 Unio  (Barolo)
description: Iris, new leather, aromatic herb and dark spice are just some of the aromas you'll find on this fragrant, focused red. The chiseled, elegantly structured palate is all about firm finesse, offering red cherry, cranberry, star anise, chopped mint and white pepper framed in taut refined tannins and vibrant acidity. Still youthfully austere, it's a classic Barolo reminiscent of times gone by, and will be even better in a few more years. Drink 2020–2029.

title: Collet NV Esprit Couture Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is the prestige cuvée from this co-op producer. Coming in a attractive, Art Deco-style bottle, the wine plays its elegant part. A strong toast flavor doesn't detract from the ripe green-fruit tone and bright acidity, while the palate feels rich and smooth. Drink now.

title: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2011 Riserva  (Taurasi)
description: Concentrated and full bodied, this opens with inviting aromas of truffle, cocoa, ripe black-skinned fruit and balsamic notes. The aromas follow over to the juicy, jammy palate along with licorice and carob notes. Velvety tannins embrace the brooding flavors. Drink through 2026.

title: Contrade di Taurasi–Lonardo 2012 Coste  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas of spiced plum, truffle, iris, menthol and leather follow through to the juicy, concentrated palate along with fleshy blackberry, clove and licorice. Firm, velvety tannins provide support. Give this a few more years to fully unwind and develop even more complexity. Drink 2022–2035.

title: Davies 2016 Ferrington Vineyards Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A little smokier in aroma and fuller in flavor than the rest of the range of Davies Pinots, this wine tastes robust, ripe and exotic, but still has bright acidity and firm tannins to give structure. It is full bodied, nicely oaky and well balanced. Best through 2024.

title: Domaine Laporte 2016 La Comtesse  (Sancerre)
description: This wine comes from vines on the edge of the village of Chavignol, one of the top sites in Sancerre. Balanced and mineral driven, it is structured with acidity and tangy, tight texture. The wine also offers apricot and white stone-fruit flavors finishing with concentrated acidity. Drink from 2019.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Plush and expansive from start to finish, this is an impressive wine with length and breadth. Jolts of well-defined flavors of cherry and vanilla meet spice and earth, making for a contemplative, tasty wine.
designation: Year of the Ram Single Vineyard

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Dutton Ranch Morelli Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From vines planted in the 19th century, near the town of Occidental, this is a knockout wine, integrated and memorably spicy, and with a dash of white pepper at its core. Baked blueberry and cherry meet cinnamon and chocolate powder around a persistence of underlying freshness and beauty.

title: Franchetti–Passopisciaro 2016 Contrada P Nerello Mascalese (Terre Siciliane)
description: Wild red berry, dark culinary spice, blue flower, moist soil and flinty aromas escape from the glass. Elegant yet enveloping, the succulent palate evokes crushed raspberry, star anise, truffle and a whiff of Mediterranean herb. Polished tannins and bright acidity provide lithe support and balance. Drink 2021–2028.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2015 Cuvée Etienne Henri  (Sancerre)
description: Etienne Henri Bourgeois pioneered oak aging in Sancerre. Made in exceptional years, this wine is aged in oak, giving it a smooth texture and an attractive touch of spice. It is just reaching maturity, with the white fruits and toast beautifully integrated. Drink now.

title: Jim Barry 2013 The Armagh Shiraz (Clare Valley)
description: The 2013 vintage was a warm year with a short harvest, and so the Jim Barry's top red wine is more than ready to drink now. While it may not have as long a cellaring life as some of its predecessors, it's still a beautiful a wine. It starts with aromas of dried flowers, Dr. Pepper, raisiny plums, raw meat, milk chocolate and spices like cumin, star anise and white pepper. The palate is still showing relatively juicy, primary fruit that's sewn together with ultrafine, powdery tannins and an earthy spine. This is powerful yet finessed.

title: Lallier NV Ouvrage Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: Aged for five years with a cork stopper rather than the usual metal stopper, this wine is concentrated, bringing together great fruit, structure, a mineral texture and a rich aftertaste. The wine's intensity demands further aging, drink this bottling from 2020.

title: Cortes de Cima 2017 Rosé (Alentejano)
