title: Elk Cove 2016 Five Mountain Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: There's lovely styling evident in this young wine, which seems delicately sculpted and boasts mouthfilling flavors. Plum, blueberry and brown spices are in the mix, with polished tannins that ensure a smooth glide through the lingering finish.

title: Raptor Ridge 2014 Sparkling Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Produced from Hartzinger Vineyard Pinot Noir, this potent bubbly spent three years en tirage. It's a sunset copper color, with tangy strawberry and cherry flavors. Bubbles are compact, and the wine has the requisite acidity, finishing with a refreshing burst of minerality.

title: Rioja Vega 2014 Edición Limitada  (Rioja)
description: Ripe red-fruit aromas are slightly candied and include notes of brick dust and baking spices. On the palate, this is lively and in good health. Savory, lightly roasted plum and currant flavors finish steady, with freshness, residual red-fruit flavors and finally some noticeable oak. Drink through 2021.

title: Riverbench 2015 Cork Jumper Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Hay yellow in the glass, this vibrant bubbly, made from Chardonnay, offers aromas of toast and shaved nectarine on the nose. The palate is loaded with lemon flavors, proving tangy, tart and pleasantly sour as it rides across the creamy mousse.

title: Robert Biale 2015 EBA Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: An extended barrel-aged red, given 30 months to settle in French oak, this wine remains thick and chewy on the palate, a fistful of red raspberry and blackberry finding supportive acidity to boost the fruit. Bark, oak and graham cracker characteristics add richness and complexity. Enjoy best 2025 through 2030.

title: Robert Biale 2015 Like Father, Like Son Syrah-Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth and velvety with a taste of black pepper, leather, fig and gravel, this wine integrates its tannin and oak well, allowing room for complexity and freshness to flourish. It has aspects of violet and lavender and a richness on the finish that speaks to blackberry jam.

title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2016 Pinot Noir  (Sancerre)
description: This rich wine shows great balance between its tannins and its broad black-cherry flavors. It offers pure fruitiness, acidity and a perfumed, dry core. The wine is just ready to drink.

title: Schloss Schönborn 2016 Graf von Schönborn Trocken Riesling (Rheingau)
description: This is a dry, mineral wine, with a bold backbone of crushed slate and smoke. Full bodied and quite creamy in texture, it's a satisfying Riesling with inviting hints of citrus, tropical melon and cookie crumbs that linger on the finish. Enjoy now through 2023.

title: Siduri 2016 Clos Pepe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Red-cherry compote, star anise, red licorice and a hint of vanilla show on the nose of this bottling from one of Adam Lee's longtime sources in the region. The palate offers rusty and earth flavors of baked cherry, but is quite snappy and crisp, enhanced by oregano, pepper and dried flowers.

title: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2014 Elivette Red (Spring Mountain District)
description: This is a lovely, structured blend half Cabernet Sauvignon with 17% Petit Verdot, 15% Malbec, 14% Cabernet Franc and 4% Merlot, from the mountainous estate. Opening in a sweet nose of sage and vanilla, it's savory in red currant and cassis, with grippy tannins. Enjoy best from 2024–2030.

title: Talisman 2014 Gunsalus Vineyard Dijon Clone 114 Méthode Ancienne Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, light and grippy on the midpalate in toasted oak and firm tannin, this is moderately structured and fully ripe, brimming in black cherry, cola and clove.
designation: Gunsalus Vineyard Dijon Clone 114 Méthode Ancienne

title: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2015 Agnès Sorel  (Saint-Nicolas-de-Bourgueil)
description: This is a ripe, smoky wine, with soft tannins and swathes of red fruits. It is still young, with a stalky character, but it will fill out as it matures because the weight and the tannins are very present. Drink from 2020. It is named after a mistress of King Charles VII of France.

title: Keuka Spring 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: A fragrant perfume of rose petals, melon, ginger and white pepper spice comes together in the glass. Succulent in feel, the palate is broad and oily, with supportive acidity and mild astringency maintaining balance. Flavors of juicy yellow apple, melon and spiced potpourri broaden the midpalate and lead to a delicate jasmine note on the lingering finish.

title: 12 Linajes 2015 Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Smoky black-fruit aromas meet the basics for a top-notch Ribera wine. While this grinds a bit on the palate, it's not too scouring. Bold berry flavors show a saucy gamy side on a finish with mild heat and scrappy intensity. Drink through 2025.

title: A.R. Lenoble  NV Rosé Terroirs  (Champagne)
description: As in all this producer's wines, a good proportion is aged in wood before blending. This gives the house style of richness and tight spice, balancing the dry nature of the wine. All Chardonnay except for the Pinot Noir to give color, this rosé is taut, crisp, light in color and ready to drink.

title: Angove 2016 Warboys Vineyard Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: An enticing nose of mocha, raisiny plum fruit, vanilla and licorice glide gracefully into a well-balanced palate. This is silky, smooth in feel, with tightly structured tannins and a finish of cedar and black pepper. Drink now–2028.

title: Anthesis 2016 Stermer & Briscoe Vineyards Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Anthesis (not antithesis!) is produced and marketed by Blue Apron, one of several online start-ups offering home delivered fresh foods. This vineyard-designated, organically grown wine is a genuinely substantial effort. Black cherry and raspberry jam push flavors forward, while firm tannins and a touch of black olive keep the finish textural and lingering. It's packaged in a 500 ml bottle, perfect with that dinner for two.

title: Archery Summit 2016 Dundee Hills Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: The first of the winery's 2016s, this young wine shows tart pomegranate and white raspberry fruits, with a hint of watermelon, as one might find in a rosé. Fermented in a mix of oak, concrete and stainless steel, the resulting blend is lighter than the previous vintage, with a well-balanced, savory finish.

title: Argyle 2016 Spirithouse Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Sourced from the Knudsen vineyard, this medium-bodied effort brings flavors of brambly berries and a touch of wet stone. It seems to trail off a bit in the finish, leaving a light lick of citrus as it fades.

title: Atrea 2016 Old Soul Red (Mendocino County)
description: Bold in flavor and stiff in structure, this full-bodied wine is laced with strong tannins and will need rich, fatty food to pair with. Still, it reveals nicely concentrated blueberry and blackberry flavors, subdued oak accents and a well-concentrated and layered composition.

title: Ayala NV Brut Majeur  (Champagne)
description: The nonvintage cuvée from this producer, this bottling exemplifies the drier style that's the firm's hallmark. It is elegant, a fruity wine that is also crisply textured. Drink now.

title: Quinta do Arrobe 2014 Mensangem Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: Soft and fruity, this blend of Touriga Nacional, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is open and gently structured. Its red fruits and maturing balance are cut with attractive acidity and bright fruitiness. Drink the wine now.

title: Quinta do Arrobe 2017 Mensagem Branco White (Tejo)
description: This soft fruity wine, is made rich by a creamy texture and given freshness by crisp Sauvignon Blanc and Arinto. The wine is refreshing, rounded and attractive. Drink now.

title: Roger Champault & Fils 2016 Les Pierris  (Sancerre)
description: This attractive, cherry-flavored wine has light tannins and acidity. A cool stalky character gives the wine lightness and a fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2017 Beyra Vinhos de Altitude Grande Reserva White (Beira Interior)
description: A half-and-half blend of Fonte Cal and Síria, the wine is ripe and fruity. It has fresh apple-juice flavors that are lifted by the citrus fruitiness. An attractive, crisp wine, this is ready to drink.
designation: Beyra Vinhos de Altitude Grande Reserva

title: Sanguinhal 2016 Casabel Red (Lisboa)
description: This softly textured ripe wine has spicy black fruits and a light touch of tannins. Rich and balanced, the wine is delicious with a rounded texture that is cut by acidity. Drink this wine now.

title: Schlink Haus 2017 Spätburgunder Rosé (Nahe)
description: This is an invitingly fruity wine, displaying a perfumed nose of strawberry and red currant jam. It's a touch candied and confected on the palate, but approachable and forward. The finish is marked by a hint of residual sugar. Drink now.

title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2016 ReZerve Barbera (Amador County)
description: A strong earthy meaty aroma is followed by herb, tomato and green-olive flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It has a distinct personality that relies on savory characters and makes a fun change of pace.

title: Swedish Hill 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Quiet aromas of peaches and orchard blossoms offer a pleasing entry to this wine. It's rounded and juicy in feel, with a mild stone fruit concentration and a pleasantly crisp finish.

title: Thomas Schmitt 2017 Estate Bottled Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Light on its feet and fruity, this is an easy-drinking wine that boasts concentrated flavors of white grapefruit, apple and lemon. It's off dry and uncomplicated, with a thirst-quench finish that is edged by a delicate honey tone.

title: ZD 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is broadly brawny in big ripe flavors of black fruit and molasses with a tightly wound tannins.

title: Adega Cooperativa do Cartaxo 2015 Terras de Cartaxo Clássico Red (Tejo)
description: This simple, fruity wine is softly textured and well balanced. It has layers of red fruits, acidity and a light touch of tannin. Blending Castelão, Trincadeira and Tinta Roriz, it is ready to drink.

title: Alagna 2016 Lannì Red (Terre Siciliane)
description: A blend of Nero d'Avola and Syrah, this has aromas suggesting prune and vanilla. The aromas segue over to the ripe palate alongside a green sensation of powdered sage.

title: Arráez 2017 Vivir Sin Dormir Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Briary berry aromas collapse toward the center of the nose on this extracted Monastrell. A cratering, smacking palate tastes of baked berry fruits, prune, oak grain and clove, while a fleshy finish is chocolaty and thick.

title: Atwater 2016 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)
description: Ripe aromas of juicy pineapple and grapefruit shine on the nose and palate. This is light in feel, with a citric kick that brightens flavors of ripe orchard fruit and chalk.

title: Bedell 2016 Taste White (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Quiet aromas of tonic and citrus open up to a light-bodied palate driven by flavors of lemon-lime and apple. This is an easygoing blend of 65% Albariño, 15% Chardonnay, 10% Sauvignon Blanc and 10% Viognier.

title: Bell 2016 The Scoundrel Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (California)
description: This sweet-seeming medium-bodied wine blends vanilla aromas with milk chocolate and cherry flavors and a soft texture for a simple and soothing character.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2014 Glorioso Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy berry aromas show lemony oak and wood resin. This feels tannic, grabby and hollow in the middle. Herbal berry flavors lean in the direction of green, while this tastes minty and low on fruit on the finish.

title: Cantina della Serra 2016 Larol  (Erbaluce di Caluso)
description: Aromas of butterscotch, toast and vanilla carry over to the palate along with roasted coffee bean, oak and a hint of dried yellow apple. It has bright acidity but lacks the fruit richness needed to stand up to the dominant oak sensations.

title: Casa Primicia 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Reedy cherry and berry aromas are gritty, while a fairly full palate deals earthy plum and spice flavors that are peppery. This tastes roasted on a firm, tough finish. Charm and high notes are fleeting on this Crianza.

title: Dusty Cellars 2017 Viognier (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: The aromas are quite subdued for the variety, with light notes of flower and spice. The palate is medium bodied, focused down the middle with stone fruit flavors that taper at the edges.

title: Terrazas de Los Andes 2015 Reserva Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Gamy berry and plum aromas are matched if not outdone by heavy herbal scents. While this is round and full in feel, it tastes roasted and herbal, with minty berry flavors that suggest green. A gamy, herbal, peppery finish is par for this course.

title: Thirsty Owl Wine Company 2016 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Aromas of fuzzy apricot and steely lemon carry to the delicately framed palate. This is short on concentration but enjoyable with its crisp, dry finish.

title: Tournon by Michel Chapoutier 2013 Shays Flat Vineyard Shiraz (Pyrenees)
description: There's a bitter, chemical, oaky element to the nose of this wine that stands out above the dark fruit, chocolate and cola characters. The palate is equally arduous, with a good lick of acidity, sandy, savory tannins and sharp edges.

title: Via Romano 2014 Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This is a smooth and rounded red with friendly fruit flavors and hints of butter and vanilla. Medium bodied and not too concentrated, it's easy to sip.

title: Aljibes 2015 Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: A nose that's top-heavy with oak and menthol aromas includes hefty black-fruit scents and a touch of green. This is Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, and it's densely centered and heavy on the palate, with no elegance to speak of. Compact oaky flavors of blackberry and cola finish with grinding tannins and residual grit.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Apex 2016 Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Toast, custard and stone fruit aromas are at the fore. The palate is medium bodied, with abundant toasty flavors that dip in the middle before breaking up on the finish. The concentration doesn't seem all there.

title: Baron Albert NV L'Emancipée Rose de Saignée Brut  (Champagne)
description: A soft rosé, this has an attractive light color and red-fruit flavors. It is ripe, rounded in texture with just the right acidity to balance. Drink now.

title: Benmarl 2016 Semi Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: A squeeze of pink grapefruit melds with grass and brisk spice on the nose of this light-bodied semidry offering. The palate is more juicy in nature, with ripe apple and pear melding with of lime zest.

title: Bougrier 2017 Alain de la Treille Gamay-Grolleau  (Rosé d'Anjou)
description: This sweet rosé is clean and fruity with wild-strawberry flavors. The crisp edge of acidity is immediately attractive and refreshing. Drink now.

title: Bougrier 2017 Château du Jaunay Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: Located in Le Landreau, this vineyard has produced a crisp, citrus and green-plum-flavored wine. It is given extra richness by the aging on lees after fermentation, which brings out the ripe fruit of the vintage and adds extra depth of flavor. Drink this attractive wine now.

title: Bougrier 2017 Pure Loire  (Rosé de Loire)
description: Cabernet Franc, Gamay and Grolleau come together in this dry rosé. It is crisp with red-currant fruit and a light tangy, tannic edge. The wine is bright and refreshing, ready to drink.

title: Château Guipière 2016 CG Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: The entry-level wine from this estate offers soft and refreshing white fruits. It is an easy wine, fresh, perfumed and ready to drink.

title: Chopo 2016 Monastrell-Syrah (Jumilla)
description: Ripe berry and cassis aromas feature more than enough charred wood and licorice scents. A palate with raw tannins is tough to penetrate. Flavors of burnt oak, clove, chocolate and stewed berry fruits finish similarly but drier. This is 70% Monastrell and 30% Syrah.

title: Coleman 2015 Cherry Cove Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is stiffly tannic, and the thin cranberry fruit may not be up to the challenge of outdueling those tannins even with more bottle aging. Flavors are simple and crisp, but one-dimensional.

title: Conveyance 2015 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A bitter edge frames this medium-bodied wine. The blackberry fruit is subsumed in strong flavors of tar, baking chocolate and cola, with a lightly fishy aftertaste.

title: Estefania 2014 Tilenus Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Roasted, rubbery blueberry and mint aromas are herbal and lightly green. This feels clampy, with hard tannins. Highly herbal and gamy flavors of berry fruits are minty at the core, while this is soupy with sucking residual tannins on the finish.

title: Jacob's Creek 2016 Shiraz (Australia)
description: Plum, black pepper and vanilla oak spice run throughout this wine. The palate is plush in feel, with a fairly simple, obvious oak streak, but there's a focused, savory line of tannins and enough acidity to keep the fruit lifted.

title: Jessie's Grove 2017 Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Steel Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Wisps of lime and tangerine in the aroma lead to some riper richer flavors in this medium-bodied and soft-textured wine. It has light butter and vanilla accents and low acidity.

title: Leonard Kreusch 2017 Piesporter Michelsberg Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Straightforward yellow peach and grapefruit flavors are approachable and juicy in this off-dry Kabinett. It's not a complex wine but is spry and zesty with a fresh, clean finish. Drink now.

title: Maryhill 2017 Moscato di Canelli Gunkel Vineyards Moscato (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas pop, with notes of mandarin orange, fresh flower, musk, herb and ale. It drinks medium-plus sweet—a surefire crowd-pleaser.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2017 Fritz Willi Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: Delicate whiffs of crushed mineral, green apple and tangerine on the nose carry to the concentrated, off-dry palate. This is an uncomplicated wine, with pure flavors of juicy pineapple and grapefruit, marked by a touch of honeycomb and lemon zest on the finish. Enjoy now–2021.

title: Gremillet NV Sélection Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe and creamy wine offers fruitiness balanced by a full mousse and cut with acidity. Dominated by Pinot Noir, it displays the richness typical of the southern Aube vineyards. Drink this bottling now.

title: Hearst Ranch 2015 The Pergola Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: A shade lighter than most Petite Sirahs, this bottling offers dried strawberry, black plum and fresh flowers on the nose. The palate surrounds a core of black and red-plum fruits and is laced with peppery spices, proving light on its feet.

title: I Capitani 2014 Emè Red (Irpinia)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of dark-skinned fruit, vanilla and baking spice. The concentrated palate offers ripe black plum, star anise and tobacco alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2024.

title: Jean-Max Roger 2017 Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)
description: This wine needs aging. Its tight texture, although rich, is also taut and mineral. With herbal acidity and a tangy aftertaste, it shows excellent potential. Drink from 2019.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy in black tea and leather, this tastes of smoky oak and dried cherry and strawberry, its texture smooth and silky. Exotic in an edginess of citrus, it finishes with a grip of tannin.

title: Krone 2015 Twee Jonge Gezellen Borealis Vintage Cuvée Brut Méthode Cap Classique Sparkling (Western Cape)
description: Made from 60% Chardonnay and 40% Pinot Noir, there's a pleasant chalkiness to the nose of this wine, supported by scents of pressed yellow flowers, apple blossom, hay and dried orange peel. The palate is bright and vibrant, with great tension and high acidity that lends a superb freshness through the close and dances delicately with a bread crust counterpoint.
designation: Twee Jonge Gezellen Borealis Vintage Cuvée Brut Méthode Cap Classique

title: Losada 2016 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Spicy berry, oak, vanilla and schist aromas introduce a crisp palate with resiny oak. Dark plum and raspberry flavors are bolstered by oaky notes, while this tastes dark and chocolaty on a finish with fresh acidity and scratchy tannins.

title: Marqués de la Concordia 2014 Federico Paternina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Up-front aromas of cedary oak, vanilla and spice provide framing for riper berry scents. A full palate with piping acidity is cut by creamy oak, while this tastes of red plum, currant, tobacco, savory spices and vanilla. Although a bit ripe and soupy in structure, this is a classic-style Rioja to drink now.

title: Max Ferd. Richter 2016 Richter Estate Riesling (Mosel)
description: This is a juicy, off-dry wine showcasing a bounty of ripe white-grapefruit and pineapple flavors. It's easy-drinking and quaffable, with a refreshing tonic finish. Enjoy now–2020.

title: Newton 2015 Unfiltered Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This sources from multiple appellations, combining grapes into a cohesive unit of deep richness and dusty mineral. The richness takes form in flavours of chocolate-covered-cherries and currants, with accents of graphite and dried herb.

title: Perinet 2015 1194 Red (Priorat)
description: From the opening gun, this is overtly and massively ripe, hence it smells of maple, raisin and prune along with crème de cassis liqueur. A heavyweight from front to back, this tastes of brandied black fruits, chocolate cake, clove and other baking spices. An unctuous finish is the opposite of light and dainty.

title: Scarpa 2012 Tettimora  (Barolo)
description: Underbrush, pressed rose, truffle and leather are some of the aromas you'll find on this medium-bodied red. The already rather approachable palate offers dried cherry, clove and roasted coffee bean alongside fine-grained but rather drying tannins. Drink after 2020.

title: Schlumberger Wein- und Sektkellerei 2016 Jahrgang Brut Klassik Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Apart from the fine spray of fizz, this nose might pass as that of fresh fruit juice, so vivid are the notes of Mirabelle plum and yellow apple. The palate is more vinous, with a smooth backdrop of yeast and generous dosage. This is easy, dry and fruit driven, but very fresh.

title: Sierra Cantabria 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Aromas of barrel spice, baking spice and earthy plum form an inviting nose. This is chewy and full on the palate, with good balance. Roasted berry, spiced plum, baking spice and clove flavors close up shop on an edgy finish, with popping acidity and residual roasted notes.

title: Steininger 2016 Grüner Veltliner (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: A shy nose gives off just a little carbon dioxide from the fizz. The substantial palate, however, shows lots of yeasty roundness. This is mild but full bodied and leaves a long impression of lees and grapy freshness. Just a little pepper tingles on the finish of this Grüner Veltliner-based Sekt.

title: Stolo 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Polished aromas of raspberry sorbet meet with sumac, cinnamon and a very strong pine-oil element on the nose of this bottling. Red-cherry fruit shows on the sip alongside woody flavors of juniper and forest floor.

title: Travaglini 2014  Gattinara
description: Aromas of coconut, dark-skinned berry and exotic spice come together on this. The taut linear palate offers dried cherry, star anise, sage and a hint of espresso alongside brisk acidity and tight close-grained tannins that grip the close.

title: Vall Llach 2015 Idus Red (Priorat)
description: Berry scented candle and baking-spice aromas comprise an exotic nose. On the palate, this is as soft as a goose-feather mattress, with very little notable acidity or lift. Deeply ripe and baked black-fruit flavors taste of cassis and blueberry on a thick finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Vokel 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick and intensely ripe, this appellation red is hearty and substantial on the palate, a richly interwoven mix of dried herb, strawberry and cola.

title: Cana's Feast 2014 Destiny Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Jammy raspberry and other red fruit aromas are followed by full-bodied, supple red and blue fruit flavors that linger on the finish. The tannins give a gentle squeeze.

title: Cavatappi 2014 Molly's Cuvée Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of fruit from esteemed Boushey, Red Willow and Alder Ridge vineyards. Aromas of sour cherry, herb and spice are followed by tart, bright fruit flavors backed by a firm lick of tannins.

title: Château de la Viaudière NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: This attractive wine offers spicy fruit as well as crisp acidity. Its three years on the lees and the ripe, creamy Chardonnay contribute to the smoothness. A cut of acidity at the end gives welcome lift. Drink now.

title: Château Moncontour NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: Aged for at least 12 months on its lees, this red-fruit-flavored wine is attractive and crisp. It has a lightly tannic edge as well as plenty of acidity and freshness. It is ready to drink.

title: Coelho 2016 Coelho Estates Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Done in a lighter style that might compare to some dry Portuguese reds, this offers tart cranberry fruit with ample, stiff tannins. A small percentage of new oak adds a hint of spice, and the tannins are backed with herbal highlights.

title: Cruzat NV Brut Método Tradicional  (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Aromas of brioche and white fruit struggle with freshness but succeed as a whole. A straightforward palate is solid, while this brut tastes of ripe apple and pear. A mild finish displays moderate depth and a hint of complexity.

title: Domaine Vincent Carême NV Tania & Vincent Carême Cuvée T Brut  (Vouvray)
description: As crisp as possible with delicious apple flavors and a bubbly mousse, this wine is dry while also having a light honey character. It is perfumed, fruity and ready to drink.
designation: Tania & Vincent Carême Cuvée T Brut

title: Donnachiara 2015  Taurasi
description: This inky colored wine has subdued aromas evoking blackberry jam, ground pepper, eucalyptus and a whiff of woodshop. The dense, monolithic palate offers dried black cherry, bitter prune, star anise, oak and roasted coffee bean alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent, drying finish. You'll also get a green note of powdered sage. Give the tannins another few years to soften, then drink to capture the remaining fruit and freshness.

title: Fournier Père et Fils 2017 Les Belles Vignes Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This is a light, poised and deliciously fruity wine. With crisp red-berry flavors and a citrus edge, it is refreshing and bright, ready to drink now.

title: Fowles Wine NV Ginger Prince Sparkling Rosé (Victoria)
description: Nearly incandescent, the bright red-berry color of this bubbly is hard not to like. The nose is as ripe as you'd expect from the hue, with plush watermelon and strawberry aromas. The palate offers a touch of sweetness, with juicy fruit flavors supported by a full body.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2017 Fritz Willi Trocken Riesling (Mosel)
description: Hints of fresh green herb, slate and yellow apple perfume the nose of this zippy, dry wine. The palate offers pristine flavors of green plum and white grapefruit, with a slightly tart, cutting feel. This is a refreshingly light-bodied wine to enjoy now–2022.

title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2016 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)
description: This is a textural Pinot Gris, soft and pillowy on the palate, with plump flavors of yellow apple and tangerine. A mild bitter almond-skin note creeps on the midpalate, adding a bit of balance and astringency.

title: Hyland 2017 Single Vineyard Rosé (McMinnville)
description: This rosé is really a generic white wine blend colored with a splash of Pinot Noir. The blend is 47% Chardonnay, 35% Riesling and 16% Gewürztraminer, with just 2% of the red wine giving it a bit of a blush hue. It's floral, fruity and tart and tastes perfectly fine.

title: Jean Reverdy et Fils 2017 La Reine Blanche  (Sancerre)
description: A soft wine with quince and ripe red-apple flavors, this is open and packed with fruit. The acidity is there, adding freshness and finishing this rounded wine with a crisp lift. Drink now.

title: Joseph Mellot 2017 Le Troncsec  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This open, ripe wine conveys a warm, rich character. Tropical fruits dominate, with just a touch of spice and minerality, plus acidity in the background. The wine is young, but is ready to drink although it will be even better from 2019.

title: La Guardiense 2015 Janare Lucchero Aglianico (Sannio)
description: Tobacco, toasted oak and cured meat aromas lead the nose. The dense palate offers dried blackberry, oak-driven spice and a hint of powdered sage alongside grainy tannins that leave an astringent finish.

title: Lamoreaux Landing 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: A pleasing mix of ripe melon, potpourri and white pepper carries this wine from start to finish. It's all about its silken, soft texture on the palate, with welcome astringency and juicy acidity keeping the balance.

title: Lanson NV White Label Dry Sec  (Champagne)
description: Dry Sec in Champagne-speak means not quite dry. This wine with its creamed-apple flavor is just that. However, the texture isn't really soft because the wine also has the good acidity associated with this producer's other Champagnes. Drink this wine now, probably as an aperitif.

title: Marcelo Mira 2014 Pinot Noir (Patagonia)
description: Baked, rooty aromas of dried cherry and currant are mostly convincing. This feels rubbing and abrasive, while flavors of root beer and mocha are oaky and on top of shy fruit. Coffee and cappuccino flavors dominate a ripe finish.

title: Marquis de Goulaine 2017 Le Puy Ferrand Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: Bright fruit shines through this crisp wine. Citrus flavors have a touch of pepper as well as lively acidity. Tangy and zesty, poised and light, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Quinta do Sagrado 2012 Late Bottled Vintage  (Port)
description: Traditional foot treading in lagars gives this wine its opulent character and generous black fruits. Tannins and berry flavors are enveloped by rich dried fruits, a touch of toffee and the potential of a smooth texture as wine ages further. Drink now, although the wine will be better from 2021.

title: Rivetti Massimo 2015 Froi  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of red berry, mint and tobacco emerge from the glass. The savory, balanced palate offers red cherry, star anise and white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2029.

title: Stolpman 2017 Para Maria de los Tecolotes Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: The nose on this extremely well-priced bottling, named after vineyard manager Ruben Solorzano's wife, is intense yet elegant, with crushed slate, black currant and charred pork aromas. The palate's chalky texture carries flavors of black plum, boysenberry, dark cocoa, fennel and marjoram.

title: Toil Oregon 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Chris Figgins' Oregon project hits the half decade mark with this lovely, stylish young wine. A plummy purple hue, it's lightly scented with toast, sandalwood and cedar. Silky smooth in the mouth, it's a bowl of ripe blueberries, done in an elegant style. There's the slightest suggestion of menthol as well. It's beautifully crafted and should be enjoyed over the next five to eight years.

title: Trisaetum 2016 Willamette Valley Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Fashioned entirely from estate-grown grapes, this muscular and substantial wine melds together black cherry, black olive and sweet spices. It's firm and polished, with almost silky tannins, and punches well above its price. Drink this now through the next decade.

title: Trivento 2015 Eolo Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Blocky, jammy berry aromas are forward and include lactic oak. This is a big boy with commendable structure. Blackberry, cassis, tobacco and vanilla flavors finish bold and spicy, with latent tobacco and barrel notes. Drink this classic full-bodied Malbec through 2023.

title: V. Testulat 2011 Cuvée Paul-Vincent Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Fruit from selected vineyards went into this ripe wine. Smoothly textured, it has hints of minerality but much more of ripe white fruits with touches of toastiness. It could do with some more time, so drink from 2020.

title: Westbrook Wine Farm 2012 Fait Accompli Red (Madera)
description: Here is a great discovery from often overlooked Madera County. There's a lot going on in this dark-colored, very aromatic and full-flavored wine that has matured for quite a while in the bottle already. Earthy, meaty, leathery aromas vie for attention while very potent fruit, dark-spice and beef jus flavors virtually flood the palate and cling to the sides of the mouth.

title: Shannon Ridge 2016 High Elevation Collection Petite Sirah (Lake County)
description: Smooth but dense, this wine is unusually supple for the variety. It shows a great combination of ripe, rich fruit flavors of black fig, black pepper, wood smoke and blackberry, with firm but not harsh tannins that give it a plush, mouthcoating texture. Best through 2025.

title: Yering Station 2016 Little Yering Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: Complex and earthy, this wine knits flavors of hot stone, tobacco, Morello cherry, and green peppercorn onto a palate of ultrafine, leathery tannins and beautifully poised acidity. This is an elegant and multifaceted wine.

title: Abacela 2015 Fiesta Tempranillo (Umpqua Valley)
description: Fiesta is the entry-level cuvée among four different Abacela Tempranillos. To say this wine overdelivers is to understate its impact. The estate-grown fruit sends up gamy scents that conjure dreams of blood sausage and lead down a deep, dark entryway into a core of blue plum, black cherry and cassis fruits. Some barrel time adds licorice and clove, with tannic muscle invigorating the finish.

title: Colombera & Garella 2014 Cascina Cottignano  (Bramaterra)
description: Aromas of graphite, dark spice, rose and wild berry lift out of the glass, along with a whiff of chopped mint. The racy, elegantly structured palate offers juicy Marasca cherry, white pepper and star anise set against polished tannins. Firm acidity gives it a nervous tension. Drink 2022–2034.

title: Enrico Serafino 2012 Zero Brut Nature Riserva Sparkling (Alta Langa)
description: This lovely elegant sparkler opens with heady scents of chamomile, dried wild flower, ripe pear and toasted bread crust. The structured palate delivers Golden Delicious apple, nectarine, citrus and mineral alongside fresh acidity and a silky perlage. It has a lingering bone-dry finish.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2015 Hope Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This blend of 55% Grenache, 27% Syrah, 15% Mourvèdre, 2% Petite Sirah and 1% Carignan is a strong showing for this historic—but only recently revived—region between Morgan Hill and Gilroy. Blackberry, lavender, elderflower buds and soil show on the nose. The structure is quite firm, holding elegant flavors of dark berry, white pepper and strong acidity.

title: Balletto 2016 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smooth and integrated, this is an earthy and spicy wine that offers balanced flavors of strawberry jam, citrus and a dash of white pepper. These tones linger as the wine's seamless, viscous texture takes hold.
designation: Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Barons de Rothschild NV Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This ripe, red-fruit-flavored wine is smooth and juicy. Its fruitiness is balanced by the filigree of acidity and minerality to give a rich wine that is also elegant. Drink this bottling now.

title: Bava 2014 Scarrone  (Barolo)
description: Rose petal, iris, forest-floor and wild-berry aromas take shape in the glass. On the tense, vibrant palate, taut, polished tannins and racy acidity provide the backdrop for wild strawberry, red cherry, star anise and chopped mint. Drink 2020–2026.

title: Challen 2015 Scarlett Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fairly dark in the glass, this is an intense and jammy take on Pinot Noir, offering aromas of boysenberry and blackberry on the nose. It's brawny and masculine on the sip, with a full and creamy mouthfeel with just enough tang, and would work well in a steak house.

title: Domaine Eden 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Intense aromas of pine, cedar and incense meet with roasted black plum, deep violet and a hint of lavender on the layered nose of this bottling, which includes 16% Merlot, 4% Petit Verdot, 2% Cabernet Franc and 1% Malbec. The woody flavors show on the palate alongside red plums and white pepper, all encased in a chalky texture.

title: Domaine Masson-Blondelet 2017 Les Angelots  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Based in Pouilly-sur-Loire, this producer has crafted a full, rich wine. With its touch of toastiness and a smoky edge, the wine is full of ripe citrus fruit that is cut with zesty acidity. Drink from 2019.

title: Gainey 2017 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Clean, crisp and reminiscent of springtime on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of lime blossom, wet cement, scratched pomelo skin and cut grass. The palate is extremely energetic and makes the mouth tingle while delivering flavors of lemongrass and lime.

title: Global Wines 2014 Cabriz Reserva Red (Dão)
description: This dark colored wine has richly perfumed aromas, and that leads to a densely textured wine. The wine shows layers of wood aging, spice and concentrated black fruits. This wine, top of the Cabriz range, is just now ready for drinking.

title: Global Wines 2015 Herdade Monte da Cal Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: Located in the northern Alentejo, this estate is a local landmark. The wine is rich and concentrated while having a fine balance between the black fruits and firm tannins. It is still in the bold fruit phase and should soften a little before it is ready to drink. Wait until 2019.

title: Jacquart 2013 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: A blend of Grand Cru fruit, this well-structured wine is rich while also tense, mineral and with further aging potential. Citrus acidity is allied to crisp apples to produce the fruity side of this well balanced wine. It will be better from 2020.

title: Jurtschitsch NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Subtle strawberry and lemon on the nose becomes much more pronounced on the palate. The foam is fine, and there is a taut line of freshness on a slender, linear body. This veers into the austere but also proclaims its pure, lasting freshness. Very classy, grown-up fizz.

title: Kessler-Haak 2015 Ohana Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A tad lighter in style than the winery's richer bottlings, this fresh wine shows pomegranate, dried roses and a hint of game on the nose. Freshly squeezed black-raspberry and sour cherry flavors ride a sharp acidity into the finish.

title: Leeuwin Estate 2016 Siblings Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
description: This blend is a fruit bowl of flavors ranging from lemons and limes to green apples, with white pepper, green bell pepper, blossoms, warm stones and wet wool. The palate teeters on the full-bodied side—slippery and oily—with a long finish of citrus and spice tones.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Private Reserve Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)
description: Roasted black currants, charred meats, purple flowers, milk chocolate and a hint of teriyaki show on the nose of this layered and complex bottling from vintner Don Lorenzi. There is a strong structure to the palate, where anise and wild herbs show against a core of black plum pudding.

title: Louis Nouvelot 2010 Topaze Millésime  (Champagne)
description: With its high proportion of Chardonnay, this wine has both richness and a tight texture. It is just approaching maturity, but the bright white fruits and citrus are still present, bringing out the acidity. Let it age further and drink from 2020.

title: Maurodos 2015 Prima  (Toro)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas blend with notes of sandalwood, turned earth and graham cracker to form a complex and inviting nose. A dry tight tannic palate is proper and drumming, while this Toro tastes of blackberry and wood spice prior to a focused but dry and tannic finish. Drink through 2024.

title: Meiomi 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Earthy and reserved at first on the nose, this new reserve bottling from the popular label offers rhubarb pie, turned earth and purple flower potpourri on the nose. Ripe fruit flavors of cranberry and raspberry show on the palate, as do turned earth and crushed slate flavors—a more elegant step up from the original bottling.

title: Michel Vattan 2017 Cuvée Argile  (Sancerre)
description: The heavier, clay soil that is found in parts of Sancerre is the origin of this rich wine. It is one of a pair of wines (the other highlighting chalk soil) and shows how terroir-driven Sancerre's Sauvignon Blanc wines can be. Ripe white fruits are cut with acidity, still youthful and needing to soften. Drink from 2019.

title: Michel Vattan 2017 Cuvée Calcaire  (Sancerre)
description: As its name indicates, this wine comes from chalk soil. Crisp minerality is the order of the day, with intense acidity, layers of citrus and a zesty, bright texture. There is a herbal element that will soften. Drink from 2019.

title: Muga 2014 Torre Muga  (Rioja)
description: Savory berry aromas include a lot of oak and graphite along with exotic hints. Hailing from a vintage marked by a rainy harvest, this isn't bright or fruity at any check point. Blackberry, cassis and licorice flavors are short on a blocky finish tasting of mint, cardamom and oak. Drink through 2024.

title: Panther Creek 2016 De Ponte Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This chewy, flavorful wine features well-ripened black cherry fruit and a dark streak of chocolate. Barrel aging (half new) adds toasted nuts to the mix, and the finish is focused and lingers gracefully, balanced with clean acids.

title: Panther Creek 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: A blend of one-third Schindler and two-thirds Lazy River fruit, this reserve was aged for 17 months in two-thirds new French oak. Unsurprisingly, it's a toasty wine, with fruit solidly in the black cherry camp, and streaks of smoke, tar and chocolate.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Le Chêne Marchand  (Sancerre)
description: From one of the top vineyards in Bué, this wine has pure, rounded and rich apple and green-plum flavors. It is a powerful concentrated wine from a vineyard that produces ripe fruit. Drink from 2019.

title: Pascal Jolivet 2017 Les Caillottes  (Sancerre)
description: A warm wine rich in white fruits and with open acidity, this instantly attractive wine will also age. Like all wines from this producer, it is made with natural yeasts, while the old vines add natural concentration. Drink from 2019.

title: Purple Hands 2016 Holstein Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Clean, brambly fruit emphasizes red fruit flavors, with highlights of coffee and chocolate. It's a textural wine, medium bodied and perfect for drinking now and over the next half decade.

title: Ramey 2014 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the cooler edge of the Petaluma Gap, this is coharvested and cofermented with 10% Viognier, which gives it a lift on the midpalate. Smoky char, baked raspberry, leather and pepper highlight a complex, thickly concentrated experience of powerful grace and silky texture.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: From an historic site in the middle of Sonoma Valley, this wine is creamy and viscous with a thicket of vanilla and cherry cordial opening up on the palate. Thick and oaky, it lingers in black pepper and an exotic mineral element that's part crushed rock, part dried herb. This is a beautiful and beguiling example of the variety.

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Red (Beira Interior)
description: One of a pair of new releases, this bottling highlights the two wine regions in which the producer operates. This wine comes from vineyards at 2,000-feet in elevation. The rocky, poor soils have concentrated the flavors giving an impressive, obviously powerful wine. Black fruits and dense tannins both show that the wine needs to age further. Drink from 2022

title: Rui Roboredo Madeira 2015 Red (Douro)
description: This is one of a pair of new releases that carry the producer's name and are designed to highlight the two regions in which he operates. It comes from old vines grown in schist soil. With all the structure and concentration, it also has ripe, generous fruit that shines through with a great fanfare of blackberry and black-plum flavors. Drink this wine from 2022.

title: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2016 Les Filles  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Serge Dagueneau works with his three daughters at this family property, celebrating their heritage in this wine. Made from late-harvest grapes with some noble rot, it is extra rich while remaining completely dry. Flavors of yellow fruits and peppered apples show strongly against the powerful acidity and final touch of honey. Drink this delicious wine from 2019.

title: Teso La Monja 2015 Victorino  (Toro)
description: This is textbook Teso la Monja, with a deep, lusty nose that is packed with a ripe but balanced black-fruit flavor and copious new oak. Hard, pounding tannins are edgy but not jagged, while this tastes of toasty blackberry, cassis and blueberry pie. A warm finish suggests molten chocolate cake. Best from 2020–2026.

title: Valserrano 2014 Finca Monteviejo  (Rioja)
description: Intense aromas of graphite, vanilla and creamy berry fruits are a fine opening to this off-vintage winner, proof that great wines can come from weak vintages. The deep palate is blazing with integrated acidity. Campfire smoke is infused into blackberry and cassis flavors, while this is long, elegant and echoes ripe berry and chocolaty oak on the finish. Drink through 2040.

title: Villa Guelpa 2015  Lessona
description: Alluring scents of dried rose, forest floor, crushed herb, woodland berry and dark spice come together on this fragrant red. The elegantly structured, focused palate delivers red cherry, crushed strawberry and star anise while a savory, almost salty mineral note lingers on the close. It's balanced, and still young, with youthfully taut, polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2022–2035.

title: Pascal & Alain Lorieux 2015 Alain Lorieux Thélème  (Chinon)
description: This is a rich, seriously structured wine that is just approaching drinkability. Rich, concentrated black fruits are framed by a firm, tannic structure. Pepper, spice and a decadent aftertaste are enmeshed in the powerful tannins. It's hard to resist now, but it should mature well; drink from 2020.

title: Besserat de Bellefon 2013 Triple B by Besserat Brut Nature  (Champagne)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes, this is an impressively rich wine. Its generousity derives from the ripe grapes and the intense fruitiness that balances the total dryness of the wine. Drink from 2020.
designation: Triple B by Besserat Brut Nature

title: Cayuse 2015 Armada Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: This is the only one of Cayuse's single-vineyard Syrahs to be produced this vintage due to a bottle closure issue. The aromas are locked up on first pour, with notes of fire pit, green olive, smoked ham, blackberry underbrush, mineral and smoked meat. The palate is flavorful, full of smoke and meat notes that linger on the extended finish.

title: Cristom 2016 Eileen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: The darkest, most muscular of the winery's 2016 Pinots, this is loaded with ripe black cherry fruit, wreathed in a whiff of smoke. There's a streak of cola and some lightly dusty tannins, and the length and texture argue for cellaring. Drink now–2030 and beyond.

title: Domaine Serene 2016 Clos du Soleil Vineyard Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: This cuvée stands out for its precise, almost sculptural framework. Poached pear, nectarine and apricot flavors combine with a touch of toasted coconut. A highlight of juicy acidity makes this feel ripe, polished and perfectly in tune with all the gorgeous fruit. Drink now–2028.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Ten Oaks Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned contours of red cherry and pomegranate make for a tart profile, edged by tightly wound acidity and underlying freshness. This is an exotic wine that could stand more time in the bottle to truly reveal itself. Enjoy from 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Ten Oaks Single Vineyard

title: G. H. Mumm 2008 RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Noirs Brut Grand Cru Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: Composed of Pinot Noir from Verzenay, this wine is beautifully balanced. Rich while elegant, it has ripe apple fruits that are cut by lime and filled out with hints of mature toastiness. It deserves to be aged even further. Drink from 2020.
designation: RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Noirs Brut Grand Cru

title: G. H. Mumm 2012 RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Blancs Brut Grand Cru  (Champagne)
description: This wine, from a range of Champagnes that highlights grand cru villages, is still very young, with taut acidity and considerable minerality. From Cramant on the Côte des Blancs, it is developing into a fine wine and has richness, great fruit and a taut texture. Let the wine soften and drink from 2021.
designation: RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Blancs Brut Grand Cru

title: Jonathan Didier Pabiot 2016 Eurythmie  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Almost tropical in its fruitiness, this wine, with one year in bottle, is generous, rich and open. Yes, it still shows a hint of minerality and herbal tanginess. But it is now a full wine packed with citrus and apricot flavors. Drink now.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from the producer's own Green Acres and Home Ranch vineyards, this is heady and inviting in decadent, lengthy waves of caramel apple and Meyer lemon meringue. Full bodied and densely ripe, it has oaky cinnamon spice and a twist of vanilla, finishing with impressive minerality.

title: Schloss Lieser 2016 Thomas Haag Niederberg Helden Auslese Riesling (Mosel)
description: Layers and layers of pristine sweet honeydew, watermelon and white peach collide in this light-footed sweet Riesling. It's spine-tingling and feather light yet unctuous and rolling in texture. An intensely fragrant, fruity wine now that should intensify in complexity well through 2035.

title: Shea 2016 Shea Vineyard Homer Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This reserve wine offers tones of ripe raspberry and cherry fruit, with well-defined acidity that keeps it lively and fresh. Aged in 60% new French oak, it offers notes of baking spices and toasted coconut.

title: Smith Woodhouse 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Full and rich, the wine has dark tannins and dense blackberry flavors. It is generous wine—juicy, perfumed and layered with impressive tannins. This is a wine with a long-term future, drink from 2028.

title: Vokel 2016 SHV Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick, concentrated and strongly built with tannins, this wine is made in a big full-bodied style. It has a generous helping of blue fruit that is lightly spiced in nutmeg and cola.

title: Zuccardi 2017 Q Chardonnay (Tupungato)
description: A tan-leaning color and a nose defined by toasty oak on top of pear and apple aromas make for a good opening. This Tupungato Chardonnay is plump, viscous and well balanced, with a mix of oaky spice and melony flavors. A steady finish confirms that this is of high quality.

title: Ca'Romè 2013 Maria di Brun Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Sawdust, oak-driven spice, dark-fruit and tobacco aromas slowly emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers espresso, licorice and cherry steeped in spirits alongside tightly packed tannins. Drink 2021–2026.

title: Giacosa Fratelli 2015 Basarin Vigna Gianmatè  (Barbaresco)
description: Subtle aromas of baking spice, dark berry and tilled earth lead the nose. The forward palate offers raspberry jam, licorice and green peppercorn alongside chewy tannins. Drink 2019–2025.

title: Planeta 2017 La Segreta Bianco White (Sicilia)
description: Aromas of white stone fruit, citrus and pistachio take center stage on this fresh white. The fruity aromas carry over to the savory, light-bodied palate along with yellow peach.

title: Achille Viglione 2013 Jacco Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Subtle aromas of leather, dark berry and underbrush lead the nose. The juicy palate offers black cherry, star anise and clove alongside firm tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Acrobat 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This is a star effort given the volume and price point. A toasty frame sets up tart fruit flavors of raspberry hard candy. It's got more grip and focus than most of the inexpensive Oregon Pinots.

title: Agricola Bellaria 2012  Taurasi
description: Aromas suggesting oak, vanilla, baked plum and a whiff of burned rubber all take shape in the glass. On the assertive palate, grainy tannins offset fleshy black cherry, cake spice, espresso and vanilla before an astringent, drying finish. Give the tannins several more years to unclench. Drink after 2024.

title: Angove 2017 Chardonnay (McLaren Vale)
description: This wine offers melon, lemon and fig tones that are bright and ripe without being jammy. A toasted coconut-oak note serves to support rather than overpower, and the lees work adds just enough texture and complexity to compliment a tight, grainy texture. Drink now–2025.

title: Argyle 2016 Nuthouse Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Here is a fruity mix of light red berries, accented with lemon and pineapple acidity. Forward and fresh, it carries a light thread of graphite into the finish.

title: Barros 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: There are many layers of ripe fruit in this relatively soft wine. It has sweetness, berry fruits and integrated tannins. Already attractive, the wine is obviously going to develop quickly. Drink from 2026.

title: Batasiolo 2015  Barbaresco
description: Red berry, cooking spice and leather aromas emerge from the glass. The solid palate offers crushed raspberry, blood orange and clove alongside austere, youthful tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Battaglio 2015 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of cedar, dark berry and eucalyptus shape the nose. The solid full-bodied palate offers dried black cherry, clove and white pepper alongside firm tannins. Drink 2020–2028.

title: Benanti 2015 Pietra Marina Bianco  (Etna)
description: Delicate aromas of acacia, white stone fruit and hazelnut lift out of the glass. On the lean but elegant palate, you'll find dried yellow apple slice, citrus, honeyed nut and a mineral note alongside fresh acidity. Drink soon to capture the remaining fruit.

title: Bodegas Muriel 2013 Fincas da la Villa Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Earthy plum and cherry aromas offer a touch of wet clay to keep things grounded. This Reserva is medium in body, with good acidity and balance. Earthy berry flavors shows hints of oak and raisin, while plum and prune notes carry over to a finish with dry edgy tannins. Drink this proper Rioja through 2023.

title: Bodegas Riojanas 2014 Viña Albina Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Aromatically speaking, this is gritty and rough. In the mouth, this Reserva from a shaky vintage is soupy but not out of shape. Sappy plum, prune and tomato flavors are classic for Rioja but finish without much punch, so best to drink this soon.

title: Bougrier 2017 Cuvée V Vieilles Vignes Grande Réserve  (Vouvray)
description: This ripe, medium-sweet wine is crisp as well as full of honey accents. Almonds, spice and delicious baked-apple flavors are well integrated into this stylish wine. Drink now or, better, from 2020.
designation: Cuvée V Vieilles Vignes Grande Réserve

title: Bougrier 2017 Domaine des Brangers  (Menetou-Salon)
description: This small appellation west of Sancerre produces a style of wine that is softer and cooler than its big-name neighbor. That makes for a wine, like this, that is charming and smooth when young, with its attractive citrus character rounded out. Drink now.

title: Canard-Duchêne NV Charles VII Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: A textured wine, properly mineral and with a taut structure, this is crisp while also having a riper background. The dosage is sufficient to give it a soft edge to contrast with the more mineral texture. Drink this wine now.
designation: Charles VII Blanc de Blancs Brut

title: Chanoine NV Tsarine Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: This sophisticated, crisp wine has a dry character that brings out fresh red fruits. Tangy with a mineral edge and tight acidity, it is ready to drink.

title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Nummer 1 Rosenmuskateller (Burgenland)
description: A pinkish hue of amber signals an unusual wine. The perfumed nose of rose petal and Turkish delight marks this out for utter seduction, while heady spice and lifted honeysuckle only increase the sensuousness. Both sweetness and spice give even more of themselves on the palate, where a wonderfully crunchy phenolic backbone provides structure alongside the wonderfully sharp acidity. This is a full-on pleasure bomb of floral and fruity intensity, whose aromatic, rose-scented echoes are beyond memorable. A wine to meditate over. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Kracher 2015 Zwischen den Seen Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 2 Welschriesling (Burgenland)
description: An earthy glint precedes the lemony caramel notes that dominate the nose. Honey-drizzled apricots reveal themselves with a second sniff and come on full tilt on the luscious palate. A lovely lemon sharpness along with a delicious streak of bitterness counters the sweetness. Wave upon wave of apricot flavor settles on the tongue, pulsating like an epicenter of pleasure. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Sattlerhof 2013 Trockenbeerenauslese Morillon (Südsteiermark)
description: A hint of sublimely ripe apricot on the nose draws you in. The aromatic allure continues on the palate, where a gently bitter edge, as of dark fir honey, streaks the gentle notes of fresh and baked apricot. There is a rounded, luscious, almost emollient fluidity that makes this glide across the pleasure centers of your brain, always following with lip-smacking freshness. This leaves sinuous trails across the tongue and brain. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Taylor Fladgate 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Ripe, structured while also fruity, this intense, perfumed Port is opulent while also elegant. Its tannins and great fruit are finely integrated and are rich with potential. Black fruits, berries and a juicy aftertaste add freshness to the wine. Drink from 2028.

title: Paolo Scavino 2011 Novantesimo Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Pressed rose, iris, new leather, exotic spice, menthol and a whiff of wild berry come to the forefront on this gorgeous wine. The full-bodied polished palate has a weightless elegance, delivering raspberry compote, crushed cherry, licorice, aromatic herb and a floral note alongside taut velvety tannins. It's already beautiful but hold for even more complexity. Drink 2021–2031.

title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Grand Selection Chardonnay (Burgenland)
description: A touch of creaminess on the nose leads to a mellow palate full of honeyed baked apple fruit. There is a hint of vanilla and a bright, almost piercing gleam of wonderful lemon sharpness, putting the creamy decadence of the palate into even more focus. This has ultimate concentration and finishes with such zesty vigor. This is built to last. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Wine & Soul 2016 Pintas Vintage  (Port)
description: This finely balanced wine is rich with tannins as well as powerful black fruits. Its mineral texture and perfumes add complexity to the ripeness of the wine. This is a wine for long-term aging, concentrated and dense with great fruits. Drink from 2029.

title: Gunter Triebaumer 2015 Ruster Ausbruch Welschriesling (Burgenland)
description: Citrus richness sprays from the glass: Sunny, ripe lemon and zesty tangerine are edged with the earthy tang of botrytis and honey. Luscious sweetness and concentrated acidity appear at full tilt on the tangy palate, but it is the lemon that lasts on the finish, leaving this incredible richness and a fresh aftertaste. Drink until 2035.

title: Fonseca 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: This bottling brings together a fine structure with great fruit to give a luscious wine that is also destined for long-term aging. With its ripe berry flavors sustained by some acidity, this is already balanced. Drink from 2028

title: Rozes 2016 Quinta do Pégo Vintage  (Port)
description: The wine has great swathes of black fruit at the same time as powerful tannins. That makes for a rich balanced wine, destined for long-term aging. There is a floral element that will soften and broaden out to give a satisfyingly ripe, never too sweet, wine. Drink from 2028.

title: Dow's 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: Very floral, intense and ripe, this is a wine that is based around big black fruits as well as fine acidity. It is obviously destined for long aging with its powerful dry tannins and perfumed acidity. Drink this wine from 2028.

title: Hager Matthias 2015 Trockenbeerenauslese Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: The nose of this wine offers heady touches of peony, vanilla, plum and oak leaf. The concentrated palate brings plum, pepper and a slight phenolic edge that helps the acidity corral all of the luscious flavors into a rounded dollop of deliciousness. Drink until 2040.

title: Louis Roederer 1995 Cristal Vinothèque Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This magnificent wine celebrates the enormous aging potential of a great Champagne. It is still full of bright red fruits and tense minerality, with only a hint of maturity. While nearing its peak for enjoyment, let it breathe before drinking.

title: Türk 2016 Eiswein Grüner Veltliner (Niederösterreich)
description: The purest scent of ripe apricot on the nose unfolds in even more spectacular fashion on the luscious palate. The flavors are carried by the immense, concentrated sweetness but are outlined and put into sharp focus by the crystalline acidity. This is sublimely pure and intense.

title: Horsepower 2015 Sur Echalas Vineyard Grenache (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The aromas are haunting, with notes of white and black pepper, peat, potpourri, green olive, orange blossom, grilled asparagus and smoked meat. The palate shows incredible texture and detail, but the story here is truly the finish—a full minute-plus investment worth every thrilling moment. It's hard to tell exactly when it stops. A complete mind- and palate-bending stunner—one of the defining wines of the vintage. Best from 2020–2030.

title: Lanson 2007 Clos Lanson Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: Produced from a small walled vineyard close to the Lanson winery in Reims, this is a splendid wine. Its richness is balanced by the intense freshness and minerality of the Chardonnay, with apple and citrus flavors that still in the background. Now mature, this wine is ready to drink.

title: Figli Luigi Oddero 2012 Vigna Rionda Riserva  (Barolo)
description: This stunning Barolo from one of the most famed vineyards in the denomination opens with aromas of wild berry, new leather, pipe tobacco and a balsamic note of menthol. Succulent, full-bodied and smooth, the structured palate seamlessly combines elegance and power, delivering juicy morello cherry, raspberry compote, licorice and chopped mint. Firm polished tannins provide the impressive framework. Drink 2020–2032.

title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Grande Cuvée Nummer 6 White (Burgenland)
description: Candied pineapple and candied lemon zest on the nose coalesce on the palate around a wonderfully tart core of purest passion fruit. This is rich and tense, taut but sweet, aromatic and heady. Each drop sends sweet ripples of aroma across the palate, while lovely citrus pulls the focus. The finish has a lovely herbaceous edge of bergamot and citrus foliage. Lovely tension. Drink until 2035.
designation: Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Grande Cuvée Nummer 6

title: Kracher 2015 Nouvelle Vague Trockenbeerenauslese Nummer 3 Zweigelt (Burgenland)
description: Szechuan pepper, cold smoke and autumn leaves on the nose lead onto a lusciously sweet palate of baked plum. This is viscous and fluid, rich and brooding, with echoes of molasses and maple syrup but something hauntingly peppery and hotly shimmering in the background. Pepper and plum dominate the finish of this most unusual Zweigelt TBA. Drink until 2040, at least.

title: Kracher 2015 Nummer 12 White (Burgenland)
description: Barley sugar, dark fir honey and caramel aromas gush from the glass and across the tongue. Their mellow sweetness gives glimpses of tarte tatin, white pepper and melted butter on a very concentrated, unbelievably luscious body. The finish has a fine streak of lemon. Drink till 2030.

title: Colosi 2017 Rosso Red (Terre Siciliane)
description: Made with 85% Nero d'Avola and 15% Nerello Cappuccio, this opens with earthy aromas of scorched earth, dark fruit and cooking spice. The simple palate offers ripe dark berry and vanilla alongside smooth tannins. Drink soon.

title: Côte West 2015 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky cherry, strawberry and vanilla combine to provide a fruity red with moderate structure and understated ripeness in this vineyard-designate.

title: Crosby Roamann 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A skin-fermented, 100% Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is dark and brooding with a slightly oxidative character that won't appeal to everybody. Concentrated and oaky, it tastes of honey and baked apple with a viscosity that lingers.

title: Cyan 2015  Toro
description: Gamy rubbery berry-fruit aromas include oak and iodine notes. A choppy hard palate tastes of roasted berry fruits and green herbs, while a full tannic finish is chunky and soupy.

title: Dois Irmãos 2016 Two Brothers' Private Selection Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Here is a straightforward, rather earthy wine, without the supple muscularity of the previous vintage. The fruit thins out quickly, leading into a dilute, one-dimensional finish.

title: Glenora 2016 Pinot Gris (Finger Lakes)
description: Shy aromas of citrus and apple blend with a light plastic tone. This is slick in feel, with green apple and pear holding court, ending on a crunchy apple peel tone.

title: Henri Bourgeois 2017 Petit Bourgeois Sauvignon Blanc (Val de Loire)
description: This wine is herbal and crisp, with a tight edge of minerality. Juicy currants and freshly sliced green fruits dominate this lightly textured wine. Drink now.

title: Herdade do Esporão 2017 Esporão Colheita Antão Vaz (Alentejano)
description: This spicy, lightly peppery wine is ripe and full of tropical fruit flavors. It has balanced acidity to contrast with the richness of the wine. Drink this wine now.

title: Las Vertientes 2016 Benchmark Reserva Red (Mendoza)
description: A black color and throwback aromas of raisin, prune and spice cake reflect a dated recipe based on overripe fruit. The palate on this Malbec blend is more confirmation of that; it's soupy and thick. Blackened, minty flavors are nearly fruitless through the finish.

title: Marilena Barbera 2017 La Bambina Nero d'Avola (Menfi)
description: Aromas of wildflower, woodland berry and Mediterranean scrub lift out of the glass. On the fresh, informal palate, crisp acidity underscores pink grapefruit, unripe pomegranate and a hint of sage.

title: Maryhill 2015 Tavolo Rosso Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Sangiovese makes up three-quarters of this wine, with the balance being Cabernet Sauvignon. Tire rubber, cherry, armpit and spice aromas lead to lighter styled, straightforward fruit flavors. It doesn't all come together.

title: McManis 2017 Chardonnay (River Junction)
description: Ripe tasting, rounded and rather soft in feel, this medium-bodied wine oozes pear, butter and butterscotch flavors for a rich, mouthcoating effect. The McManis family makes it from a vineyard that is certified sustainable.

title: Primarius 2016 Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: Aromas of tire rubber give way to notes of strawberry, cherry and smoke. The palate brings a pleasing sense of elegance but can't make up the difference.

title: R. Stuart & Co. NV Bubbly Sparkling (Oregon)
description: Tasted in July 2018, this nonvintage brut is a 50/50 blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc. The bubbles are big and fat, and the wine carries scents of powdered sugar sprinkled on grapefruit. It falls on the rustic side of the sparkling wine spectrum, but packs plenty of flavor, including a potent streak of sweet baking spices.

title: Rios de Tinta 2016  Ribera del Duero
description: Black-fruit aromas include notes of rubber and mixed spices. On the palate, this is loose in structure but shows ample acidity. Moderately ripe berry and black-plum flavors are savory and taste of stewed meat on the finish.

title: Truett Hurst 2016 Inconspicuous Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Syrupy black fruit is liqueur-like in consistency and richness, the wine dusty in texture and wrap-around tannin. It has a burly ripeness that dominates in all aspects.

title: Waterbrook 2017 Icon Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of vanilla, wilted flower and stone fruit are followed by full-bodied, dry, lightly creamy feeling peach flavors. The oak seems a bit heavy-handed.

title: Arrocal 2016 Ocho Meses En Barrica  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Aromas of cherry Kool-Aid and candied berry fruits are circumspect. On the palate, this young Tempranillo is chunky, pulpy and lacking in definition. Oaky flavors of chocolate, chicken fat and spice stand out more than fruit, while this lacks intensity on a plump finish.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2016 Virdiana Roble  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Jammy berry and cotton candy aromas are a bit hot and weedy. This feels sappy but upright on the palate. Flavors of plum, currant and green herbs finish with grip and spice notes.

title: Bird in Hand 2016 Sparkling Pinot Noir (Adelaide Hills)
description: This ballerina pink fizz smells of watermelon rind, strawberry and white pepper. The palate is on the sweet side, with a creamy texture and a slightly bitter rind quality sneaking back in towards the finish.

title: Zuccardi 2017 Fosil San Pablo Chardonnay (Uco Valley)
description: Few Argentinean Chardonnays have achieved this level of quality, so despite the high price, Fosil is special. For starters, it comes from the spot with the highest elevation in Mendoza: San Pablo in the Uco Valley. This smells of spiced apple and butterscotch, while a high-energy palate comes straight from the terroir. Lightly buttery baked apple and peach flavors are pure and steady on a firm, balanced finish. Drink through 2021.

title: Acumen 2014 Peak Attelas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From an estate-grown site that's rocky and sheltered from high heat, this wine, blended with 4% Malbec, retains plenty of firm acidity alongside big-boned tannins and balanced weight. Coffee and cassis complement a wealth of dark cherry, blueberry and plum flavors.

title: Allan Hancock 2016 Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Dark berry and cherry fruits meet with turned earth, oak smoke and wet rocks on the intriguing nose of this bottling from the Santa Maria community college winery. Boysenberry and black-raspberry flavors show on the sip alongside shaved cocoa and soil flavors, the overall richness cut smartly by acid.

title: Balletto 2016 BCD Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Bright and balanced, this is from a relatively warm site and is full, fleshy and meaty in style. Savory black tea and cardamom season a core of red cassis, black cherry and strawberry, with a soft, velvety texture behind the fruit.
designation: BCD Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Barfontarc 2009 Cuvée Sainte Germaine Brut  (Champagne)
description: Produced by the Baroville cooperative in the Aube, this rich, rounded wine has balanced fruit that is just beginning to show some good aging. Toast and almonds are coming through the tight white-fruit texture. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Baron Albert NV La Pimpante Blanc de Blancs Fûts Brut  (Champagne)
description: Fermented in wood, this is a rich, concentrated wine. A panoply of ripe white fruits and tense acidity enhance the texture. Spiced apple and a touch of toast add complexity. Drink now.
designation: La Pimpante Blanc de Blancs Fûts Brut

title: Ben Haines 2015 Volta Brackets Marsanne (Yarra Valley)
description: Ben Haines's whites are all about texture, and this Yarra Valley Marsanne doesn't disappoint. It's mineral-driven and tightly wound. with aromas of honeysuckle, pear, green apple rind and crushed stone that flow seamlessly onto a palate that's citrusy and chalky. A backbone of bright, focused acidity makes this exceptionally food friendly.

title: Bertrand-Delespierre NV Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: The nonvintage cuvée from this producer, this reveals great finesse. Minerality and tight acidity are balanced by the elegant white fruit and acidity. Everything is just right, giving a crisp wine that is ready to drink.
designation: Enfant de la Montagne Premier Cru Brut

title: Bethel Heights 2016 West Block Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: The West block vines date to 1977 and reveal complex flavors of pomegranate and raspberry fruit, layered with chocolate and coconut streaks. It's balanced and persistent, drinking nicely and set to age gracefully for a decade or longer.

title: Billecart-Salmon NV Brut Sous Bois  (Champagne)
description: Equal proportions of the three main Champagne grapes and partial aging in wood before bottling give this wine a distinctively rich character. Bottle aging has also softened the concentrated white fruits and acidity. This balanced wine is ready to drink.

title: Boizel NV Ultime Extra Brut  (Champagne)
description: This crisp wine balances dryness with its ripe fruit and strong mineral texture. It is rich while also so dry ,with almost no dosage. As such it needs to age a little longer, so drink this bottling from 2019.

title: Chehalem 2015 Ridgecrest Vineyards (Reserve) Pinot Noir (Ribbon Ridge)
description: This reserve-level wine, from the estate's Ribbon Ridge AVA vineyard, is concentrated and complicated. Aging in half new oak barrels piles on flavors of baking spices and toast, while the core of ripe cherry fruit is highlighted with streaks of cola, coffee and tobacco. It's drinking quite nicely and should continue to do so through 2025.

title: Deer Creek 2015 Private Reserve Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: The talented Herb Quady had a hand in making this wine, a delicious bottle jam-packed with flavors of blueberry compote and blueberry cobbler. It's tasty, forward and set in a palate-pleasing toasty frame. Drink now–2023.

title: Domaine de la Gaverie 2017 Demi-Sec  (Vouvray)
description: Neither dry nor sweet, this wine is fruity, with a firm edge of minerality and a zesty character. It hovers between acidity, fresh fruit and a more honeyed character giving poise and some good aging potential. Drink this succulent wine from 2020.

title: Domaine Fouassier 2017 Clos Paradis  (Sancerre)
description: This rich wine has not lost its acidity or mineral-driven white fruits. With a touch of pepper on the palate from the alcohol, the wine is full, dense and will be better from 2019.

title: Domaine Laporte 2017 Les Grandmontains  (Sancerre)
description: With an edge of tangy fruit, this wine is ripe, concentrated and intensely textured. Its strong citrus fruits, great acidity, concentrated minerality and zesty freshness are still developing. It needs time to round out and become even richer. Drink from 2020.

title: Elyse 2015 York Creek Vineyard Petite Sirah (Spring Mountain District)
description: Huge in tannin structure, this mountain-grown wine includes 7% Carignan and 2% Zinfandel. Baked bread, red fruit, leather and sizable brawn characterize its youthfulness; enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Encosta do Sobral 2015 Different Red (Tejo)
description: A powerful wine, an iron fist in a velvet glove, this wine is rich and dense, hiding its tannic concentration with a smooth generous texture. Acidity, ripe black fruits and layers of acidity and dryness all suggest that the wine should age further. Drink from 2019.

title: Franz Keller 2017 Vom Löss Pinot Gris (Baden)
description: Sugar cookie and lemon aromas perfume this elegantly structured Pinot Gris. It's medium bodied and dry, with concentrated grapefruit and lemon flavors that leave a pleasant murmur of citrus zest on midpalate. It finishes on lingering notes of crushed mineral and volcanic ash.

title: Fullerton 2016 Fir Crest Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This mix of clone 115 and Pommard is principally sourced for vines more than three decades old. It's firmly anchored in dark flavors of black cherry, cassis, baker's chocolate and espresso. Tannins are ripe and firm, while the finish carries a light suggestion of charred wood.

title: Pelissero 2015 Tulin  (Barbaresco)
description: Toasted oak, espresso and dark cooking spice lead the nose. The taut palate delivers raspberry jam, clove, vanilla and coffee alongside astringent tannins that grip the finish. Drink after 2022.

title: Planeta 2017 La Segreta Grillo (Sicilia)
description: Here's a fresh, light-bodied white that offers aromas of citrus, apple, wildflower and a hint of Mediterranean herb. The aromas carry over to the tangy palate along with a saline note.

title: Planeta 2017 Rosato (Sicilia)
description: Made with Nero d'Avola and Syrah, this delightful rosato has aromas of wildflower, Mediterranean brush and red berry. Reflecting the nose, the bright, easy-drinking palate offers pomegranate, citrus and a hint of white pepper alongside tangy acidity.
