title: Pradorey 2015 Crianza Finca Valdelayegua Single Vineyard  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Spicy black-cherry aromas are earthy and herbal, with a note of olive. A deep but tightly drawn palate brings flavors of berry, plum and raspberry. This Crianza is tight as nails on a raw finish. Time could help this along; drink through 2028.

title: Prinsi 2015 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with aromas suggesting hay, black plum and cooking spice. The taut palate offers sour cherry, clove and vanilla alongside close-grained, somewhat astringent tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Quinta dos Murças 2017 Assobio Branco White (Douro)
description: A blend of five Douro grapes, the wine is soft with an open texture that has attractive acidity to balance. Richness is balanced with a tight texture that gives the wine its shape and crisp aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Sanguinhal 2017 Quinta de S. Francisco White (Obidos)
description: This is a soft wine that has a rounded texture that is gently lifted by crisp apples and acidity. It's the bright acidity of the Vital grape in the blend that really gives the wine its refreshing nature. Drink now.

title: Sean Minor 2015 Point North Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Already showing some sunset colors, this wine seems to be moving quickly to maturity. It's lightly fruity with strawberries and a hint of sweet spice. Drink up.

title: Serafino 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (McLaren Vale)
description: This offers flavors of lemon, melon and stone fruit backed by spicy oak. The acidity is bright, while the oak adds texture without being too heavy. It's restrained and poised, just lacking some excitement.

title: Sierra Norte 2016 Porta Regia Colección Privada 5 Meses Monastrell (Jumilla)
description: Blackberry and black-cherry aromas lead to a saturated and syrupy palate with dry tannins. Blackened, rubbery dark-berry flavors end with a plunk, like a big round rock hitting water. Welcome to the world of ripe, weighty Monastrell.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 The Investor Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends sizable portions of Merlot and Petite Sirah with Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, the varieties in tension with one another for dominance, with the Petite Sirah winning. Baked plum, cocoa powder and black pepper ride along a thick tannic frame.

title: The Four Graces 2015 Doe Ridge Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: The mouthfeel is quite chalky, and flavors of earth, tea, tobacco and charcoal dominate. The resulting astringency seems to thin out the fruit. This might best be drunk with a big, fatty protein entrée.

title: The Vice 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Meaty, dry and light, this wine offers moderate length and body, with highlighted flavors of cherry, lemon peel and mint.

title: Theresa Eccher 2016 Alizée Bianco  (Etna)
description: Spring flower, lemon zest and Mediterranean herb aromas follow over to the racy, rather lean palate along with green pear and wet stone. Brisk acidity gives it a crisp finish.

title: Thiénot NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Ripe with red-fruit flavors, this balanced wine is soft and easy to enjoy. The taste of strawberries is gently lifted by acidity and a smooth, rounded texture, finishing with ripe fruits.

title: Tie-Dye 2015 Red (North Coast)
description: A deep, dark color and smoky aromas lead to ripe and fairly rich fruit flavors in this big and straightforward wine. It is full bodied and somewhat tannic in texture, which makes sense considering the 43% Syrah, 40% Petite Sirah and 17% Zinfandel that went into the blend.

title: Timothy Malone 2016 Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Tim Malone employs no new wood and relies upon spontaneous fermentations when crafting his wines. The result here is a medium-bodied, only lightly ripened wine, with a mix of rhubarb, mountain berry, pepper and herb. The tannins remain stiff and herbal, with a hint of stem.

title: Tinedo 2015 Cala N.2 Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla)
description: Blackberry, raisin and baking-spice aromas generate a sense of power more than finesse and elegance. On the palate, this blend of Tempranillo, Graciano and Cabernet Sauvignon is beyond intense. Flavors of savory berry, oak and caramel finish bold and syrupy.
region_1: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla

title: Vignobles Berthier 2014 La Croix Renaud  (Sancerre)
description: Surprisingly pale in color, this wine is old-style red Sancerre. Light, crisp cherry flavors and acidity all pull together. It is perfumed, soft and ready to drink.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2014 Flavium Premium Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Initally, this Bierzo Mencía is funky smelling, with gamy aromas of berry fruits, iodine and rubber. A flush, heavy palate is more thick and flat than lively, while herbal green notes infiltrate berry and spice flavors. Green peppercorn flavors stand out on a chunky finish.

title: Vollereaux NV Brut Rosé de Saignée  (Champagne)
description: A dark-colored rosé, this has a rich texture and ripe red berry fruits. The finish is soft, with a generous full-bodied character to go with the warm fruitiness. The wine is ready to drink.

title: A to Z 2016 The Essence of Oregon Pinot Noir (Oregon)
description: This is a 25 vineyard blend, with the word “Essence” in bold black script across the label. The wine is a rather insubstantial essence, delivering light berry fruit flavors, and a touch of tomato. It finishes with tart acidity.

title: Adega Mayor 2013 Reserva do Commendador Red (Alentejano)
description: Richly spicy and with bold black fruits, this wine was wood aged giving the wine a toasty edge as well as dense black-plum flavors. It also has a touch of pepper from the high alcohol which is less attractive. Its tannins are still powerful, but drink this wine now.

title: Atalayas de Golbán 2015 Torre de Golbán Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: Bold berry fruit and spun-sugar aromas scream ripeness and oak. On the palate, this strikes as being tough, aggressive and forward in nature; nothing is reserved or subtle. Crackling plum and cherry flavors wrap up on a rough finish. More time in bottle could help this, but Crianzas shouldn't require a lot of patience. Drink through 2030.

title: Backsberg 2017 Méthode Cap Classique Brut Sparkling (Paarl)
description: This kosher bubbly is light and easy, with soft aromas and flavors of strawberry tops, snappy currant and red apple skin. The palate is lively and brisk in feel, with medium acidity and an enduring note of melon rind on the finish. Drink now.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Full bodied and almost fat with all its unctuous flavors, this wine smells like butter and baking spices and tastes like pear syrup and nutmeg. It has a mouth-coating texture, plenty of oak influence and a sense of near-sweetness on the finish.

title: Bellante 2016 Jack McGinley Vineyard Syrah (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Concentrated aromas of blackberry and balsamic glaze show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is very tangy and thick with more berry-balsamic touches as well as peppery spice.

title: Bleasdale 2014 Frank Potts Red (Langhorne Creek)
description: This blend is currently quite woody and closed at the moment. Plenty of swirling renders notes of currants, tobacco leaf, mint and other green herbs on the nose. Structurally, it's set up for aging from a good deal of acidity, bold tannins and and an earthy profile. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Bodegas Heredad Aduna 2014 Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Plum and berry aromas come with notes of tobacco ash and green herbs. On the palate, this is a bit closed and clipped. Savory, spicy berry and plum flavors finish with length and notes of vanilla and mixed spices.

title: Bodegas Valdemar 2014 Fincas Valdemacuco Crianza  (Ribera del Duero)
description: An obtuse nose with chunky berry aromas gets sketchier under the microscope, which unveils aromas of green bean and mulch. A flat rubbery tough palate is fiercely tannic, while this tastes a bit stewed and heavy. A rubbery finish tastes of dark-berry fruit.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Big Red (Contra Costa County)
description: This wine is full bodied, dry, firm but smooth in texture and has a good array of berry and black-cherry flavors. It has nice weight and breadth and a good balance of body, moderate tannins and fruit acidity.

title: Château de la Viaudière NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: This simple, fruity wine with a rounded texture offers flavors of ripe strawberries. Produced from Grolleau (used widely in still rosé wines) and Cabernet Franc, the wine had three years on the lees before disgorgement, giving extra final richness. Drink now.

title: Collet NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: A deep colored rosé that is full of fruit, this is ripe but with plenty of contrasting acidity. Red-currant flavors dominate, with a cleansing streak of freshness and a tangy aftertaste. This bottling is ready to drink.

title: Copper Belt 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a solid, seamless, but rather blocky wine. Flavors of black cherry come highlighted with scents and streaks of tobacco. The tannins are thick and fully ripened, with an earthy aspect that suggests Eola-Amity Hills fruit, though that remains unspecified.

title: D. Massin NV Cuvée de Réserve Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This Aube-based producer has created a delicious, soft wine. Its red fruits are gentle, ripe and fully integrated with the creamy mousse and light acidity at the end. The bottling is ready to drink.

title: Daniel Reverdy & Fils 2017  Sancerre
description: This bright, fruity wine offers lively acidity and an almost chalky texture. It is taut and crisp, a classic Sauvignon Blanc from the village of Verdigny. Drink now.

title: Desire 2016 Eiswein White (Rheinhessen)
description: Jasmine tea, honey and saffron perfume this intriguing value icewine. The palate is peachy and honeyed but marked by savory tones of earth and smoked herb. Fresh lemony acidity accentuates its delicate, lacy mouthfeel and lingering finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Domaine des Patureaux 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: This wine has layers of citrus and crisp fruits under ripe apricot and sweet apple flavors. A tangy texture gives shape to this attractive wine, although it is really all about fruitiness. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Gueneau 2017 Les Griottes  (Sancerre)
description: Named after the cherry trees that once grew where the vineyard is now, this wine is textured, crisp and full of layered citrus fruit and acidity. Still young, it will be better from 2019.

title: Domaine Vincent Carême 2016 Tania & Vincent Carême Spring  (Vouvray)
description: This wine is yeasty and fruity, with good aging potential. Nuttiness, spice and a touch of ginger give this wine a fruity character that is still developing. Good acidity and a crisp floral aftertaste point to the future. Drink from 2020.

title: Talisman 2014 Red Dog Vineyard Honey's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Bursting in black cherry and a light thread of cola spice, this is from a single block of one site, planted all to Pommard clone. Tree bark and black tea provide seasoning to a soft and lengthy palate of exuberance.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2016 Calderara Sottana  (Etna)
description: Aromas of Spanish broom, Mediterranean brush, citrus zest and a subtle whiff of oak slowly take shape. On the palate, bright acidity frames ripe lemon, golden apple, coffee bean and minerality. This is a serious white made to be paired with savory first courses as opposed to a simple aperitif.

title: The Lane NV Lois Blanc de Blancs  (Adelaide Hills)
description: This delicate, low key sparkler is a blend of three different clones of Chardonnay. The variety shows its many colors with subtle fig, white spice and tropical fruit notes. The palate is creamy but balanced by fine bubbles and crisp acidity.

title: Tobias 2015 Formation Red (Sonoma-Mendocino)
description: Hearty and full bodied, this wine is loaded with blackberry, dark chocolate and beef flavors and structured with moderate tannins and a rich mouthfeel. Blended from Zinfandel, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, it has good concentration, ripeness and length, and it's easy to enjoy.

title: Travaglini 2012 Tre Vigne  (Gattinara)
description: Aromas of eucalyptus, exotic spice, underbrush and aromatic herb lead the nose. The tightly knit palate offers cranberry, dried cherry, star anise and clove set against taut, close-grained tannins.

title: Veuve Doussot NV Grand Cuvée Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is the standard nonvintage cuvée from this Aube-based producer. With two years bottle age before release, it is still fresh but with smooth fruits that show some maturity. Apples and citrus come well together along with a well-balanced aftertaste. Drink this bottling now.

title: Ziata 2015 Mia Madre Red (Napa Valley)
description: Tight-grained tannins and oak define this wine's powerful concentration and the heartiness of the vintage. Flavors of black plum, blackberry and leather give it fruit-forward complexity but are held in check by the wines inherent structure.

title: Joseph Mellot 2014 Le Connétable  (Sancerre)
description: This smoothly textured, cherry-flavored wine is rich and gently tannic. Ripe fruits partner with a good layer of acidity. It has a crisp edge along with spice from wood aging. The wine is just ready to drink, still fruity, ripe and fleshy.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: This wine starts with plush aromas of yellow melon, plumeria, wild lime sorbet and a hint of cream. There is ample zip to the palate, where acidity and a strong floral character keep the honeydew and white peach flavors in check.

title: Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)
description: Made from 93% Pinot Noir and 7% Pinot Meunier, this is a lovely sparkling wine, rounded and layered with moderate acidity. The flavors dance around aspects of wild strawberry, raspberry and melon, with a lasting tease of hazelnut.

title: Acumen 2014 Mountainside Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blending 42% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Malbec, 19% Merlot, 14% Cabernet Franc and 6% Petit Verdot, this is an elegant, structured red, elongated by silky tannins. Cedar, sage, red currant and turned earth provide an understated savory personality.

title: Amarano 2012 Principe Lagonessa  (Taurasi)
description: Forest floor, plum, baking spice and incense aromas lift out of the glass. It's concentrated, chewy and brooding, doling out blackberry jam, star anise and crushed mint framed in firm, close-grained tannins. Drink after 2024.

title: Argyle 2016 Spirithouse Chardonnay (Dundee Hills)
description: The Knudsen vineyard is the source of this reserve-level release. It's toasty and thick with tree fruits. There's a viscous, almost oily quality to the wine, which is long on flavor, though a bit uniform throughout.

title: Artesa 2016 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: This soft, smooth estate wine is forward in tart red fruit, supported by pillowy tannins and well-balanced acidity. There are welcome flavors of cherry and strawberry that flirt with pomegranate and rhubarb.

title: Artesa 2016 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Silky, sanguine and tart, this wine is defined by tones of strawberry, rhubarb and citrus. It is a delicate, lightly textured wine that holds its ripeness well and has a lingering spice note.

title: Au Contraire 2015 Lawler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine offers expressive tones of strawberry, leather and jam, with a full-bodied, rich approach. A creamy, velvety quality unfolds on the palate, supported by brawny tannins.

title: Blue Rock 2017 Baby Blue Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made with the addition of 9% Viognier grown in Bennett Valley, this is a pleasing white layered in lushness and strong flavors of pineapple and mango. The tropical nature doesn't preclude brightness and balance, ending in a flourish of white flowers.

title: Boniperti 2016 Carlin Nebbiolo (Colline Novaresi)
description: Underbrush, crushed mint and dark-spice aromas lead the way. It's juicy and savory, doling out dried red cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside bright acidity and firm, refined tannins. A salty note marks the close.

title: Bruliam 2016 Rocky Ridge Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: This is a hearty red, completely characteristic of its rough-hewn, mountain appellation, a study in crushed rock and elusive mineral elements. The fruit is a mix of blackberry and black cherry dipped in chocolate, with seasonings of black and white pepper.

title: Calluna 2015 Calluna Vineyards Cuvée Red (Chalk Hill)
description: This is among the finest Bordeaux blends at its price point, from estate-grown fruit, and consisting of a majority Merlot. A dusty, oaky nose gives way to soft fleshy black fruit, cedar and black pepper, offering length and breadth with ease.

title: Estampa 2016 Reserva Red (Colchagua Valley)
description: Aromas of olive, juniper and green herb control a low-fruit nose. A flabby body without much structure and herbal flavors of plum and cherry finish bland, with almost no follow through.

title: Primus 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Maipo Valley)
description: A berry aroma carries an earthy undertone in this wine. The palate has mild lift, with little definition to its fruit tones.

title: Univitis 2017 Grand Théatre Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: A simple wine, this is attractive with red fruits but needs serious chilling to be at its best. Drink now.

title: Binz 2016 Hanna's Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Charred wood-smoke aromas and raw oak flavors nearly overwhelm the taste of this heavy-handed and medium-bodied wine.

title: Black Box 2016 Rosé (California)
description: This is a basic, straightforward wine with light watermelon flavors, a soft mouthfeel and short finish.

title: Château La Croix de Marsan 2016  Bordeaux
description: Dark chocolate and spice dominate this tough wine. The structure and extraction have smothered the fruit. Aging will be a hard call.

title: Château Saint Antoine 2016 Fleur Saint Antoine  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: Closed and tough, this wine has spent too long in wood. It offers little but spice and toast.

title: El Coto 2017 Blanco Verdejo (Rioja)
description: An almost watery color is telling. This Verdejo is not common to the Rioja region, and it's not showing much. A flimsy palate holds bland, lightly vegetal white fruit flavors that don't hold up for long on a slightly bitter finish.

title: Loma Larga 2017 Lomas del Valle Pinot Noir (Casablanca Valley)
description: A dark red color and dull, grassy, green aromas send up the red flags. This Pinot from a short and hot vintage is heavy and flat. Soft, gummy berry flavors are lacking in varietal character, while this feels clunky and tastes murky and like red licorice candy on the finish.

title: Millésimé 2016 Orange Muscat (Santa Barbara County)
description: Melon and candied lemon meet with oxidized, vinegar-laced aromas on the nose of this bottling. Cooked lemons and apple-cider flavors show on the palate.

title: Original House Wine 2017 Fish House Sauvignon Blanc (America)
description: Light aromas of tropical fruit and herb carry a slight metallic note. The flavor concentration is quite light, making this simple and straightforward.

title: Viña Bisquertt 2016 La Joya Gran Reserva Syrah (Colchagua Valley)
description: This Syrah seems to have been caught up in the rains of 2016. It smells distinctly raw and herbaceous, like olives in brine. A tannic, drawing palate is rough, while this tastes of herbal red plum, cranberry and pepper. A bone-dry finish could use more heft.

title: Viña el Principal 2015 Calicanto Red (Maipo Valley)
description: A minty green nose with sappy raspberry and rhubarb aromas leads to a raw but dense palate. Jammy berry aromas have a weedy green side, while this tracks back to minty and green on the finish.

title: Autoritas NV Gran Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Chile)
description: Baked berry and raisin aromas are dull and flat. This Cabernet feels sticky and jammy, with no flow to the palate. Candied berry and raisin flavors turn gummy and chewy on the finish.

title: Bodegas Ondarre NV Selección Millennium Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: A yellow color and doughy aromas of bread and applesauce are less than fresh. A flat palate lacks acidity and pulse, while this tastes of yeasty dough and sour citrus fruit. A tangy, briny finish suggests scrambled eggs on top of sourdough bread.

title: Can Sumoi 2017 Serra De L'Home Xarel-lo (Penedès)
description: This new Xarello from Pepe Raventós and Francesc Escala arrives in a stout bottle that's a nice touch. A nose of crushed vitamins lacks pop and freshness. The cidery palate is low on balance, while it finishes nutty and salty, like peanut butter or peanut brittle.

title: Château La Mothe du Barry 2016 Cuvée le Barry  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
description: This wine is spoiled by overripe fruit. It has a juicy component as well as firm tannins, but that high-alcohol jammy character is not pleasant.

title: Harvest Press NV Chardonnay (America)
description: Aromas of roasted corn and herb lead to a ripe stone-fruit flavor. This is an easy, enjoyable wine at an accessible price.

title: Llano Estacado 2017 Moscato (Texas)
description: Guava, orange blossom and Mandarin aromas introduce this uncomplicated, sugary Moscato. The palate is luscious and loaded with melon, Valencia orange, mango and lychee flavors that lead into a sweet finish.

title: Reichwage 2015 Twin Hills Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoked cherry and tea flavors become somewhat stemmy and green, with a touch of leather and barnyard-like earth.

title: Collina Serragrilli 2015 Serragrilli  (Barbaresco)
description: This offers aromas of dark-skinned fruit, eucalyptus and espresso. The concentrated palate delivers raspberry jam, Marasca cherry, roasted coffee bean and licorice alongside youthfully assertive tannins. Drink 2022–2026.

title: Colomé 2014 Estate Malbec (Salta)
description: Inky, concentrated aromas of black fruits are mildly spicy and granular. High acidity along with a grape-skins texture defines the palate, which tastes of grapy blackberry. A compact, narrow finish is flush but lacks expansiveness.

title: Conde Bel 2008 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Subtle cedar and tobacco aromas are smooth and mature. This Gran Reserva from a notoriously tough and cold vintage feels tight, firm and rubbery. Savory, slightly stewed berry and plum flavors are lightly herbal and finish with gritty tension.

title: Deutz NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: This beautifully balanced, perfumed wine offers both red fruits and tangy acidity. The dosage fits its fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Dion 2015 Wedding Tree Cuvée Brut Sparkling (Chehalem Mountains)
description: Made in the méthode traditionelle, this is lightly toasty and quite dry. The pale tawny gold hue and dried apple flavors suggest that it be consumed in the near term, between now and 2020. There's a touch of pepper adding a bit of welcome spice to the finish.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2015 McMinnville Cuvée Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: Wines from this small AVA are often marked with a strong minerality, but here it's only mildly evident. The grapy fruit flavors suggest it was sourced from young vines, and the ample acidity puts that fruit front and center, with little indication of time in new barrels. Enjoy it for its youth and freshness, and drink now–2022.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2016 Dundee Hills Cuvée Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Part of the winery's AVA Collection, this new release is the first of the 2016s. An unusual streak of pine sap enlivens the aromas, not harsh, but definitely present on the palate. There's blueberry and fig fruit as well, and the fig comes with a Newtonian crunch. Though not typical of this AVA in the heart of the Willamette Valley, it's an interesting and compelling wine nonetheless.

title: Domaine Laporte 2015 Les Grandmontains  (Sancerre)
description: A light Pinot Noir, this is soft, full of red-cherry flavors and silky tannins. The wine has a fresh feel while also offering plenty of ripe fruitiness, acidity and a refreshing, crisp aftertaste. Drink this gently structured, balanced wine from 2020.

title: Donnafugata 2015 Chiarandà  (Contessa Entellina)
description: Aromas of ripe orchard fruit, oak, toast and coconut lead the nose. On the enveloping palate, you'll find dried apricot, toasted oak, nut and a hint of crushed herb. Enjoy over the next few years to capture the remaining fruit richness.

title: Duck Pond 2016 Willow Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This limited cuvée includes about one-quarter whole clusters, and saw 30% new French oak. Strawberry, raspberry and a light wash of mocha orchestrate a young, fresh and fruity wine ready for immediate enjoyment.

title: Elio Filippino 2013 Serra Capelli  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of cedar, menthol and dark berry emerge from the glass. The dense palate offers ripe black plum, mocha and clove alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Elizabeth Chambers 2015 Lazy River Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Still tasting quite young, this tight, chewy wine seems to be in the midst of pulling itself together. Components of sour plum, wild cherry and green tea are in place, but the seamless ripeness of past vintages is not, at least for now.

title: Elizabeth Chambers 2015 Russell-Grooters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Compact and stubbornly closed, this offers suggestions of plum and cherry, framed with stem and earth. The tannins conjure up black tea, finishing dark and astringent.

title: Fabio Zambolin 2015 Vallelonga Nebbiolo (Coste della Sesia)
description: Tense and linear, this offers pomegranate, clove, menthol and licorice flavors. Taut close-grained tannins provide the tight framework while fresh acidity lends balance. Drink after 2020.

title: Fairsing 2016 Sullivan Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Other than slight clonal variations in the three estate blends, there's little to differentiate the 2016 Pinots from Fairsing, at least at this young age. This has the same citrus component and wild blackberry fruit as the wine labeled Estate. Barrel aging for 10 months in 30% new French oak adds a touch of vanilla wafer.

title: Francis Blanchet 2017 Silice  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: This tense, dense wine is still young. Its pure line in acidity is emphasized by the concentration and strong minerality. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2017 Schiefer Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: Notes of wet slate, green apple and orange blossom perfume this delicately off-dry wine. The palate is juicy, offering a pristine citrus flavor that is accented by zesty acidity and a clean, mineral finish. While not a deeply concentrated wine, it is invigorating and thirst quenching.

title: Gyéjacquot Frères NV Anatom Blanc Vrai Brut  (Champagne)
description: This blend holds Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, the latter aged briefly in wood. The result is a generous wine, the acidity integrated into ripe apple flavors. It is fruity, still a young bottling and likely to benefit from a few more months of aging. Drink from 2019.

title: Huett 2017 Croft Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: This half-stainless- and half-neutral-oak-fermented wine takes a gentle approach to this variety. The natural acidity and herbaceousness of Sauvignon Blanc is softened here with 10 g/L of residual sugar. The wine is round and fruity, with a mix of preserved lemon, white peach and pineapple. Drink slightly chilled.

title: Jean Laurent NV Cuvée Blanche Brut Pinot Blanc (Champagne)
description: It's often forgotten that Pinot Blanc is one of the permitted grapes in Champagne. Normally found in the Aube, it makes, as here, a wine softer than Chardonnay, with ripe white fruits and an open texture. This wine is attractive, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Forget-Brimont NV Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: From the northern slopes of the Montagne de Reims, the vines in this wine are classified as Grand Cru. They have produced a refined, stylish wine with tense minerality and intense acidity. The bottling, with layers of citrus and a crisp texture, is still young and will be better from 2019.
designation: Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Brut

title: Foxen 2016 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe red cherry meets with hints of dewy thyme, sagebrush and minty earth on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is loaded with herbal impact, as thyme and oregano provide depth to the pomegranate and raspberry flavors.

title: Fritz Haag 2016 Brauneberger Juffer Feinherb Riesling (Mosel)
description: Intensely dusty, smoky mineral tones introduce this just-off-dry Riesling. It's a bracing, invigorating sip, offering layers of fresh lemon and lime flavors accented by salt and just a glimmer of tannins on the finish. A complex, thirst-quenching wine to enjoy now–2025.

title: Fullerton 2016 Bella Vida Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: Once again the Bella Vida rings the bell as the best of a fine lineup of Pinots from Fullerton. Rich, ripe, powerful fruit flavors mix strawberry jam, black cherry syrup, coffee, cola and brown spices. It's not a wine you have to wait on; enjoy it now through the early 2020s.

title: G D Vajra 2014 Bricco delle Viole  (Barolo)
description: Woodland berry, blue flower, underbrush, tobacco and crushed herb aromas lead the way on this fragrant wine. It's ethereally elegant, delivering succulent red berry, star anise and tobacco alongside polished tannins and vibrant acidity. It's already almost accessible but also shows good mid-term aging potential. Drink 2019–2026.

title: H.& C. Nittnaus 2017 Spätlese Muskat Ottonel (Burgenland)
description: Lemon sherbet candy, ripe green grapes and a floral touch of honeysuckle make for a heady nose. The palate continues in the same hedonistic fashion and strikes a joyful balance between lovely fruit sweetness tempered by lemony freshness and overtones of nettle and elderflower. A perfect accompaniment to fruit salads and smelly cheese with its medium-sweet and refreshing finish.

title: Hearst Ranch 2015 The Point Red (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry aromas are layered with savory touches of pepper, salt, leather and turned earth on the complex and well-integrated nose of this Bordeaux blend, named for the Hearst family's rocky point off of San Simeon beach. Dark-red and black plums are lifted by marjoram and Asian spice on the medium-bodied palate.

title: Jacquart NV Brut Mosaic Signature  (Champagne)
description: Aged five years on lees rather than the usual three years for Brut Mosaïque, this wine, spelled, confusingly Brut Mosaic, has greater depth and richness. It hints at maturity, opulent and mineral at the same time. Drink now.

title: JCB 2014 No 34 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)
description: This is made from 80% Pinot Noir, the remainder Chardonnay, both coming from both the Napa and Sonoma sides of the appellation. Inviting in wild strawberry, it is dry and stony and exuberant in earthy mineral aspects of crushed rock and dried herb.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: The Jackson Estate wines are usually a couple of steps above K-J Vintner's Reserve. Full ripeness and a moderate vein of sweet-seeming oak make this full-bodied wine taste sunny and appealing. Black-cherry and baking-spice aromas lead to juicy generous fruit flavors.

title: King Estate 2017 Domaine Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: A leader in Oregon Pinot Gris, King Estate nails this mid-priced entry. A tangy mix of grapefruit and other citrus signals a crisp style. The flavors hit the edge of tropical, showing a bit of pineapple. This is a perfect match to a wide variety of lighter seafood and poultry.

title: Lallier NV Loridon Sélection Parcellaire Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: This is one of a pair of Champagnes from vineyards in Aÿ. Made from Chardonnay, it has some minerality but the main thrust is richness balanced by intense acidity and beautiful white stone fruits. It is not quite ready to drink, so wait until 2019.
designation: Loridon Sélection Parcellaire Grand Cru Blanc de Blancs Extra Brut

title: Mailly Grand Cru 2010 L'Intemporelle Rosé Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: From a producer with a panoply of Grand Cru vineyards, this wine is balanced and perfumed. The crisp texture and taut red fruit contrast with the generous richness of this still-young wine. It needs to age a bit more. Drink from 2019.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There is a strong woody touch to the nose of this bottling along with dried peach and dried mango aromas. The palate begins with a strong citrus-peel flavor then leads into green-pear and cider-apple flavors. The finish is a unique touch of kaffir lime leaf and lemongrass, which would go well with a wide variety of food.

title: Nada Giuseppe 2013 Casot Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Enticing aromas of rose petal, red berry and cedar lead the nose. The juicy full-bodied palate doles out red cherry, white pepper and star anise alongside fine-grained tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2020–2029.

title: Panther Creek 2016 Carter Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Young and complex, the Carter selection is a fine-tuned wine with an appealing mix of black fruits. Highlights of peppery herbs lead into a finish balancing stiff tannins and lemony acidity. Good already, but a couple of more years of bottle aging is recommended.

title: Pietro Rinaldi 2014  Barolo
description: Aromas of woodland berry, rose petal and mint slowly take shape on this. The juicy palate offers crushed raspberry, star anise and white pepper alongside polished tannins and fresh acidity. Drink 2020–2027.

title: Prinz Salm 2016 Sommerlocher Steinrossel Erste Lage Trocken Riesling (Nahe)
description: Zesty lime and green plum notes on the nose introduce this vibrantly zesty Riesling. It's dry and medium bodied in style, but juicy white grapefruit and tangerine flavors lend density to the midpalate. Whiffs of fresh herb linger on the finish. Lovely already but should deepen in complexity well through 2030.

title: Purple Hands 2016 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: Aromatic and balanced, Cody Wright's take on fruit from this classic vineyard hits all the right (no pun intended) notes. There are seams of blueberry pie, cola and a hint of minerality, excellent texture and length, and enough stiffness to the tannins to suggest holding off a bit on drinking it. A good window would be 2020 through the decade.

title: Quinta da Romaneira 2016 Vintage  (Port)
description: A jammy wine with fresh acidity as well as bright fruit. It seems to have missed out on structure although smoky fruit is right there. That suggests a wine that will age relatively quickly. Think about drinking this wine from 2026.

title: Dobbes Family Estate 2015 Griffin's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: This is a fine example of the vintage's many strengths. It is irresistible in its violet aroma that carries to the palate of plum, cherry and chocolate flavors. Polished tannins help it gather strength, with hints of tar and asphalt on the well-formed finish. Drink now–2025.

title: Domaine Vacheron 2016  Sancerre
description: The entry-level Pinot Noir from this red-wine specialist reveals ripe and juicy red-berry flavors and a core of tannins. The wine has structure, density and rich fruit all within a balanced structure. Drink from 2019.

title: Enrico Serafino 2014 Brut Rosé Pinot Nero (Alta Langa)
description: Made with 100% Pinot Nero, this racy, refined sparkler has delicate scents of wild berry, pastry dough and a whiff of flowering rosemary. On the dry delicate palate, racy acidity and a lively elegant perlage provide the backdrop for strawberry, tangy citrus and a hint of white pepper.

title: Franz Keller 2017 Vom Löss Pinot Blanc (Baden)
description: Hints of smoke, crushed mineral and lemon zest are inviting on the nose of this dry, full-bodied Pinot Blanc. It's rounded and silky on the palate, but peppered by vivacious streaks of lemon-lime acidity that pierce through the finish. Enjoy now–2025.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This lovely, light-hearted white offers an approachable embrace of firm lemon, fig and mango. It is acid-driven on the palate, with just a touch of lushness on the structured finish.

title: Hickory Hollow 2016 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: This Gewürztraminer strikes a fine balance between the grape's more intense characteristics and subtler, more earth-driven elements. Aromas of ripe yellow apple, green pear rind and a zesty dusting of crushed stone ride over an undercurrent of potpourri spice. With 30% fermented in neutral French oak, the palate is broad in feel yet immensely juicy in a ripe orchard-fruit flavor. Delicate astringency offers a clean close to the tangy powdered-limestone finish.

title: La Ganghija 2015  Barbaresco
description: Aromas of rose petal, red berry and tobacco lead the way. The juicy palate offers raspberry, white pepper and star anise set against firm tannins. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Lallier 2010 Millésime Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
description: This wine is rich, ready to drink and full bodied. It has weight, with hints of yellow fruits as well as crisper citrus. A strong streak of minerality cuts through the wine, giving texture. Drink now.

title: Lallier NV R.014 Rosé Brut  (Champagne)
description: Dominated by fruit from the 2014 vintage, this wine was aged for three years before disgorging. That's given richness without losing the ripe fruit: rich Pinot Noir and taut Chardonnay. It is still a structured wine and will be softer from 2019.

title: Les Frères Couillaud 2016 Château de la Ragotière Cuvée Amélie Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: This full, ripe wine is now deliciously soft, with attractive apple and citrus flavors. It was aged for 12 months on its lees, which has filled out the texture and given extra richness. It is ready to drink.
designation: Château de la Ragotière Cuvée Amélie Sur Lie

title: Matsu 2015 El Recio  (Toro)
description: Intense berry aromas are baked, earthy and suggestive of prune. A powerful palate is direct, healthy and tannic. A mix of black-fruit and blueberry flavors concludes with dry, peppery spice notes on a long tight finish that's on target. Drink through 2026.

title: Oso Libre 2013 Por Vida Estate Red (Adelaida District)
description: Strawberry and cranberry aromas are hit with white-pepper spice on the nose of this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 41% Primitivo and 9% Mourvèdre. There is lively acid on the palate, where fresh black raspberry and more pepper flavors meet with sage and thyme.

title: Pietradolce 2017 Bianco  (Etna)
description: Delicately fragrant, this offers alluring scents of Spanish broom, mature orchard fruit, Mediterranean scrub and flint. On the elegant, medium-bodied palate, fresh acidity supports ripe apple, mature pear, white almond and a saline-driven mineral note.

title: Purple Hands 2016 Stoller Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: This lushly aromatic wine plays out broadly across the palate, with a well-integrated mix of brambly berries, pineapple marinade, cherry cola and a light hint of leather. It's all a single clone from the Stoller Vineyard, and despite its youth it is drinking in peak condition already.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Palisades Vineyard Petite Sirah (Calistoga)
description: Polished tannin and subtle oak await further aging in support of this wine's powerful concentration of violet, molasses and black fig. Peppery, the spice contrasts well against the deeper, richer well of dark chocolate and graham cracker. Enjoy best 2026–2030.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Varozza Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: Soft red fruit comes lightly spiced in this vineyard-designate, from a site in the heart of the appellation. It's plush and lush, with plenty of body and weight: a graceful companion for the table.

title: Rodney Strong 2014 Rockaway Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This vineyard outside of Geyserville is known for contributing great concentration to its wines and this vintage is no exception. Chalky tannins, mocha and cedar wrap around a broad, full-bodied structure that boasts an impressive backbone of succulent cassis and black cherry.

title: Save Our Souls 2016 Pinot Noir (Yarra Valley)
description: From acclaimed Aussie winemaker William Downie along with Jason Searle, this Mornington Peninsula Pinot ticks all the boxes. There are aromas of brambly red berries, mushrooms, wet earth and spice. The palate is mouthfilling, with silky, savory tannins and a mushroom and soy sauce finish. Drink now–2023.

title: Schloss Vollrads 2017 Dry Riesling (Rheingau)
description: While the nose is delicate, this dry, medium-bodied Riesling offers fresh tangerine and white melon flavors accented by a hint of crushed mineral as well as racy lemon-lime acidity. It's an elegant wine that's approachable now but should evolve well through 2025.

title: Steininger 2016 Sparkling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Something salty and savory hovers above the nose of this very frothy, lively sparkler before the full ripeness of fruit hits home. Ripe plums and yellow apples take center stage against a creamy, full body. This is dry, serious and fresh.

title: Aspaldi 2011 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas are a touch baked and raisiny, which makes sense given the warmth and dryness of the 2011 vintage in Rioja. On the palate, this is dry as a bone, with cheek-pounding tannins. Flavors of roasted plum, red currant, tomato sauce and vanilla finish raw but also clean and true. Drink through 2024.

title: Ayala NV Rosé Majeur Brut  (Champagne)
description: Chardonnay dominates this wine (its color comes from the addition of still red wine, a normal practice in Champagne). With its mineral texture and low dosage that give a crisp aftertaste, this is a food-friendly rosé. Drink now.

title: Batasiolo 2014 Boscareto  (Barolo)
description: Earthy aromas of underbrush, truffle, leather and game follow over to the firm palate along with dried cherry, prune, crushed herb and clove. Close-grained, drying tannins provide astringent support while it finishes on a rather salty note. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Bischöfliche Weingüter Trier 2017 DOM Riesling (Mosel)
description: The nose suggests notes of crushed mineral, pollen and sunbaked slate. Tart tangerine and green plum flavors are pristine and juicy on the palate. It finishes quite dry and refreshing.

title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2012 Rioja Bordón Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Spicy rooty aromas of licorice, anise, fennel and dried berry fruits are a bit herbal and raw. As for raw, the palate fits that description, with bumpiness to boot. Berry, oak spice and baking-spice flavors are steady on the finish. Drink through 2023.

title: Bodegas Palacio 2015 Glorioso Crianza  (Rioja)
description: Smooth, spicy berry and black-cherry aromas are spread across a concentrated nose. A tight juicy palate is fresh, while this weighs in as medium-to-full. Lightly roasted berry and plum flavors include a spot of oaky vanilla, while this is mellow and emphasizes freshness and spice notes on the finish.

title: Ca' del Baio 2015 Asili  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of cedar, dark spice and black-skinned berry lead the nose. The dense palate evokes vanilla, black cherry jam and star anise alongside close-grained tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Calabria Family Wines 2014 The Iconic Grand Reserve Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
description: From 100-year-old vines revived by the Calabria family themselves, this is a broody, robust red that needs time in the cellar. Ripe plum and dark berry, dark chocolate, pepper and plenty of charred oak dominate the nose. The palate dials the richness up another notch, coating the tongue like a wool blanket with more plush fruit and toasty, chewy oak. This is a beast of a wine at the moment and needs a few more years to settle. Drink 2020–2038.

title: CarlindePaolo 2015  Barbaresco
description: Delicate aromas of rose petal, tilled soil and leather emerge from the glass. The round palate offers raspberry jam, licorice and vanilla alongside fine-grained tannins. Drink through 2025.

title: Cascina Rabaglio 2015 Gaia Principe  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with subtle aromas of dark berry, underbrush and botanical herb. The taut palate offers red cherry, white pepper and clove alongside firm acidity and assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Castello d'Alba 2016 Reserva Red (Douro)
description: This stylish wine balances acidity with a firm core of tannins. Its berry fruits and spice from wood aging are now integrated to give a ripe wine that also has a fresh juicy element. Drink the wine from 2019.

title: Castello di Azeglio 2016  Erbaluce di Caluso
description: Delicately alluring aromas of peach blossom, stone fruit and citrus lead the nose. Recalling the aromas, the ripe, rounded palate offers mature yellow apple, candied tangerine zest and pineapple packed in syrup.

title: Château Favray 2017  Pouilly-Fumé
description: The Favray estate is one parcel of 39 acres, producing a taut, mineral and citrus-fruit-driven wine. Still young, his potentially rich wine has intense acidity that needs to soften. Drink from 2019.

title: Claude Baron NV Pierre de Lune Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
description: The luminescence of the moon is reflected in the Baron family's crisp Chardonnay. This taut, dry wine has attractive apple and tight citrus flavors. Its acidity and lively bright texture come together to give a perfumed wine touched by minerality, and ready to drink.
designation: Pierre de Lune Blanc de Blancs Brut

title: Coeur de Terre 2015 Héritage Reserve Pinot Noir (McMinnville)
description: There's a palate-reviving snap to this wine, which opens with ripe, juicy flavors of blackberries. A streak of mocha carries it along, and there's a hint of something akin to eucalyptus as well.

title: Damilano 2014 Cannubi  (Barolo)
description: Aromas of underbrush, exotic spice and dark-skinned fruit mingle with a whiff of camphor. The assertive palate offers dried morello cherry, clove and star anise alongside firm acidity while tightly knit, close-grained tannins leave a somewhat astringent finish. It's still austere and needs time to fully develop. Drink after 2022.

title: Doña Paula 2015 Selección de Bodega Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Blackberry, cassis and licorice aromas are ripe on the nose. Bright acidity creates tension on the palate, while this tastes of berry and cherry flavors offset by lactic oak. On the finish, an oaky vanilla tone wrestles with brisk red-berry acidity.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Finger Lakes)
description: Vibrant aromas of grapefruit spray, papaya and tomato leaf carry to the textured, light-bodied palate. This is immensely crisp and refreshing in feel, with crunchy green pear and citrus ringing on the finish.

title: Fairsing 2016 Fairsing Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: There's a strong citrus component of lemon and grapefruit, underscoring wild blackberry fruit. Barrel aging for 10 months in 30% new French oak adds a streak of roasted coffee through the finish. Balanced and medium bodied, this should drink well into the mid-2020s.

title: Franchetti 2015 Passobianco Chardonnay (Terre Siciliane)
description: Made with 100% Chardonnay, this opens with aromas of orchard fruit, toasted oak and acacia flower. The rich palate offers Golden Delicious apple and lemon alongside a note of bitter almond. Drink through 2022.

title: Marshall Davis 2016 Seven Hills Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (OR))
description: The aromas bring notes of vanilla, coconut, cranberry and wood spice. The palate shows a mixture of fruit and barrel, with the latter generally winning out. The oak is heavy-handed, obscuring the fruit and spice notes of the variety.

title: Member's Mark NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Made by Champagne Montaine, this is a soft wine with a creamy mousse and a relatively high dosage. That gives a rounded character to the wine to go with the white-fruit flavors. It is attractively balanced and ready to drink.

title: Michel Vattan 2017 Rosé (Sancerre)
description: This is a lively, fresh and crisp wine, with both tight acidity and perfumed red fruits. Young, fruity and bright, it is ready to drink.

title: Millbrook 2016 Chardonnay (New York)
description: Fleshy peach and cantaloupe aromas boarder on the overripe spectrum. The palate is creamy in feel, yet balanced by a persistent vein of acidity and soft peach-skin astringency.

title: Milton Park 2016 Shiraz (South Australia)
description: This wine offers lifted plush, plummy fruit, black olive and peppery spice aromas which lead into a medium-bodied, rounded palate that's balanced by savory, tingly acidity. The oak juts out a little towards the finish.

title: Monmousseau NV Brut  (Vouvray)
description: Spicy and with a good mineral streak, this wine also has a creamy character from the mousse and exotic hints of vanilla and hazelnut. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Mount Peak 2015 Rattlesnake Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Cherry-berry flavors are seasoned in pleasing accents of cinnamon and vanilla in this rich, highly ripe wine. The tannins are soft and supple, providing simple support without distraction.

title: :Nota Bene 2015 Stone Tree Vineyard Syrah (Wahluke Slope)
description: Blended with 5% Viognier, which shows itself. Generous aromas of fresh orange peel, flower and boysenberry are followed by ripe, full-bodied fruit flavors. The tannins bring a gritty feel and some bitterness, too, on an otherwise enjoyable offering.

title: Poderi Elia 2011 Serracapelli Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of roasted coffee bean, toasted oak and menthol lead the nose. The dense palate offers prune, mocha and coconut alongside grainy, assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Taft Street 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral muscat-like aromatics persist in this wine. This is a tight, firmly crisp in acidity example of the variety that is integrated and moderately ripe.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2017 Nerello Mascalese (Etna)
description: Aromas of toasted nut and Mediterranean scrub lead the nose. It's very pale, almost amber in colored and a bit evolved, offering suggestions of white peach and citrus zest alongside a hint of tangy acidity. A saline note signals the close.

title: Thomas Schmitt 2017 Estate Bottled Riesling (Mosel)
description: Whiffs of turmeric and cardamom lend an exotic perfume to added tones of waxy grapefruit peel and slate on the nose of this wine. Fresh white-grapefruit and lemon flavors have a delicate tinge of sweetness and crisp acidic balance. Enjoy now.

title: Thompson Estate 2016 Four Chambers Sauvignon Blanc-Semillon (Margaret River)
description: An almost even split of Sauvignon Blanc and Semillon, this wine is dominated by vegetal aromas at first, but peach and melon tones become apparent with time in the glass. The acidity is bright and crunchy, yet balanced by a waxy texture.

title: Trudon NV Emblématis Brut  (Champagne)
description: This is Trudon's entry-level wine, with a nod to the family's historical use of 100% malolactic and reserve wines. Pinot Meunier and Pinot Noir make for an open and very drinkable Champagne. Soft acidity and ripe apple fruits partner with a generous structure and richness. Drink now.

title: Underwood 2017 The Bubbles Sparkling (Oregon)
description: From the Union Wine Company, this value bubbly is 62% Pinot Noir and 38% Chardonnay. It's fresh, crisp and clean, with notes of apple, melon and citrus. It comes in full-size, crown-capped wine bottles and 375 ml cans.

title: Icardi 2015 Starderi  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with subdued aromas suggesting cedar and green peppercorn. The dense palate offers vanilla, espresso and mature plum alongside close-grained tannins that leave a rather astringent finish.

title: Abad Dom Bueno 2016 Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Straightforward berry and plum aromas are a bit smoky. A grapy palate is saturated and full of fruit, but also grabby, tannic and hard. Cherry and plum flavors are bold and lightly toasted, while this Mencía is racy and aggressive on the finish.

title: Allegretto 2014 Ayres Family Reserve Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Dark boysenberry aromas meet with peppery spice and herbs on the tangy nose of this bottling. The palate shows a bit of balsamic sourness, with hints of boysenberry and blackberry fruit.

title: Barfontarc NV Blanc de Noirs Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: This is a young wine, still crisp and with hints of tannins that need to soften. It is full, ripe and spicy, with hints of red-currant flavors. The bottling needs to age; drink from 2019.

title: Barrelhouse 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is well made in a soft supple style that highlights mild lemon and apple flavors and light buttery vanillin accents. Medium body and soft acidity keep it easy in texture, and although it was aged in Bourbon barrels for three months, luckily there is very little Bourbon taste.

title: Gómez de Segura 2013 Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Saucy berry aromas include screaming oak notes, while this is smacking, tannic and full on the palate. Plum and berry fruit flavors are fully oaked, while this feels tight and drawing on the finish.

title: Hugl-Wimmer NV Rosé Secco Sparkling (Österreichischer Perlwein)
description: The pale pink hue and fresh notes of red apple continue to fizz on the light, dry, easy palate. This is very refreshing, dry and easy and an ideal drink for a summer crowd. Drink soon.

title: J. & P. Matheus 2016 Piesporter Michelsberg Riesling (Mosel)
description: Medium sweet in style, this is a refreshing, light-bodied wine with hints of ripe yellow plum and crushed mineral on the nose. Flavors of banana peel and white peach lend a creaminess to the midpalate. The finish is balanced crisply by acidity.

title: Jean Duclert NV Brut  (Champagne)
description: Dominated by Pinot Meunier, this soft, ripe nonvintage cuvée is immediately attractive. It has crisp apples, lively bright acidity and a tight, mineral-textured aftertaste. Drink this wine now.

title: Jean Duclert NV Brut Rosé  (Champagne)
description: Based in the Marne Valley, this brand, owned by the Baron family, offers a range of soft, ripe and fruity wines. Full of red fruits with an attractive touch of minerality, this Champagne is crisp and taut while never forgetting the freshness of the Pinot Meunier in the blend. Drink now.

title: Jean Laurent 2008 Rosé Millésime Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne)
description: A small-production wine, this is dark rosé in color, with a touch of tannin from the pure Pinot Noir. Rich and now mature, with hints of acidity, it is ready to drink.

title: Jessie's Grove 2017 Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Dry Rosé of Carignane (Lodi)
description: This is a very good dry wine that's quite fresh, well balanced and thirst quenching. Raspberry and watermelon flavors are buoyed by good fruit acidity for a tangy mouthfeel.
designation: Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Dry Rosé of

title: Joseph Mellot 2016 Le Rabault  (Sancerre)
description: This smooth and sophisticated wine offers attractive red-berry fruits and crisp acidity. It is lightly structured, layering smoky tannins over the mineral texture and crisp aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

title: Kokomo 2016 Pauline's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Velvety thick and pleasantly concentrated, this is a burly, big-boned and richly defined wine. It's also a celebration of blackberry jam that's accented in smoke and leather.

title: La Crema 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a great value for a wine of esteemed provenance. It is tannic and savory with a delicately fruity profile of citrus, black tea and rose. Balanced, it shows varietal character for a fair price.

title: La Ganghija 2015 Giacosa  (Barbaresco)
description: This offers subtle aromas of cedar, tobacco and dark-skinned fruit. The solid palate evokes dried cherry, licorice and clove alongside assertive tannins. Drink after 2021.

title: Mahoney 2016 Gavin Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Heady in vanilla brioche and sugary aromas, this wine has a steely midpalate that takes on a lushness toward the finish, a mix of baked apple and sweet cinnamon.

title: Meiomi 2017 Rosé (California)
description: Flavors like canteloupe and a full body to carry them make this a full-flavored and mouth-filling wine. It has a feeling of richness and weight on the palate that will pair nicely with bold foods like pulled pork and Thai barbecue.

title: Oso Libre 2013 Querida Red (Adelaida District)
description: This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon and 50% Merlot offers aromas of blackberry, purple flowers and a fig balsamic glaze on the nose. The palate is extremely tangy, offering fresh flavors of blackberry and peppery spice.

title: Panther Creek 2016 Schindler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Given its youth, it's not at all surprising that this wine is still pulling itself together. There are streams of tart citrus, wild berry, tobacco and earth, all flowing in the right direction but not yet coalesced into a seamless whole. Barrel aging for 17 months in half new French oak brings a touch of vanilla to the finish.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Basic Black Red (Sonoma County-Napa County)
description: The majority of the fruit for this wine comes from Sonoma County (59%), the rest from Napa Valley, the whole made from cofermented Grenache, Early Burgundy, Tempranillo, Syrah, Carignan and Zinfandel. Together they offer a touch of reduction, black fruit and leather around dried herb and cedar notes.

title: San Silvestro 2015 Magno  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of red berry, forest floor and baking spice take shape in the glass. The firm palate offers sour cherry, clove and white pepper alongside solid, youthfully assertive tannins. Drink after 2022.

title: Sanguinhal 2015 Touriga Nacional (Lisboa)
description: Aged for 12 months in wood, this wine is perfumed, ripe and just moving from firm tannins to a more open character. Its structure is still there as is plenty of crisp acidity. The result is wine that is cool, focusing on freshness as well as richness. Drink now.

title: Serafino 2013 Sharktooth Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: There's a fair amount of bright plummy fruit, mint chocolate and dried green herbs in this wine. The full body comes with tight, savory tannins and a warm, oaky finish.

title: Serge Dagueneau et Filles 2017 Tradition  (Pouilly-Fumé)
description: Based in the small village of Les Berthiers, this wine family has produced a classic wine. It has acidity, with a tense and mineral texture that's balanced with bright white fruits and citrus. Drink now.

title: Lingua Franca 2016 Hope Well Vineyard Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills)
description: Mimi Casteel tends this vineyard, and this young, still-unevolved wine needs more time to fully blossom. It hews closely to the emerging Lingua Franca style—not quite austere, but focused, tart and juicy, with just-ripe-enough flavors of cranberry and raspberry front and center. This should continue to improve over the next eight to 10 years, so tuck it away until 2020.

title: Lük 2016 Serra Vineyard Own Rooted Cabernet Sauvignon (Applegate Valley)
description: This robust and fragrant Cabernet is bolstered by 6% Malbec. It's a potent wine that displays rich flavors of black fruits, coffee and cacao. The tannins resolve on the finish, with a drying sensation of black tea.

title: Maison Roy 2015 Incline Pinot Noir (Yamhill-Carlton)
description: This winery is the project of second generation Beaux Frères founders Jared Etzel and Marc-André Roy. Aromatic and well integrated, this cuvée has fruit flavors of tart strawberry preserves, underscored with streaks of earth, herb and cola. The tannins are ripe enough, though still a bit chewy. A couple of more years of bottle aging is recommended.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This Santa Cruz Mountains-based winery has been making a value-driven Edna Valley Chardonnay since 1985, and this one does not disappoint, Pungent aromas of lemon oil and orange pith are rounded by seared white peach, crushed sand and smoke on the nose, while the zesty palate delivers more stone fruit, bright lemon, toasty oak and solid tannic tension.

title: Pflüger 2017 Quarzit Trocken Weissburgunder (Pfalz)
description: While the nose is closed, suggesting crushed mineral and hints of spice, the palate offers more expressive tones of lemon, white grapefruit and bitters. This is a dry, medium-bodied wine, with penetrating lemon-lime acidity and lingering juiciness of citrus on finish.

title: Philippe Fontaine 2014 Cuvée des Lys Brut Blanc de Blancs Pinot Blanc (Champagne)
description: Pinot Blanc finds a home in the Côte des Bar region of the Aube. In this expression it shows a beautiful character, ripe, tender and very open. Warm white and yellow fruits shine this well-balanced, ready-to-drink wine.
designation: Cuvée des Lys Brut Blanc de Blancs

title: Pietradolce 2015 Rosso Barbagalli  (Etna)
description: Made with old, pre-phylloxera Nerello Mascalese vines, this opens with earthy aromas of wild berry, blue flower, crushed stone, leather and just a whiff of barnyard. The full-bodied palate doles out Marasca cherry soaked in spirits, star anise, white pepper and a hint of game alongside fine-grained tannins. A salty mineral note marks the close.

title: Poças 2008 Colheita  (Port)
description: The wood-aged wine has retained its fruit in the manner of a 10-year-old tawny. While there are plenty of rich red fruits, there is also the layer of wood-aging toast and spice to give the wine an extra dimension. Like all tawnies, this wine is ready to drink.

title: Point Ormond 2015 Marsanne-Roussanne (Upper Goulburn)
description: This wine offers heady aromas of marzipan, bruised apple, white pepper and a hint of caramel. More mineral than fruit driven on the palate, it's less viscous in texture than you'd expect. Instead, it feels fairly taut and stony, with a long, tangy finish and a copper penny-like acidity.

title: Portal del Priorat 2015 Tros de Clos Carignan (Priorat)
description: Earthy blackberry aromas include a gaseous note as well as hints of black olive and spice cake. While big as an ox, this varietal Carignan is also bumpy and incongruous on the palate. Sappy black-plum and berry flavors include vanilla and lemony oak notes in front of a drawing finish with savory tobacco accents. Drink this warm-vintage Priorat red through 2022.

title: Quinta S. Joao Batista 2015 Touriga Franca-Alicante Bouschet Reserva Red (Tejo)
description: The rich dark color of Alicante Bouschet shows strongly in this wine. The grape adds to the density of the more subtle Touriga Franca to give a ripe juicy wine, full of black fruits and generous tannins. The wine will be ready from 2020.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Lone Oak Vineyard Partners' Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Shy at first on the nose, this wine begins to show pithy aromas of tangerine alongside gardenia and a touch of sour cream. The palate is texturally driven with grippy tension that leads into more orange-pith and pink-grapefruit flavors, finishing on an ashy Brie-rind quality.

title: Sparkman 2016 Wonderland Grenache (Yakima Valley)
description: A blend of fruit from Boushey, Olsen and Sagemoor vineyards. The aromas pop, with appealing notes of raspberry, smoked meat, herb, white pepper, potpourri and mountain blueberry. Textured, swoon-worthy blue fruit and savory flavors follow and persist through the lingering finish. It's a thoroughly captivating wine, with a lovely sense of freshness.

title: Tenuta di Fessina 2016 Erse Bianco  (Etna)
description: Delicate scents of pear, Spanish broom and wild herb form the bouquet of this elegant, almost ethereal white. It's fresh, linear and loaded with finesse, offering juicy citrus, Rennet apple and a hint of pistachio alongside a tangy saline note.

title: Toil Oregon 2016 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: Leonetti Cellar/Figgins/Toil winemaker Chris Figgins jumps into Chardonnay for the first time with grapes from McMinnville's Dupee vineyard. Juicy fruit flavors of pear and peach, along with a light touch (20%) of new oak, make for a full, firm, well-balanced young wine with years of life ahead.

title: Wechsler 2017 Trocken Weisser Burgunder (Rheinhessen)
description: Whiffs of spice, tangerine and dusty mineral collide on the nose of this dry, full-bodied Pinot Blanc. The palate bursts with racy white grapefruit and lemon flavors offset by a lusciously rich mouthfeel. It's a satisfying, textural wine with a long, lingering finish.

title: WildAire 2017 Stater Vineyard Pinot Blanc (Dundee Hills)
description: Matthew Driscoll's wines hit a consistently high standard, and this young Pinot Blanc deftly mixes several emerging trends in Oregon: whole cluster pressing, native yeasts and light exposure to all- (or mostly) neutral oak. Apple, peach and pear flavors come with a touch of cinnamon, and the sur lie aging adds a crunchy/creamy texture throughout.

title: Abacela 2015 Malbec (Umpqua Valley)
description: Abacela's reds are dark, bold and tannic, but the estate-grown fruit is up to the challenge of the extended barrel aging. Bourbon tea aromas introduce this pure Malbec, which does a vertical dive into deep black cherry and cassis fruit. A spine of iron and finishing touches of licorice and espresso contribute to a powerful, tannic finish.

title: Alexana 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: Fermented in neutral oak, this retains lovely floral aromas and flavor notes of roses and orange blossoms. They introduce a robust mix of peach, apricot and cantaloupe fruit. The lingering finish may call to mind the last lick of an orange creamsicle.

title: Anzivino 2012  Gattinara
description: Made wholly with Nebbiolo, this opens with earthy aromas of crushed herb, star anise, menthol and woodland berry. Reflecting the nose, the linear palate delivers dried Marasca cherry, cranberry and clove framed in taut refined tannins. Fresh acidity lends balance while it closes on an iron note.
